name: Fields of Arle: New Travel Destination – Oldenburg
description: Feuerland started a set of new travel destinations. You can get them in the towns printed on the travel destination.
categories: Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Farming, Industry / Manufacturing
mechanics: Worker Placement

name: The Rise of Blitzkrieg: The Fall of France, 1940
description:
On May 10, 1940, the German Army Groups A and B began their invasion of Belgium and the Netherlands. The Allies, who determined this to be an offensive based on the Schlieffen Plan, set up as planned a line of defense along the Dyle river in Belgium. However, the German main force, the Army Group A's armored forces, broke through the Ardennes forest, contrary to the Allies' expectations, and advanced behind the Allied forces and advanced quickly in Northern France towards the English Channel.

The Rise of Blitzkrieg simulates the Fall of France. One player is the German, the other the Allies, and the game starts with operations plans. Can the German player trap the Allied player who knows the historical facts? Can the Allied player use its military strength to stop the German invasion? This game challenges the players' operational skills.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Simulation

name: Horizon Wars: Zero Dark
description: Horizon Wars: Zero Dark is a science-fiction skirmish-level tabletop miniatures wargame. It allows for solitaire, co-operative, and competitive versus play. Players create a team of operatives, customizing both their statistics and their upgrades (ranging from leadership ability and medical skills to advanced weaponry and other high-tech gadgets). The adversary, the Red Force, is controlled through an AI and a standard deck of playing cards. Scenarios are objective-based and range from one-off encounters to narrative campaigns, complete with character progression.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Solo / Solitaire Game, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Shadows of Brimstone: Wasteland Warmasters Enemy Supplement #1
description:
The Wasteland Scavengers are a motley crew of criminals, cutthroats, and raiders! Brutal warriors led by powerful Warlords that don’t just want to survive in the barren and lawless wastes, but rather to thrive there! Some Warlords gain a fearsome reputation and high level of infamy from their savage exploits. These most feared Warlords are known as Wasteland Warmasters!

This set adds new large Enemy Record Sheets for 2 of the dangerous Wasteland Warmasters –Tar'Rio Gant and Celarrius Drakoth, making them full Enemy mini-bosses. It also includes new Wasteland-themed Artifact cards, as well as a set of new Threat cards that combine various Blasted Wastes themed Enemies together, and even Epic Threats to face off against a more dangerous version of each of these Wasteland Warmasters with their Scavenger crew.

This game supplement enhances the Blasted Wastes OtherWorld Expansion as well as the Resin Enemy Figures for Tar'Rio Gant and Celarrius Drakoth. That OtherWorld Expansion and those resin Miniatures are NOT INCLUDED.
categories: Adventure, American West, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Horror, Miniatures, Science Fiction
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Role Playing

name: Infinity Defiance: Megalodron
description: The Megalodron expansion adds the massive Megalodron enemy to Infinity Defiance. Included in the box are the Megalodron PVC miniature, 1 Megalodron enemy card, 4 Megalodron initiative cards, and an alternative final mission for the Core set, mission 13.
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling

name: Blood Red Skies: Battle Of Midway
description:
Blood Red Skies is a tabletop miniatures game in which you take command of a force of fighter aircraft in battle. The emphasis in Blood Red Skies is on controlling a large number of planes at once. Action in the game is fast-paced, with no pre-plotting or book-keeping required. A smallish game of Blood Red Skies, with six planes per side, can be fought in forty-five minutes or less.

A force is comprised of iconic World War 2 fighter aircraft using the dynamic ‘Advantage’ system. Opposing pilots can also use card-based aircraft traits, doctrines, Ace skills and theatre rules to make the most of their planes and fighting environment.

The Battle of Midway starter set contains everything you need to get playing, including rules, tokens, dice, game cards, and crucially 12 highly detailed Warlord Resin aircraft with which to battle.

The Grumman F4F Wildcat When the US Navy and Marine Corps entered the Second World War, they had only one effective fighter aircraft available to them: the F4F Wildcat. Fortunately, the Wildcat proved more than equal to the task of holding the line.

The Mitsubishi A6M2 ‘Zero’ The Mitsubishi A6M Zero was a fast, modern fighter, but had no armour for the pilot. When the Zero (derived from the Japanese name Reisen - meaning Zero Fighter) was in the hands of aggressive and well-trained pilots this weakness was rarely apparent.

The US aircraft are provided in blue-coloured resin and the Japanese in white/cream, making your squadrons easily distinguishable and able to launch into furious tabletop dogfights even before you touch paint to model.

–description from the publisher
categories: Aviation / Flight, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Змеи и лестницы: Бродилка (Snakes and Ladders: Adventure)
description:
In the far, far jungle... a very unusual and extremely rare crunchfruit grows. The animals decide to hold a race: the winner will get the mysterious fruit. They collect various equipment in the jungle, scattered by unfortunate seekers, and gather at the start. During this dynamic and fun race, the participants will have to create the board themselves! Players roll the dice, move their characters around the field, mark successes on the tablets and interfere with rivals in every possible way. Make your way with ladders, trap opponents with vines, scare away snakes to avoid rolling down them, arm yourself with scissors to deal with vines. Let the race begin!

—description from the publisher (translated)
mechanics: Unspecified

name: War Chest: Tournament Kit
description:
The War Chest tournament kit comes with a set of rules for running different styles of tournaments, as well as as series of new royal coins, control markers, seals, and an initiative marker, as prizes for players to customize their game. These can be used as an alternative to the base game components, and depict the Bear and Stag factions. Gold and silver colored versions of the coins allow players to secure bragging rights based on their finishing position!

—description from publisher
categories: Abstract Strategy, Expansion for Base-game, Wargame
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Variable Player Powers
publishers: Alderac Entertainment Group, MTS Games, Popcorn Games

name: Black Rose Wars: Duel – Lex: Prismatic Cage Preorder Promo
description:
This spell (foil version) was a promo for preordering Black Rose Wars: Duel - Lex. It can be used in every Black Rose War game.

Prismatic Cage
Forgotten Spell

In this round each time the target activate a Spell choose an effect:

Inflict 3 damage on the target
Convert 3 damage on the target
Place 2 room damage in the room of the target
Inflict 2 damage on another target in the same room as the target
Place the target in your room and inflict 1 damage to the target
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Renaissance
mechanics: Action Queue, Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Yatai
description:
Players will be busy running a Japanese street food stall. Thanks to a 3x2 grid system, it will be possible to choose which types of action to carry out in one's turn between adding customers, cooking food, stocking the fridge with drinks, serving dishes, and recycling empty bottles. All with a queue management mechanism that will require you to coordinate your choices well to best satisfy customers. During the game, it will be possible to develop your own Yatai, add cooking plates, enlarge the refrigerator, or learn to cook new dishes and improve customer reviews.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Drafting, Chaining, Resource Queue

name: Iron Lady's Fleet: The Falklands War
description:
"Iron Lady’s Fleet” is a game of naval warfare taking place in South-Atlantic during the Falklands Wars in 1982.
Time Scale :
- 8 hours per turn
- 80 km per hex.

The players maneuver war ships, submarines, aircrafts, amphibious war ships and cargos on a map covering.

The game reuse rules from Victory Games Fleet series, but includes new weapons as missiles, ground launched ballistic missiles, SAM, cruise missiles
There are also new rules regarding submarines, Aegis ships, anti-missile defence systems, long range air-to-air missile,

More Information:

The game includes 5 scénarios, from very simple to more complex ones :
1/ Bluff Cove Black Death
2/ Lost Cruiser
3/ Strike San Carlos
4/ Like Churchill's her fought
5/ Galtieri's Backhand Blow
categories: Aviation / Flight, Modern Warfare, Nautical, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Movement Points, Simulation

name: Flying Saucers
description:
Flying saucers game has an interesting introductory story. Somewhere in space four civilizations fight for resources.

Figurines represent different categories of flying saucers, which differ in speed, size and power. Flying saucers destroy enemy saucers by stopping next to it. Flying saucer with more power, or joined multiple saucers can destroy enemy flying saucer. The goal of the game is to destroy the main enemy flying saucer.

The game can be played with dice or without it.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement

name: Battle of Sekigahara Game
description:
The Battle of Sekigahara is a 1-2 player tactical war game covering the epic Japanese battle in 1600. Two warring factions, one from the East and one from the West, have their sights on becoming the ultimate empire. The fate of Japan rests in your hands...

October 21, 1600 - The fate of Japan hangs in the balance. The country is split into two factions each of which has gathered a large army. Osaka Castle has been captured and forces under Ieyasu Tokugawa have moved south to finish the war. Ishida Mitsunari has an army waiting to entrap the Ieyasu's forces referred to as the Eastern Army. Ishida's Western Army awaits though treachery is in the wind. The stage is set.

The Battle of Sekigahara is a low to moderate complexity tactical game covering the epic Japanese battle in 1600 during the Sengoku period. The game takes about 90 minutes to play. One player commands the Western Army under Ishida Mitsunari and the other player commands the Eastern Army under Tokugawa Ieyasu. Cards vary game play.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Hexagon Grid, Simulation

name: Quando for grande QUERO SER…
description:
“When I grow up, I want to be…” This has been said, is said and will be said by children everywhere. There is a time when a child starts to discover the various professions and by the influence of a familiar or by the influence of some book or movie, she will identify herself with some kind of activity that she wants to do when she grows up.

Quando for grande QUERO SER… is a board game for 2 to 5 players, with ages of 5 and up. For this game 10 professions where chosen, those usually chosen by kids when completing the phrase. Those professions are: a Pilot, a Fireman, a Chef, a Police Officer, an Astronaut, an Engineer, a Mechanic, a Doctor, a Soldier and a Farmer. Some are represented by a female drawing and others by a male drawing.

The object of the game is to put together the various profession drawings that are composed of 3 parts: Head, torso and feet. The players need to have skill, attention and a bit of luck in order to gather on the board the three parts that are needed to complete each profession drawing. Besides the different drawings, the background color for each profession is also different in order to help the younger players to identify each of the parts for each of the professions so they can easily put together the complete set.
The winner will be the one who can complete the most profession drawings.
mechanics: Hand Management, Set Collection, Tile Placement

name: Stalingrad Roads: Battle on the Edge of the Abyss
description:
Stalingrad Roads is a wargame for 2 players covering the 1942-43 winter campaign on the Soviet South Front. The game begins with the outbreak of the Uranus offensive in late November 1942 and ends with Manstein's counter-attack in March 1943.
The game is aligned with the 'Roads' series, which features the titles Liberty Roads and Victory Roads (published by Hexasim). The system will be familiar to players who have enjoyed the first two games, but it has been adapted to take into account all the specifics of the campaign (the supply of the Stalingrad pocket, management of the Stavka,...).

Offensive Roads: Stalingrad has four scenarios.

Edge of the Abyss: 17 turns. The full campaign.
Wintergewitter: this small two-turn scenario is ideal for getting started with the system, but is also a challenge for both players.
Manstein's Backhand Blow: a short but intense scenario to maneuver the elite German armored forces and save a desperate situation.
Star and Gallop : Starting in February 1943, this scenario shows the end of the campaign from the surrender of the 6th Army. A real game within the game, it allows players to discover these very little simulated offensives and opens up a situation rich in opportunities for the Soviet player.


—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Ratio / Combat Results Table, Simulation, Zone of Control

name: Lock 'n Load Tactical: A Feat of Arms
description:
"Defeat? I do not recognize the meaning of the word." – Margaret Thatcher April 1982, start of the Falklands War

In April of 1982, Argentina invaded the British sovereign territory of the Falkland Islands, in the South Atlantic. The Argentines had long claimed ownership of the islands, which they called Islas Malvinas. The unforeseen attack and occupation sparked international outrage, and Great Britain quickly mobilized a naval task force to retake the islands, 8,000 miles from home. Relying on the élan of their professional and highly trained military personnel, the combined air, sea and land forces succeeded against the odds, victorious less than 80 days from the Argentine seizure of the islands. For the British, it was no less than a spectacular feat of arms.

A Feat of Arms is an expansion module for Lock ’n Load Tactical: Heroes of the Falklands. Play 12 scenarios on six new X-Maps, including a new Port Stanley Map for a revised take on Operation Rosario, the initial Argentine invasion. Other new terrain includes rugged hills—for new battles on Mt. Harriet, Wireless Ridge and Sapper Hill—and a grass airfield, for the SAS’s audacious raid on Pebble Island and the ferocious final action of the Battle of Goose Green. Across the islands, the bold British Paras and Royal Marines fought well-armed Argentine Army conscripts and Marines defending vital terrain and counterattacking upon lost ground. The conditions were harsh, with most of the fighting done at night, among minefields and under heavy mortar and artillery fire.

The Falklands War was a test of mettle. Are you up to the test?

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Marvel: Crisis Protocol – She-Hulk
description:
Jennifer Walters is the cousin of Bruce Banner, the Hulk. After an attempt on her life left her in critical condition, a blood transfusion from Banner infused her with gamma irradiation and transformed her into the savage and sensational She-Hulk.

While she gained much of the superhuman strength of the Hulk, Walters retains her sharp wit and honed sense of justice when she transforms, becoming a less inhibited version of herself. She rarely sees the need to return to her original self, preferring instead to fight crime with her immense strength and durability.

Contents:
1 Miniature
‣ 1 She-Hulk
1 Bases
1 Character Stat Card
4 Team Tactic Cards
1 Affiliation Card
11 Tokens
mechanics: Dice Rolling

name: The Communication in Catan
description:
A promotional version of the original Settlers game. Produced by Kosmos for the French telecom company Alcatel.
It's the same game but with a telecom theme. The traditional resources are replaced by:
telephone, cable tv, internet, mobile phone and multimedia.
The longest road becomes the longest fiber line and the robber becomes Government regulation! The land types become: rural, residential, metropolitan, industrial and high tech.

From the back of the box...
"Imagine you'll find an isle like Catan settled and populated.The settlers did a very good job during the passed years and Catan became a prosper and very nice isle.All the people living in Catan are very happy to be there. But - there is one thing they heard about, what they actually miss - Communication!
They read in newspapers from telephones and heard about the fabulous possibilities of the internet. All these things the people of Catan are missing so far.
Imagine you are a well experienced provider for telecommunication services. Yopu will immediately start to build a communication network, that is future proof and fulfills the needs of the people living in Catan. With the new Optinex (TM) technology you create a complete network optimized for the special needs of the people in Catan.
Will you be the winner in the competition with the other players in the game?
Who knows? - But you can do a lot to improve your position by trading with other people, finding strategic alliances or simply by being lucky. It is more than a game, it is a challenge for you, as it is your daily business to work with communications.
Become the biggest telecommunication provider in Catan with an evolving network and a clear focus for the future. Dominate the communication in Catan.
On behalf of Alcatel we wish you good luck!"

Belongs to the Catan Series.
mechanics: Modular Board, Trading

name: Hellfire
description:
From the publisher:

Written by Jim Webster, Hellfire is a unique set of 6mm SF wargames rules. Generic in nature, Hellfire differs from other products in this field in that it is scenario driven rather than points based - the emphasis being on putting the fun back into gaming.

A very comprehensive set of rules, Hellfire allow you to play the game you want to play, in the setting you want to play it in. by covering a wide range of possibilities from troop reactions at night and nuclear warfare to psionics and machine intelligence.

The ground breaking reaction system that governs exactly how your troops behave on the battlefield accurately simulates how prolonged exposure to combat saps at even the best of troops emotional resilience and reflects the grind of real war. Additionally the system allows you to have aliens and androids that act in an un-human fashion and not as men in rubber suits or tin cladding.

The rulebook also contains four diverse scenarios illustrating the flexibility of the system and appendices on models and figure availability for the game, and SF combat literature as a source of scenario ideas.
mechanics: Dice Rolling

name: The War Game
description:
Charles Grant's The War Game is a classic set of rules for "old school" miniature wargaming. The rules first appeared as a series of articles in Tradition magazine, a UK production aimed at painters of miniature soldiers. The published version is a 191-page hardcover book.

The era covered by the rules is vaguely the Seven Years War, generally known as the "Horse and Musket" era. One interesting feature of the game is that rather than strictly portray the historical era, The War Game invites creating fictional armies of the period so players can give their own grandiloquent names to their units and paint them using their own uniform designs.

The scales used for the game are pretty fuzzy. The miniatures are used singly, i.e., not mounted in multiples on a base as in most miniature wargames. An infantry brigade of two regiments is roughly 100 single figures. Maneuvering your units can be tedious, but it's easy to adopt any formation.

The War Game not only provides a set of rules, but each chapter provides a great deal of philosophy behind the rule with the actual game mechanics stated simply at the end. For example, the actual rules for moving infantry are very simple, but Grant takes four pages, with a lot of reasoning and reference to historical sources, to come to them.

The War Game is far from concise. However, it's not just a set of rules, it's a great read from one of miniature wargaming's founders.
categories: Age of Reason, Book, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Simulation

name: Irensei
description:
Irensei is a mixture of Go and Gomoku played on a Go Board (19x19). Players win the game by getting seven stones in a row of their color. In addition, they may capture and eliminate enemy stones in the same way that is done in Go.


The winning condition is to have seven in a row, vertically, diagonally, or horizontally, if and only if all these stones are inside the central 15x15 square. i.e. not on the two lines from the edge of the board.
For balancing purposes however, Black, the first player, loses when he makes eight in a row or more.
The capture, Ko, and no-suicide rules from Go apply.
There is an exception to the no-suicide rule: if a stone placed in a suicide position completes a seven-in-a-row, then it is a win.
mechanics: Enclosure, Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition

name: Legends and Lies: The Skeptic
description:
Legends and Lies: Skeptic is an expansion for the Legends and Lies card game for 3 or 4 players. It adds an alternative to the normal partnership four player version of the game and adds the new role of the Skeptic.

Each player has a turn as the Skeptic and when filling that role they are no longer concerned with proving the existence of various cyrptozoological creatures, but have the sole purpose of debunking the other players' claims. This is done by playing Expedition cards sideways in front of them which count against proving that creature. The Skeptic also has the ability to discard a card to the Tabloids before they draw or put another way, they can plant an extra disparaging story every turn. At the end of a hand, the Skeptic's score is doubled if they are able to prevent all the cryptozoologists from having a successful expedition.
mechanics: Variable Player Powers

name: Beyond the Gates of Antares: Strike on Kar'a Nine
description:
Strike on Kar’A Nine is a new introductory set for Beyond the Gates of Antares containing forces for both the Algoryn and the Concord, with dice, rules and templates plus a fold-out battle mat and cut-out terrain – everything you need to get started with the game.

Thanks to the order dice draw system, every battle is a tense affair with both players constantly being involved in the action. Both epic defeats and narrow victories will be enjoyable when you venture Beyond the Gates of Antares. Prepare yourself for an exhilarating adventure!

The full colour Getting Started book is designed to coach you through, making your first steps as exciting and as simple as possible, with a series of scenarios that gradually introduce the mechanics of the game. Each scenario introduces new rules, culminating in a final battle using everything in the box where you will be able to use all you have learnt.
mechanics: Action Points, Chit-Pull System, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: The Last Mechs
description:
Background:
War started in the year 2200, it was inevitable... metal combined with technology had turned into humanity’s worst enemy.
In the present day some cities still survive, protected by huge metallic walls, labyrinths and gates to prepare a first line of defense before any threats reach the inner parts of the city.
Build and pilot your Mech armor, it’s the only thing you can really trust to stay alive when venturing into the dangerous wasteland.
Money is worthless nowadays, but search the wasteland for scrap metal, cables, and electronics, you may even find weapons and lost tech from the Mech Wars. Whatever you find in the wasteland can be used to upgrade your weapons and armor, or as currency in the cities.
Pirates, mercenaries and psychos attack the cities in an attempt to conquer them, to loot and steal as much scrap metal and technology as possibly can.
Intro:
The Last Mechs is a cooperative exploration game for 1 to 4 players, a dungeon crawler set in a post-apocalyptic future. Includes a campaign mode that will guide you through the adventure with a comic book illustrated by David Daza.
Aside from the campaign, every hero will have their own short comic that narrates their personal stories, which you can unveil by searching for clues in the cities.
With highly detailed pre-assembled miniatures ready to play.
You can choose from 4 different heroes: Paul “The Legend” a former army man turned mercenary, Karl the mechanic with his D-Sherpa droid always by his side, Lorna and her large modified cargo Mech, and Gork the smuggler.
The Last Mechs includes some RPG elements, since the heroes attributes include Mech piloting, repairing, exploring, and communications, and they can learn new skills by spending experience points.
There are different phases in TLM:
A travel phase, when one of the heroes must guide the group while trying to avoid the grave dangers that plague the wasteland.
A search phase when you may look for scrap, electronics and cables (the most valued resources), or even find standard or lost tech weapons and armor that you can repair. Additionally, different adventures and events unrelated to the campaign may trigger during your journey.
By the end of the travel phase, if you haven’t reached a city, you must set camp on the dangerous wasteland and take shifts to guard the camp.
During the guard phase, the heroes will decide how to split the guard rounds and will solve events in the dark of the wasteland. Also, the mechanic can repair the Mechs and the droid can build ammunitions.
Your party will earn fame the longer you stay in the wasteland, which will give you benefits in the cities, but the danger levels will increase the longer you venture into the wasteland, making it harder for your team to survive.
The few cities that still stand have metallic labyrinths that protect them from enemies, which you must pass through to access the cities.
In the cities you will have access to: (depending on the city)
1- Canteen: Find clues about your story and rumors.
2- Doctor: Heal your heroes.
3- Mech garage: Repair and upgrade your Mechs and equipment.
4- Tattoo parlor: To get temporary boosts for your skills.
5-Supplies: Purchase weapons and ammo.

Kickstarter Prelaunch:
https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/juegorama/last-mechs?re...

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Points, Action Queue, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Role Playing, Variable Player Powers

name: Alien vs Predator: Alien Stalkers
description:
Different kind of animal, the fastest one of the brood.
—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Modular Board, Player Elimination, Role Playing, Secret Unit Deployment, Variable Player Powers

name: Sea of Nadia
description:
Sea of Nadia is a board game about hunting treasures around the Sea of Nadia.

You will dive into a fantasy land of 17th century where treasures are all over the islands of the Sea of Nadia. And you will take a role of one of 4 captains - a rich but still crazy about gold merchant Sam Bellamy, a brave lady Charlotte de Berry famous for her unpredictability, strong and explosive pirate Bartholomew Roberts, and sneaky bastard brought up by pirates Jean-David Nau.

You will take control of a captain and travel on a ship around the map, collect resources, open chests full of treasures, gain captain powers, get best merchant offers, cooperate with others to stop the most rich ones or maybe trick other hunters by messing their plans or even steal their keys or treasures and many more!

To open chests you will need specific combinations of resources so the more luxurious is the chest - the more difficult it is to collect required keys and the more points you get.

To improve your abilities and get great one time deals, you will be able to buy cards which give you permanent or temporary effects.

But be careful and look at the compasses, as they will show you what is happening in the sea and will affect all of the players!

There's also a fun choice for the Admirals of each round, where they will roll dice and assign them to each captain including themselves!

If this sounds like something you're into, let's sail with us the SEA OF NADIA!

- description from the designer, Alex Maklai
categories: Adventure, Collectible Components, Dice, Fantasy, Nautical, Pirates, Transportation, Travel
mechanics: Action Points, Action Queue, Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Pick-up and Deliver, Set Collection, Variable Player Powers

name: Intellector
description:
Intellector - chess XXI century

It is similar in many respects to the ancient "game of Zion." But Intellector more than classical chess - is a completely new abstract puzzle game:

Each of the pieces has a move that is much like pieces in chess, in terms of the 'feel' of the game, but with the hexagon board it will offer unique features to explore.

The game is played on a hex board of 59 spaces.

The goal of the game is to capture the Intellector pieces, again think of it as the king piece.

Agressor - first striker; can be moved only in the dark hexagon located on a straight line connecting the vertices (corners) of dark hexagons.

Progressor - moving forward;walks straight ahead (through the line) to an adjacent hexagon, that is, only those of the hexagons, which are closer to the "baseline" of the enemy in relation to the hexagon in which it is located.

The Liberator - goes through one of the hexagons, which adjoins the faces of its hex

Defenssor - defender; goes to any of the adjacent hexagons, which adjoins the faces of its hex.

Dominator - can be moved to any of the hexagons located in the direction of forming a series of hexagons contiguous faces.
Intellector - smart, literally from the Latin word "understanding." It goes on any neighboring hexagon, which is in contact with the face through the hexagon, in which it is located
mechanics: Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid

name: ビストロ・フリップ (Bistro Flip)
description:
ビストロ・フリップ (Bistro Flip: A Dinner by Heaven Sent Chefs) is a Japanese card game.

“Ding ding!” Ring the bell, and call out “ORDER PLEASE!” and let the game begin!
Select and match up the ingredients. Add in your own personal touch.... Cook it up and hope for the best.... FLIP!
What fun and unique dish did you make? Was it what you were hoping for?
Create interesting and original dishes and have a belly laugh at what comes up! A fun, lively party game.

Chef players must create 3 meals to suit the requirements of the Diner player.
The person at the end of the rounds with the most points is the winner.

HOW TO PLAY:
The Diner player requests a meal.
Ingredients are drafted, so Chef players should pick wisely as you may end up with ingredients that may not work.
Additional randomized Chef's Style cards are dealt to each player.
Chef players plan their meals, once the Diner calls "TIME!", everyone must stop planning and present their recipes.
Show the cards, appeal other than cards with oral presentation to the Diner. But the dish is not completed yet. When they present their recipe for each course, they FLIP over 1 more face down card to complete the dish...
Will it be a perfect match or something no one wants to try?
mechanics: Open Drafting, Role Playing
publishers: Banana Moon Studio Sapporo (バナナムーン･ステュディオ), RareSightGames (レアサイトゲームズ)

name: Godtear: Luella, The Raging Storm & Shield Maidens
description:
"Like a mighty storm, Luella engulfs her enemies in a whirlwind of flashing steel and thunderous fury. Take cover, for she and her Shieldmaidens charge into battle without a backward glance."

Ride the lightning - this set includes:
Luella
3 Shield Maidens
Luella’s banner
Profile cards
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Grid Movement, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Variable Player Powers

name: Iron Helm: Uln-Rolk Promo Card
description:
Character promo card for Iron Helm that came in the game box for StoneFire, from the same publisher. It is also available in a promo pack called the Gnome Pack #1, from Grey Gnome Games on the Game Crafter.

Card name: Uln-Rolk
Trappings: Mace
Skill: Divinity
Skill proficiency: Brawn
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Shadows of Brimstone: Swamps of Jargono Artifacts #2 Game Supplement
description:
Otherworld artifact packs add interesting new loot to the game! Includes 15 new Artifact Cards for the Jargono Otherworld.

-description from publisher's website
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Horror, Miniatures
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Role Playing

name: Devolution: Become a Supreme Leader for Life!
description:
Devolution is a game about the dark nature of politics, where you will attempt to take control of the Judiciary, Media and Strategic Companies to gain the absolute power over the Republic and become the Supreme-Leader-For-Life! (Just a heads up though, life may be short and death unnatural).

To do that, you will need to gain popularity points by bribing or manipulating the voters. It comes at a cost of increasing depravity of public life and so the doomsday clock is set in motion! If you don't seize power before it reaches 100, the people will storm the palace gates and hang everyone.

The increasing depravity may not be all bad news. When the Depravity Meter reaches 70 there will be an opportunity for one of you to seize power as the leader of the revolutionary movement that will soon swallow everyone. Players can also seize power with the generals in a Coup d'État or with Priesthood or with Business.

winning conditions depend on the number of players


Each player holds seven cards and plays 2 per turn. These and popularity can be used to buy cards from the Republic deck or to spite and stop the other players which raises the depravity which, as Depravity Meter reaches 70, gives one more opportunity, for those holding the Spirit of the Revolution card, to seize power as the leader of the people. There is a variety of cards in the deck, some can be used out of turn in reaction to another player’s play adding more dynamic interaction to the game (you can foil someone else’s plan by assassinating the Judge they needed to gain an Judiciary Institution with a Black Ops card, for example).

Like in politics, the effects of one’s actions are not always 100% predicable: dice rolls) and as the Depravity Meter goes up past bomb-marked fields, the player causing the depravity has to draw a card from the Shit Happens deck which may adversely affect just them or everybody at the table (the logic being that the misdeeds withing the party affect the image of the whole party). Players draw cards at the end of their turn.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Set Collection, Take That

name: Thieves of Dorantia
description:
No Loyalty Among Thieves!

After being hired by the thieves guild to seek out and eliminate one of their very own, your adventurers play a dangerous game of cat and mouse that turns into a whodunit, on the streets of Dorantia!

Thieves of Dorantia is a high-stakes hex-crawl adventure, featuring:

Rules for new weapon type - pole weapons.
Rules for new dungeon tile type - narrow corridor.
Three new classes - street enforcer, street mage, and scout.
Hex-crawl chase game with gather information mechanic,
city guard, incarceration, twelve city locations and citizens.
City tunnel system with forgotten passageways.
New spells, traps, magic items, and treasure.
Nine unique Final Boss fights.

Requires Four Against Darkness

-description from designer
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Ultimate Werewolf: Extreme – Super Collector's Edition
description:
Your once-quiet village is infested with werewolves... Can you and the other villagers find them before they eliminate you?

Ultimate Werewolf Extreme is the best -selling party game where each player has a secret role: as a villager, hunt down and eliminate the werewolves; as a werewolf, convince the other players that you're innocent, while secretly eliminating them.

Choose from dozens of special roles each game for unlimited replayability!

This edition of Ultimate Werewolf includes:

Ultimate Werewolf Extreme
Ultimate Werewolf Bonus Roles
Ultimate Werewolf Pro
Ultimate Werewolf Artifacts deck
Plastic Werewolf warning sign
Name card pad
Portable deck box
"Got Villager?" bumper sticker
Moderator score pad
Tarot sized role cards for every role
200 custom card sleeves
25 Tarot card holders
25 Polarized inserts
25 award certificates
25 Rubber slap bracelets
4 Painted 3D minis: Ivory Tower, Sandwich, Gavel, Charm
GameTrayz Organizer

—description from the publisher
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Deduction, Horror, Murder/Mystery, Negotiation, Party Game
mechanics: Hidden Roles, Player Elimination, Roles with Asymmetric Information, Team-Based Game, Traitor Game, Variable Player Powers, Voting

name: Undaunted 2200: Callisto
description:
Jovian Moon Base - Callisto, 22nd Century AD: Tensions have arisen between the conglomerate of Earth's leading corporations that funded the base and the mining collective tasked with operating it. Protests have erupted, strikes been called, and contracts broken. Private security forces have been hired, industrial mining vehicles repurposed for combat, and long-disused military mechs reawoken. The battle for Callisto is about to begin: It's time to choose your side.

Undaunted 2200: Callisto is a standalone game in the Undaunted series that adapts the core gameplay of previous games to a new science-fiction setting. Play across an illustrated map in two-player, four-player, and solo game modes. Navigate the barren lunar landscape, maneuver to seize dominant high-ground positions, and utilize your formidable mechs to gain control of Callisto and its precious resources.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Solo / Solitaire Game, Team-Based Game

name: Dead Man's Hand Redux
description:
BECOME THE LEGEND

Dead Man’s Hand is the fast paced Old West Skirmish game where every decision you make could be your last. Pick up your pistol and posse up with the local Law, throw your hand in with raucous Cowboys, or maybe you’re looking for something else? Join in with a group of dangerous Outlaws and rob the bank or hook up with the crazy Desperados, what they’re up to nobody is ever sure.

This is the second edition of Dead Man’s Hand, which was first published in 2013 and has gone through many print runs and languages. This second edition is not a wholesale change from the original, nor is it a remake of a classic. After ten years out there in the world and with a lot of success, we identified that DMH needed a fresh look and a few changes but it’s the same game as many of you have enjoyed these past years. To those of you new to DMH, you’re gonna love it!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Simulation

name: The Easter Bunny Game
description:
The Easter Bunny Game is a pickup and delivery game in which players of all ages move their bunnies around the board, collecting Easter eggs, and delivering them to homes in time for Easter.

The game is played with chocolate mini-eggs; approximately 24 in four colours are required each game.

If I get the balance right, older kids and adults will enjoy the challenge of planning efficient routes and beating the opponents to the more lucrative destinations, while younger kids will still enjoy scoffing the eggs :)

Ingredients:
12 cards
Board
4 counters
24 miniature chocolate eggs... you'll need a new supply for each game!
mechanics: Pick-up and Deliver

name: Kingdom Death: Monster – Gen Con 2015 Lantern Promos
description:
The Dying Lantern and Vibrant Lantern promo gear cards were created to celebrate Kingdom Death: Monster's first ever public appearance!

The cards were originally given away at Gen Con 2015 to people who participated in a demo of the game vs. the White Lion. If the group died, each received the Dying Lantern promo. If they survived, they were given the Vibrant Lantern promo. Both were later made available in the Kingdom Death webstore for purchase.

These gear cards were also included with the Pinup Sci-fi Twilight Knight promo miniature, which is not part of the game.

The creator has stated that these promos are just for fun. They do not have associated recipes or rules on how to incorporate them into a campaign; it is meant to be left up to the players how to use them.
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Horror, Mature / Adult
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Role Playing

name: Warfighter: WWII Expansion #46 – Maquis
description:
Even in the darkest days following the fall of France to the German blitzkrieg in May 1940, not all was lost: from the populace arose the Resistance fighters called the Maquis. Whether baker, banker, teacher or housewife, these brave civilian men and women showed that resistance was not futile, rallying under the flag with the Croix de Lorraine. With less training and equipment than regular forces, and scrounging whatever they could, the Maquis carried out a shadow war on many fronts: printing and distributing underground propaganda, sabotaging enemy networks, aiding Allied pilots who had crashed behind enemy lines, and sending valuable intelligence to the British, risking their lives and retaliation, until France was finally liberated in December 1944.

Warfighter WWII: Expansion - #46 Maquis features Resistance fighters with missions and skills which reflect their methods of guerilla warfighting, with scrounged-up weapons and gear, stealthy movement, and unconventional objectives. This set adds 56 cards to your Warfighter WWII Europe Missions! This is a Soldier pack with new Soldiers, Missions, Objectives, Weapons, Equipment, Skills, and Service Records.

7 x Player Soldiers (French Resistance)
6 x Non-Player Soldiers (French Resistance)
5 x Squad Soldiers (French Resistance)
9 x Weapons
2 x Equipments
8 x Skills
3 x Service Records
8 x Missions
8 x Objectives

—description from the publisher
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling

name: Hjärnor
description:
Hjärnor is a cooperative miniature game set in the small town Möllinge in southern Sweden during a zombie outbreak in the middle of the nineties. The goal of the game varies with different scenarios, where each player take the role of a hero and combine their forces to survive the zombies and manage with their task.
There are rules for character building and after each scenario the heroes level up depending on the outcome of the session.
The difficulty of the scenario is scaled depending on the amount of heroes and their levels.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Role Playing

name: Das Spiele-Buch
description:
Das Spiele-Buch by Erwin Glonnegger is a comprehensive look at boardgames over the ages.
It is a German language book filled with illustrations, photos and (if public domain) rules from all aspects of tabletop gaming. Even the glossary and index is dotted with pictures.
It gives descriptions for hundreds of games, sorted by play types, making this book a family reference book on gaming.
mechanics: Unspecified
publishers: (Unknown), Bertelsmann, Drei Magier Spiele, Hugendubel Verlag, Otto Maier Verlag, Ravensburger

name: La Liga Solvay
description:
Description from the designer:

We are in England, at the beginning of the 20th century, a period of notorious and pioneering advances in science and investigation have led to the development of men with supernatural powers. The limits of science have been overtaken, and now they wonder what can be done with their magnificent gifts. In order to counteract those who use their powers for the benefit of evil, her Gracious Majesty Queen Victoria, has decided to act, and has enlisted the philanthropist and chemical engineer Ernest Solvay, to recruit the most loyal and capable men to her cause. So began one of the most exciting and bloody wars humanity has ever known.

OBJECTIVE OF THE GAME
Attack and beat your rivals.

CONTENTS
92 cards and rules.

PREPARATION
The game can be played by any number of players from 2 or 5.
Divide the cards into three stacks:
1- Scientists.
2- Countries.
3- Combats.
Shuffle the three stacks separately.
Deal the following cards to each player: 2 scientists, 2 countries, and 6 combats.

CARD MANAGEMENT
Keep the unused stack of combat cards separately and face down on the game table, when the stack has no cards left, shuffle the discarded cards once again.
The unused scientist and country cards should not be used.

YOUR HAND
Before you start playing, each player must put their Scientist and Country face up on the table:
Scientists’ cards: Two allies to attack with. The first value corresponds to the damage caused, and the second to the turns the player must rest after each attack.
Countries cards: Places where you attack, the sum of the value indicates the life you have.
Combat cards: Don’t let your rivals see them.

BEGINNING AND END OF THE GAME.
You can decide who starts however you chose, and follow in turns in a clockwise direction. At the end of each turn, you can’t have more than 6 cards in your hand. The player who outlives the others is the winner.

STAGES IN EACH TURN
Each turn has three stages:
1- Combat action. You can use combat cards once only, if you don’t want to combat, you can use your turn to discard the cards you don’t want.
2- Scientist action. You can attack with one scientist only in each turn.
In order to use them you have to activate their powers previously by using two Formula cards (see Combat cards).
3- Take as many cards as you need from the Combat stack until you have 6 cards in your hand.
mechanics: Hand Management, Player Elimination

name: Heroes of Stalingrad: Battlegrounds
description:
Expand the war to the industrial sectors of Stalingrad with the ammunition factory (on 2 terrain boards), 2 new heroes, and 2 new platoons for each army, roads, buildings and more!



Contents of the Kickstarter Edition:

Russian Units
Rifle Battalion, 270th Rifle Regiment, 10th NKVD Divisio (Russian Platoon)
Shturmovye Gruppy, Stalingrad Academy of Street Fighting (Russian Platoon with elite troops)
Papa Koulikov (Russian Hero)
Sasha and the Beasts, 270th Rifle Regiment, 10th NKVD Division (Russian Heroic Platoon) - Kickstarter Exclusive
2 Aircraft (LAGG-3, YAK-78) - Kickstarter Exclusive
Vasily Zaytsev, Sniper (Russian Hero) - Kickstarter Exclusive
Extra units and options (T60 Scout Tank, Sharpshooters, RPG40 Grenades, Concealed, Sprinter, Hardboiled, Overwatch, Initiative, …)




German Units
Panzergrenadiere, III. Battalion, Pzgr-Reg 26, 24. Pzr-Div. (German Platoon)
Aufklärungsabteilung 40, 24. Panzer-Division (German Platoon with elite troops)
David Kintz (German Hero)
Die Geisterabteilung, The Ghostly Recons (German Heroic Platoon) - Kickstarter Exclusive
2 Aircraft (STUKA, MESSERSCHMITT) - Kickstarter Exclusive
Major König, Sniper (German Hero) - Kickstarter Exclusive
Extra units and options (Artillery Spotter, Stug III, Overwatch, …)




Terrain
Terrain Tiles (4 Double-sided Road/Terrain Tiles)
Working Class District (4 Small Houses)
The Factory (2 Double-sided Terrain Boards)
The Factory Mini Campaign (3 linked scenarios)
Heroes of Stalingrad: Battleground Set #5 – The Sewers (4 punch boards, available separately)
Battlegrounds Storage Box (Terrain Board Storage) - Kickstarter Exclusive
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Modular Board, Simulation, Variable Player Powers

name: So Long, My World: Eclipse of My Soul
description:
"Have you... have you ever thought that the word soul is pronunciated like..."

Eclipse of my Soul expands the gameplay with Neurosis Cards and Psychosis Cards.

Neurosis Cards are drafted at the beginning of each game, giving you a particular power that will distinguish you from the other players. Psychosis Cards will be obtained if players are banking too many feeling tokens, giving them dangerous effects.
These cards will become relevant for the Karma Chains as well.

Like Remnants of the Moon and Wells of the Sun, Eclipse of My Soul is fully compatible with all game modes.
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Deduction, Expansion for Base-game, Horror
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: Shopping War
description:
Shopping War in a nutshell

Up to 4 valorous and goofy Shoppers:
- strolling around a lively and colourful shopping center (unfortunately not during a sales period);
- aiming for the best Shop items, Weapons and Mates (you need Vegetables, but also a Bazooka);
- creating powerful and bizarre Combos (ever tried to make friendship with a Wooden Washing Machine?);
- scuffling each other to gain 3 Stars to win! (nothing better to settle the scores with friends and relatives)

More info

Choose the Shopper that best reflects your strategy, personality, taste or whatever. Every time you win a Scuffle against another Shopper, you get 1 Star to show off in front of the others.
Combine the consumer goods you receive while Strolling around the Shops with Weapons and Mates in order to create extraordinary Combos. Of course, the better the Combos you equip to your Shopper, the higher the chances of defeating your enemies and creating a new embarrassing dance to express your joy.
The first Shopper who gets 3 Stars wins the game and obtains the right to cheer and boast of his victory for the rest of the day.

The story behind

"Three guys from Rome, Perugia and Milan meet and decide to create an extravagant board game... no, this is not the beginning of an old-fashioned joke. This is the simple story of three board game enthusiasts, with the desire to bring something new and unique on the table to entertain families and friends"
Special thanks to:

- Tambù for their invaluable support in all the project phases
- Gianluca Chicconi for the outstanding illustrations
- Isacco Saccoman for the impeccable graphic design
- Our friends and family, who have followed us from the beginning, providing precious feedbacks
mechanics: Connections, Dice Rolling, Variable Set-up

name: Blackbox
description:
A blackbox is a device, system, or object which can be viewed in terms of its inputs and outputs, or transfer characteristics, without any knowledge of its internal workings. Its implementation is "opaque" – or black. This kind of system may exchange matter with its environment. The term originates from military signal engineering and originally designated enemy equipment that was not meant to be opened due to the danger of booby traps.

Similarly, or not at all, this game is new and different each time you play it. You know for sure that you will put some time in, and hopefully get some fun out of it. Rest assured, however, that no incendiary devices are included.

This game originates from the urge to create a versatile modular sandbox simulation of a boring Euro game, also known as cube-pusher, or JASE (just another soulless euro), with the aim to re-create any of these games, and mashing them up as preferred, or not. Luckily, it got a bit sidetracked in development and while I hope, or fear, its ancestry still shines through, it became more of a beast of its own.

Blackbox consists of a large number of Modules, all of which plug into the Proto Module, and the exact composition of which decides how the game you play this time actually works, which mechanisms you will get to use, how you will score and a variety of other variables.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action Points, Area Majority / Influence, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, End Game Bonuses, Mancala, Modular Board, Network and Route Building, Rondel, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Set Collection, Simultaneous Action Selection, Square Grid, Sudden Death Ending, Track Movement, Turn Order: Progressive, Variable Set-up, Victory Points as a Resource, Worker Placement

name: Oathmark: Oathbreakers
description:
Dark necromancers have laid claim to forsaken kingdoms and summoned forth the souls of those who defiled their oathmarks.
The dead, once again, march to war.
As armies of wraiths and skeletal warriors bring destruction to their lands, the small kingdoms of the Marches also turn to the spirits of the dead.
Gathering the most ancient and powerful of oathmarks, they recall the spectral forms of those that died in loyal battle to once again come forth in defence of their kingdoms. With these ethereal warriors joining their ranks, the kings of the Marches may yet stand.

This supplement for Oathmark: Battles of the Lost Age introduces the forces of the dead to the game.
Some armies will use dark magic to summon the souls and corpses of traitors from the past, while others will recall the spirits of loyal warriors that gave their lives and willingly fight again.

This book also includes expanded rules for characters, which allow you to chart their progress from battle-to-battle, and watch as they grow in rank, responsibility, and power. All of these rules are then incorporated into a campaign featuring new scenarios that together tell of an epic war for survival.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Haphazards
description:
Haphazards is a hilarious card game for 3-8 players. Each round, one player encounters a dangerous hazard. The other players use their cards to attempt a rescue. The player with the best rescue wins.

Can you defeat the Yeti with a banana, a circus tent, and a hampster? Can you cross a ravine with a bale of hay, a skateboard, and a jackalope? With 270 cards in the deck, the possibilities are endless!

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Fantasy, Humor, Party Game
mechanics: Hand Management, Player Judge, Simultaneous Action Selection, Storytelling

name: Witchbound
description:
The once-famous island of Coven Cove hasn’t seen a real witch in over 100 years, until now. Be it a mistake, or fate, you have awakened your magic and are now bound to the island. While the cozy town is full of fascinating characters willing to help, none can undo this. You must venture out into the wilds to explore the ruins of what the witches left behind. Perhaps you’ll find answers, or maybe, you’ll discover being a witch isn’t so bad. You will find, however, danger around every corner, as the island keeps a dark secret.

Gameplay Overview

A grand adventure awaits you in this open-world style story-driven game. You’ll explore scenes full of details for you to interact with using the skills, items, and prompts you acquire. These interactions lead to entries in the massive storybook full of branching narratives, puzzles, and illustrated cut-scenes. As each day ends you’ll recover from your adventures but just as the moon changes, so does the world around you. As events unfold you will learn more about your journey.
Each and every decision you make matters.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Narrative Choice / Paragraph, Pattern Recognition, Push Your Luck, Solo / Solitaire Game
publishers: Board Game Circus, CMON Global Limited, Dark Doll Games, Geekach Games, HIT Games, Matagot, Meeple On Board, TLAMA games

name: Fungonia
description:
A cooperative game with mushrooms from Patagonia.

Hello Researchers, Welcome to Nature! In Fungonia we must collect and study species of Fungi that inhabit the Argentine Patagonia. You have to complete the missions as a team or alone, carefully choosing the cards to play. The ecosystem and society need them. Good luck in your research!

In turns, the players will play cards on the table, being able to add mushrooms to the nature reserve; grow them to the next level, or send them to the lab to be studied. The cards are limited, so it is essential to complete the mission with the proposed request in both the Nature Reserve and the Laboratory before they run out.

The game offers two tutorial missions, and 16 missions, the first one being the easiest, and the last one quite a challenge. It is not mandatory to play all the missions, and in case of losing, you can start again.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Set Collection

name: Maladum: Dungeons of Enveron
description:
Maladum is a fantasy miniatures board game in which you control a band of adventurers seeking their fortune in the ancient dungeons of Enveron. They must fight off the Revenant hordes as they search for valuable artefacts and negotiate with a varied cast of NPCs.

Maladum is built on the bestselling sci-fi game Core Space but has been overhauled and updated to accomodate the fantasy theme and rich lore. Like Core Space, Maladum takes place on a detailed 3D board of award-winning Battle Systems terrain, included in the box!

Your Adventurers will return to the town between games, where the exciting campaign system will track your party's fortunes, developing their skills, upgrading their equipment and telling their story.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Measurement Movement, Modular Board, Role Playing, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Semi-Cooperative Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up

name: Battlestations: Core Rulebook
description:
Publisher Blurb:

Are you a hero?

Battlestations is a character-based adventure game of simultaneous ship-to-ship and boarding combat in space. Players work together against the forces controlled by the referee. Battlestations can be played as one-off missions or as part of an ongoing campaign. You'll track character's positions on the spaceship layouts and the ships' positions on the hex map. The action in Battlestations is literally character driven. If you want the ship to turn or speed up, a character has to take an action to make is so. If you want the ship's guns to fire at an enemy ship, a character has to take an action to fire the guns.

This is the rulebook only. You will need the full boxed game to play.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Role Playing

name: Shadows of Brimstone: Forbidden Fortress – Forbidden Darkness Supplement
description:
Description from the publisher:

The war-torn battlefields of Feudal Japan are home to brutal fighting and creatures of myth and legend. For even the cunning warrior, it is difficult to keep corruption at bay and your heart pure of dishonor. As the war of the Dragon rages on, the Darkness grows emboldened, always ready to strike.

This 15-card Game Supplement for Shadows of Brimstone features an all new set of Darkness cards, themed for Feudal Japan! With effects that deal in Corruption, manipulate Grit, and make your Travel after the Adventure more dangerous, as well as making Enemies you fight both Ruthless and Soulless as they hunt you down, these new Darkness cards add new and dangerous challenges to your adventures.

Forbidden Darkness is a brand new set of cards that were not previously available through any Kickstarter project.

CONTENTS

Card #539 An Age of War ×2
Card #540 Taste of Corruption ×2
Card #541 Local Legends ×2
Card #542 Dark Soul
Card #543 War of the Dragon
Card #544 Bloodthirsty
Card #545 Shadow Clan Assassins
Card #546 Shame of Failure
Card #547 Born of Darkness
Card #548 Evil on the Move
Card #549 Emboldened
Card #550 Dishonored / Gravely Dishonored (Rule Card)
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Gold n' Grog
description:
Gold n' Grog is a press your luck pirate card game where players aim to collect as much treasure as they possibly can. Use Action Cards to aid your drawing power or to hinder your opponents.

Gold n' Grog can be learned in less than 5 minutes.
To setup, all you need to do is pass out 1 cutlass card to each player, then mix the rest of the cards into a large face-down pile in the center of the table.

Turns are made up of 2 phases.


Action Phase
Draw Phase


During your Action Phase, you may play as many action cards from your hand as your pirate heart desires. For you draw phase, you may draw up to 5 cards from the draw pile, one at a time. If you find yourself without a cutlass and you run into something bad, you'll lose your draw, otherwise you may collect all the drawn cards.

—description from the designer
mechanics: End Game Bonuses, Hand Management, Push Your Luck, Take That, Trading

name: BattleTech: The Fourth Succession War Scenarios Volume One
description:
From the publisher's guide:;

"Armies of BattleMechs stride toward their objectives, razing cities with their missiles, lasers, PPCs, and autocannons on the way. The language of battle is blood, and the cries of the homeless echo in the troubled sleep of every MechWarrior.

Torn from the pages of the Fourth Succession War, this scenario pack contains battles from the Davion/Liao front, the Steiner/Kurita front, as well as a series of engagements between Wolf's Dragoons and their former employer, the Draconis Combine, in their private war with the Dragon.

See how the Federated Suns bites pieces out of the Capellan Confederation, how some Lyran/Draconis battles could have gone either way, and how an elite mercenary unit takes on everything Takashi Kurita can throw at it. Command groups of regiments in climactic engagements or play the role of a commando on a secret and sensitive mission.

Put yourself to the test in 16 BattleTech, 3 BattleForce, and 2 MechWarrior scenarios from the Fourth Succession War."

User comment:

This scenario pack wasn't reprinted by FanPro, and doesn't appear to be on the list of possible reprints from Catalyst Game Labs as at Jan 11, making it difficult to find. Unlike the later BattlePack: Fourth Succession War, the scenarios are drawn predominantly from the BattleTech gamebooks and expansions, rather than the series of novels that covered the Fourth Succession War.

Despite having "Volume One" in the title, there doesn't seem to have ever been a Volume Two.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Role Playing

name: Kingdom Death: Monster – Messenger of Courage Challenge Scenario
description:
The Messenger of Courage is a promotional miniature that will only be available through the Kingdom Death: Monster kickstarter and future Kingdom Death special events.

Messenger of Courage was supposed to include:

One plastic Messenger of Courage
One-shot Challenge Scenario
Scout's Tunic Promo Gear Card
One Settlement Event Card
One Hunt Event Card


The Messenger of Courage was shipped in Wave 1 of Kickstarter fulfillment, but the game content mentioned in the campaign was not included. Game creator Adam Poots mentioned that the content would be printed and released on their website eventually. For now, it is available in PDF format on the Kingdom Death website.
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Horror, Mature / Adult, Miniatures
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Role Playing

name: Sergeants Miniatures Game: Saint-Côme-du-Mont Expansion
description:
"Saint-Côme-du-Mont is a collection of X-Terrain suitable to add a small stone church to your games. The church steeple is an excellent place for look outs and snipers. And the stone construction of both the church and parsonage will make it necessary to go in and clean the enemy out."

This expansion expands play with three typical country buildings - a small stone church, a single story parsonage, and a open crypt with shed. Each building has special sighting rules and provide excellent cover. Additional scenarios are included.

CONTENTS:

X3A Saint-Côme-du-Mont - a stone church with steeple
X3B St. Comé le Presbytrère - a one story stone parsonage
X3C La Crypte de St. Comé - a church graveyard and crypt
10 Scenarios
3 sets of 3 Story cards
7 Order cards
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, World War II
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Modular Board, Open Drafting, Storytelling

name: RUS: Age of the Vikings
description:
"RUS: Age of the Vikings" is a strongly themed military and economic strategy wargame set in Viking Age Russia, in which up to 5 players compete to become Czar of the Rus. It deliberately sets out to marry the elegant inclusivity of Eurogames with the thematic gameplay of a classic Amerigame.

Each turn, players choose 6 of 9 Actions that drive the game. Will you send out Envoys to engage in Diplomacy, Harvest your crops, Trade with foreign powers, Construct settlements, invest in Culture & Technology or Recruit troops to engage in warfare? The player who chooses the Action gains a bonus, but all other players simultaneously take part in each Action Phase that is chosen.

It is possible to win the game without ever engaging in warfare, but for those who prefer blood, combat uses a Tactics Card system which means you have to out-think your opponent to beat them in battle.

As in history, Politics Cards provide a random element, introducing new Kingdoms (like the Muscovites or the Golden Horde) or triggering good harvests, famine and ultimately the Black Death.

The first player to score 8 Victory Points wins the game, but if the Black Death is triggered before this happens, all Kingdoms are hit by the plague. The survivors then take stock to see who is the most powerful in the new world that emerges.

With virtually no down-time and multiple routes to victory, RUS: Age of the Vikings provides a dynamic strategic experience within a playing time of about 30 mns per player.
categories: Civilization, Economic, Medieval, Negotiation, Political, Print & Play, Territory Building, Wargame
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Commodity Speculation, Open Drafting, Simulation, Trading, Variable Player Powers

name: Scurry & Scamper
description:
Description from the publisher:

THE SCENE

You approach the hole in the wall with caution. You sniff the air. The smell of sharp cheddar perfectly aged wafts its way to you from the open pantry door. Your belly rumbles. Your mouth waters. You can almost taste the crumbly, cheesy goodness. You step forward closer to the hole...but wait! Was that the sound of the cat sharpening its claws on the linoleum?

SCURRY & SCAMPER
A Game of Tricks, Traps, & Cheese

Scurry & Scamper is a trick-taking game that adds pre and post-hand actions allowing you to manipulate the hand in your favor or twist the outcome afterwards. Players are rats trying to collect the largest cheese hoard, while sticking their fellow rats with the biggest pile of Fink Traps.  

Players win cheese tokens by winning tricks of cards, but beware!  Scurry and Scamper cards will have those cheese tokens flying into other rat’s hoards, sticking unlucky players with Finks. Whoever has the least Finks wins!

Can you out-fink your fellow rats and scamper off with the most cheese?
mechanics: Action/Event, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Hand Management, Take That, Trick-taking

name: Vs. System 2PCG: Sinister Syndicate
description:
The second release of the Great Power Arc.

An inevitable side-effect to the indomitable effectiveness of a certain wise-cracking webslinger has resulted in his enemies effectively unionizing! This evil expansion to Vs. System 2PCG includes an unprecidented SIX NEW MAIN CHARACTERS and presents a menacing collection of Spider-Man's most notorious villains!

Vs. System 2PCG: Sinister Syndicate showcases 55 new cards that showcase Spider-Man's greatest foes. Including Main Characters, Supporting Characters, Plot Twists, and a Special Location. Vs System 2PCG: Sinister Syndicate can be combined with any other Vs System 2PCG sets.

This is not a stand-alone game.

-description from publisher
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting
mechanics: Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: The Walking Dead: All Out War – Made to Suffer Expansion
description:
The Made to Suffer Expansion for The Walking Dead: All Out War Miniatures Game recreates the ongoing struggle of the survivors and Rick’s ill-fated encounter with the tyrannical boss of Woodbury – the Governor! The set also includes new characters, equipment, supplies, events and scenery to expand your regular games.

It also contains a printed play-mat with detailed town interiors, rules for fighting inside, and expanded rules for larger games and allied forces!

—description from the publisher
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Zombies
mechanics: Dice Rolling

name: Star Wars: Imperial Assault – Training Ground Skirmish Map
description:
Battle through the Training Ground Skirmish Map for Imperial Assault, which rapidly changes between a heavily forested floor and a pristine Imperial facility. Two unique skirmish missions invite you to reprogram remotes with your data or trick your opponent into guessing which unit is your most important. No matter which mission you play, this Skirmish Map draws you into the action with evocative art of the Rebel soldier Fenn Signis and an Imperial Stormtrooper.

The playmat comes with scenario cards which can be played on the mat
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Star Wars: Imperial Assault – Coruscant Landfill Skirmish Map
description:
The heaping junk piles of Coruscant set the stage for your skirmish games with the Coruscant Landfill Skirmish Map. Carrying lucrative crates back to your base can give you victory points in one skirmish mission, while the other challenges your strike team to engage in battle around the lair of a ravenous dianoga. Whether you’re playing in a high-stakes tournament or just a friendly match at your home, you can enjoy the artwork of Biv Bodhrik and IG-88 that frames this playmat.

The playmat comes with scenario cards which can be played on the mat
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Aeon's End: Evolution
description:
An expansion for Aeons End that consists of milestones from the Past and Future Kickstarter campaign. It contains:

Treasures:

Portable Furnace
Fossilized Feather
Arachnos' Cobwebs
Indira's Aetherial Glow
Nook's Mechanex


Market Cards:

Fall Lantern
Reflecting Current
Crescent Greave
Feeding Lichen


Mage:

Dorian


Nemesis:

Clouded Mesmer

name: Massive Darkness 2: Sorcerer's Hat Promo Card
description:
Originally available in pack D of the Dice Tower 2022 Kickstarter campaign.

Rare Treasure

Cost: 1 Mana
Roll 1 Shadow Die and apply the effect (once per round)
Mana: Gain that many Mana
Sword: Deal that many wounds to 1 enemy in Magic Range
Shadow: +1 action
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Cards Against Humanity: Bōks
description:
Say hello to Bōks, a magical device combining the portability of a bag, the rigidity of a cube, and the timeless beauty of a rectangle. It’s emptiness, redesigned.

With a 3,500-card capacity, Bōks fits your whole collection and more (measures 15.5" x 9.5" x 5.75").
Sleek vegan-leather exterior and luxurious microsuede lining.
Includes five one-of-a-kind procedurally-generated cards.
Secrets.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Too Many Bones: Nexus Box
description:
Too Many Bones promo card:

A weapon for someone with a true heart and a sharp mind.

Setup:
The card will be mixed into the Loot Deck. When received it can be used up to three times.

Usage:
Roll Nexus's Tyrant Die and apply the rolled result by either using Backup Plan effects for free or gaining training Pt.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Zombie Legacy
description:
Zombie Legacy is a fast paced co-op game for 2-5 players with 10 Legacy episodes. With branching storylines and an emphasis on character development, players choose their own path, and those choices impact gameplay.

Working together with your fellow survivors you will explore the city searching for supplies and assets as you encounter zombies, hostiles and obstacles in your path. Will you survive together or die alone?

Zombie Legacy Character Creation

The first thing we do in Zombie Legacy is create our character! Each character is unique and customizable.

First choose the character image sticker. Then choose your back story and stick it onto your player mat. Choose things that resonate with you or fit your feel for your hero and your play style - these choices will impact the game play and the campaign.

You will also choose a starting weapon, and a Luck ability.

This will be your character for the entire game throughout every episode.

Zombie Legacy Game Mechanics

Legacy - what happens in one episode will impact the next. Each episode has a branching storyline and you will decide as a group which way to take the game - choose your own path!
Co-operative Play – you work as a team to achieve that episode’s goals.
Modular Board with Tile Placement – tile selection is randomized forming a modular game board that is different every time leading to different possibilities for strategy and exploration.
Grid Movement – you may move orthogonally on the game board, either moving into tiles that have been placed or by placing tiles onto the board.
Variable Player Powers and Role Playing – in Zombie Legacy each character may develop different skills and attributes that can impact gameplay.
Discovery, Pick up and Deliver – an episode may require you to search for particular items. These items can be found on the tiles, so you need to place tiles on the board in order to search. If you discover one of these items, you may collect it (pick up) and deliver it to the specified location. Delivery may trigger a reward.
Trading – you may exchange game items with another player if you are in the same location.
Combat – is a combination Dice Rolling with Encounter Cards and your assets.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Pick-up and Deliver, Tile Placement, Variable Player Powers

name: 20th Air Force
description:
A Solitaire Game of the Strategic Bombing Campaign against Japan: 1944-1945

On April 18, 1942, Jimmy Doolittle led a squadron of carrier-based B25 Mitchells on a daring surprise raid on Tokyo. The raid, conducted as revenge for the Japanese surprise attack on Pearl Harbor four months earlier, caused little damage but was a harbinger of the destruction from the air that was destined to befall the islands of Japan…

By 1944, US forces had seized island bases in the Marianas close enough to Japan to employ the new long range B29 Superfortresses in a high-stakes strategic bombing campaign against Japanese industries and cities. So began the short (late 1944 until August 1945) but incredibly destructive life of the United States Army Air Force’s (USAAF’s) 20th Air Force.

Your objective as you take command of the 20th Air Force in September 1944 is nothing short of reducing Japan’s cities, large and small, to smoldering rubble! To do it you’ve got the powerful and sophisticated B29, in ever increasing numbers and with flight crews improving in combat and navigation skills, and a research effort you direct to develop more and more sophisticated weapons. While initially you must focus on clearing the sky of Imperial Japanese Army Air Force (IJAAF) fighters and blasting Japanese war industries with high explosive bombs, eventually you will develop incendiary bombs which rapidly reduce Japan’s combustible wooden and paper cities to ashes, and their dispersed war industries to ruins. Simultaneously, demolish her ports and kamikaze bases, and mine her waters. In the meantime, research marches on, perhaps you will obtain the ultimate weapon, the Atomic Bomb? Hopefully you will, because you are in a race against time – if Japan can hold out long enough the US will have to launch “Operation Olympic”, the costly planned invasion of Japan, and your strategic bombing campaign will have failed.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Area-Impulse, Critical Hits and Failures, Dice Rolling, Force Commitment, Increase Value of Unchosen Resources, Ratio / Combat Results Table, Simulation, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Set-up

name: Resident Evil: The Board Game – Director's Cut
description:
The Director's Cut box includes all the Stretch Goals from the Kickstarter campaign.

It includes additional characters to play as in the Core game complete with their cards and models, as well as new enemies complete with their cards and models to use in certain scenarios in the Core game.

It also includes a rulebook which details how to add the new enemies to the Core game and also includes some additional gameplay modes which includes Traitor mode where one character can be revealed to be a traitor sent by the enemy organization, Umbrella, to sabotage the game from the inside. Real Survival mode takes the Hard mode (also featured in this box) and cranks up the challenge even more and Battle mode is a new solo mode which sees a single character trying to kill as many enemies as possible before the tension deck runs out.
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Miniatures, Video Game Theme, Zombies
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: El Dorado Canyon: More Ways to Die Expansion
description: This is the second expansion to El Dorado Canyon. It includes two unique characters and 4 unique town cards to add to the game to give it more variety and replay-ability.
mechanics: Push Your Luck, Simultaneous Action Selection, Take That

name: Grim(m) World: First Steps
description:
