Ship parts also randomly appear, allowing players to craft their ships according to their strategy or vice versa. While essentially a trading game that can be won peacefully, piracy is always an option and defences cannot be ignored!
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Pick-up and Deliver, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Spred
description:
Spred is a LOT derivative for Series: Shibumi. It features a simple ball-removal game mechanism that makes loops impossible, but at the same time, produces potentially long games in a very small playing area. An average game lasts 45-50 turns.

Two players (White and Black) start with a supply of 8 red balls each.

The board starts empty. Players take alternate turns placing a ball of their colour (White or Black, not red) on an empty position.

If, after a player's move, there is at least one straight line of three connected* balls (touching) of their colour (the lines can be orthogonal or across levels), the player does the following:

1. Chooses any of those lines of three.
2. Removes the maximum number of movable balls from that line. This means that the player must find out the correct order to remove them so he removes the most. Balls may drop as a result of these removals.
3. Places one RED ball of their supply on any of the empty spaces that composed the removed line.

The game ends when a player runs out of red balls or there are no more available moves, whatever happens first. The player with less red balls in hand wins.

(*)- Note that flat diagonal lines are not connected!
mechanics: Pattern Building

name: TactDecks: Reign of Heroes
description:
BUILD a party of specialized fantasy heroes.

CONSTRUCT a battlefield with environment tiles, terrain, and fortifications.

DESTROY your opponent(s) with a mix of melee, ranged, and magical attacks.

TactDecks: Reign of Heroes is a fully customizable, expandable battle system. A single set supports 2 players, or add additional sets to increase the size of your battlefield and options.

Highly portable and adaptable, TactDecks supports a creative combination of battlefield layout and party configurations. Whatever your tactical preference - spell, sword, arrow, subterfuge, or a little bit of everything - TactDecks adapts to your tactical style.

There's no arenas. No static mats. Movement is organic and possible in every conceivable direction (including up and down). Climb, move, or demolish terrain, don't just look at it!
categories: Card Game, Fantasy, Medieval, Miniatures, Science Fiction
mechanics: Area Movement, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Hand Management, Player Elimination, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: Clang!: Bloodthirsty Beasts
description:
BLOODTHIRSTY BEASTS is the first expansion to the Clang! CORE ARMY PACK

Each player has one Beast Hunter card. Instead of fighting or talking with their Troops (standard Clang! rules), players can instead choose to send out their Beast Hunters to search for Beasts that they can use to attack the enemy. They can only do this if they are the player leading the battle, and only if they were also leading in the previous game turn. Sending out the Beast Hunters means they surrender the lead (to the player on their left)

At the end of the turn that that player regains the lead, their Beast Hunters return with a Beast (top card from the pile). They can use this Beast to fight the enemy, but only if they have their Beast Hunters with their army (not out beast hunting), as they need these to goad the Beast into battle

It is best to use Beasts to attack players who have no Beasts themselves, or whose Beast Hunters are out looking for monsters, as they will have to defend using their Troops rather than a Beast

Beasts can fight Beasts, using standard Clang! fighting rules, and Beasts can fight Troops, again using the standard rules, but only red attack bars can affect Beasts, so they are hard to defeat. If a player has fewer than three red combat bars amongst the hand of four Troops they have to choose from, they are doomed to lose, so it is best to pick the three weakest Troops to send to their destruction

Some Beasts have Special Attacks - these could depend on Troops having a certain level of bar for a skill such as Bravery or they all run away from the beast, or could mean looking at the Troop pictures so for instance any Troops without shields cannot defend themselves against the Special Attack and are defeated

Beasts can help turn the tide of battle, intimidate other players, or add a final blow to win the war, but Beasts themselves do not count towards Troop totals so if your Troops are defeated you lose

Components:
BLOODTHIRSTY BEASTS gamebox
Beasts (1 deck of 16 cards)
Beast Hunters (1 deck of 6 cards)
Instructions (1 deck of 3 cards)
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Medieval
mechanics: Hand Management
publishers: sinocono GAMES, The Game Crafter, LLC

name: Wall Street: The World of Financial Wizardry
description:
The fourth Jerry Lewis-endorsed, big box (26" square) Hasbro game. From the same series that brought us High Stakes, Power Broker, and Spellbound.

Players compete to be the first to either collect $100,000 or be the only remaining player that has not claimed bankruptcy.

Players take turns rolling the dice and moving onto board spaces (called "blocks"). Certain blocks permit players to buy and sell seven different stocks. each stock type pays different dividends. Payment can be affected by Bull or Bear cards as well as Insider Informatin cards.
mechanics: Commodity Speculation, Dice Rolling, Stock Holding

name: Le chemin de compostelle (Le Jeu de Loupio)
description:
The goal is to reach St. Jacques de Compostela in the way that collected the necessary assets: generosity, courage, resourcefulness, knowledge etc.

Basically the game is a race from Assisi to Compostela, witt rolling the dice, but with hazards on the way and rewards for virtues such as 'courage' 'generosity' and 'knowledge'.

Who reaches the finish first is the winner.
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Children's Game, Racing, Religious
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move

name: Yuke! Nobunaga Kashindan
description:
Issue game of Wargame Japanese History #14.

Multi-players game for vassals of Oda Nobunaga in Sengoku period of Japan. Oda Nobunaga was most powerful daimyo(feudal lord) in Sengoku period.
"Yuke! Nobunaga Kashindan" means Go! Nobunaga's Vassals.
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Oda_Nobunaga

Each player control one major vassals in Oda clan.
Standard game can play from three to five players. The game also include rule for one(solitaire) and two players.

Each counter represents a vassal to serve Oda clan. Each vassal have three ability, military, castellation and politic. During in the game, players can recruit vassals to own faction.

Each card represents a mission be ordered from Oda Nobunaga. Each mission has victory points, necessary abilities and penalty of failure.

Elect chief vassal at the beginning of each turn. Then, chief vassal is draw mission cards and he assigns missions to each player. Players can negotiate freely for achieve mission.
Repeat until the mission is exhausted.

Winner is determined by victory points.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Harvest
description:
This is a relatively easy to learn strategy game that can be played by printing off a hexgrid and using coins or similarly sized markers. It seems to be somewhat unique, but Dots and Boxes is probably it's closest relative.

The rules are explained here: https://www.scribd.com/doc/258354969/Harvest
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Anima Tactics: Sarah Reinhold
description:
Publisher Blurb:

Sarah is the heiress of the once prestigious house Reindhold. Her supernatural abilities manifested at a young age, causing her uncle Alfred to use all of his influence and power to get her taken in by the church as a Saint. Since then she has worked hard to master her innate skills and use them to support the Nathaniel cause. She hopes this way she can help as many people as possible.

Summoner Level: 1 Affinity: Light. Mist of the Hallowed: Any ranged attacks against a friendly unit within Sarah's Control Zone suffer -1 Attack.
Nathaniel's Incense (Magic, Effect) - Units within Sarah's Control Zone recover 2 LP each during the Recovery Phase, and cannot be Stunned due to a Crash. Upkeep: o
Stigmata (Magic, Effect, Reactive) - When a friendly Unit within Sarah's Control Zone would lose LP due to their own ability or rules, Sarah loses the LP instead.
Nathaniel's Hand (Magic, Effect) - Magic and Ki abilities that are being Upkept by units within Sarah's Control Zone are cancelled. Effect 16. Limit: Once per turn.
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling

name: Armored Knights North Africa: Operation Venezia
description:
The German offensive to take Tobruk / May 27 - June 28, 1942

Armored Knights North Afrika - Operation Venezia allows you to plan and fight the battle that won Rommel Tobruk. It was a close and at the same time complete victory for Rommel. His forces made their way around the flank of the British Gazala Line and met with initial success. But after a few days the Germans found themsleves encircled by a strongly entrenched British Brigade, the 150th, which sat astride the German supply route.
Rommel came close the throwing in the towel, within about a day, before clinching success by finally forcing the 150th Brigade to surrender first and open the supply route. Immediately after beating the 150th Brigade the Brtish armour decided to make a final effort to beat Rommel in the Cauldron. They failed and Rommel turned the tables on them. So much so that almost 90% of the remaining British armour was destroyed and gave Rommel his opportunity to take Tobruk and move past the Egyptian frontier wire and towards Alexandria.

All units modeled as battalions, companies/batteries.
Hexes represent approximately 2km of terrain.
Each turn represents 2 hours of ff daylight or 2-4 hours of night.

This game comes with:
•Armored Knights North Afrika Rules
•(9) 11x17 Scenario Cards
•Numerous Player Aides and Examples
•Game Turn Record Track for Venezia
•Game Turn Record Track for Battleaxe
•(4) Full Color Order of Battle Charts
•Full Color Battleaxe Order of Battle Chart
•Very Sturdy box
•Approximately 1000 double sided unit counters and markers
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Hexagon Grid

name: Colonial Campaigns: Boxer Rebellion – Admiral Seymour's Relief Attempt
description:
From the back of the book:

Boxer Rebellion: Admiral Seymour's Relief Attempt features 10 action-packed historical scenarios from the first phase of the Boxer Rebellion. Fanatical Boxers, The Chinese Imperial Army and a train bound Allied force battle it out on the way to Peking. Also featured are three scenarios from pre-European involvement where the Chinese Army tried to suppress the growing Boxer movement.

The scenarios:
1. Senlou Temple - October 18, 1899 Chinese Army vs. Boxers
2. Laishui Boxing Grounds - May 16, 1900 Chinese Army vs. Boxers
3. Boxer Revenge - May 18, 1900 Chinese Army vs. Boxers
4. Skirmish on the Rails - June 11, 1900
5. Anting Station - June 13, 1900
6. The Relief of Lofa Station - June 14, 1900
7. Cracker Guns - June 20, 1900
8. General Nieh's Pursuit - June 21, 1900
9. The Battle of Peitsang - June 21, 1900
10. Hsiku Arsenal - June 22, 1900

These scenarios are organized to be played using The Sword and the Flame, but can easily be adapted to any rules set. Units are set at 8 figures instead of the traditional 20. This allows for faster play, greater flexibility and ... your 20-figure units become 2½ units instantly! All scenarios are played ona 4x6' table. Give it a try!

Other sections include:
- Uniform inforamtion
- History of the period!
- Information on the Chinese and European Forces
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Simulation

name: Mines of the Sacred Dragon: Promo Exp Set #1
description:
MOSD Promo Expansion Set #1 comes with 5x the same hexagon tile. The tile has all 6 colors on it.
Some versions included 3 tiles with all six colors, one with blue/blue/grey/blue/blue/grey, and one with green/green/grey/green/green/grey.
mechanics: Modular Board, Tile Placement

name: Elemental Clash: Austrian Tales
description:
"Elemental Clash: Austrian Tales" is an easy-to-learn, fast-paced and very strategic Customizable Card Game for 2 - 4 mighty Wizards, who harness the four Elements Earth, Air, Fire and Water to summon fantastic Creatures and cast magical Spells in order to deplete the opponent's Spellbook (deck) and thus defeating them.

The aim of the game is to reduce the cards in your opponent’s card-deck (or Spellbook) to zero by using the Spells and Creatures in your Spellbook. Players take turns that always follow the same structure. For each point of damage a Player receives through Creatures or Spells, he or she puts the top card of his or her deck on his or her Discard Pile (or Archive). Is a player unable to draw a card, he or she loses immediately.

Dive into the fascinating world of Austrian folk tales with "Elemental Clash: Austrian Tales". The game is a standalone-game - you do not need to purchase the Elemental Clash Basic Set or any of the expansions - which includes over 80 Creature, Spell and Element-Stone cards, totalling in at over 270 cards.

Each Creature and Spell in "Elemental Clash - Austrian Tales" is directly inspired by and based on well and lesser known characters and events to be found in the rich treasury of Austrian folk tales.

"Elemental Clash - Austrian Tales" is the ideal gift for all fans of Customizable Card Games as well as for all those who are interested in (Austrian) folk tales and mythology.

If you are curious you can have a look at all the cards at http://www.elementalclash.com/cards/ec-austrian-tales/


German:

Tauche ein in die faszinierende Welt der österreichischen Sagen mit „Elemental Clash – Sagenwelten". In diesem Kartenspiel für die ganze Familie übernehmen 2 bis 4 Spieler die Rolle von Zauberern, die sich die vier Elemente Erde, Luft, Feuer und Wasser zu nutzen machen um Kreaturen heraufzubeschwören, damit diese an ihrer Seite kämpfen, und mächtige Zaubersprüche zu wirken, um sich den Sieg zu sichern.

„Elemental Clash – Sagenwelten“ enthält fast 80 verschiedene Kreaturen- und Zauberkarten, die allesamt von Charakteren und Begebenheiten aus dem österreichischen Sagenschatz inspiriert sind. Insgesamt beinhaltet die Box ca. 270 Karten die vom Entwickler des Spiels, Andreas Propst selbst illustriert wurden.

„Elemental Clash – Sagenwelten“ ist das ideale Geschenk für alle Sagenfreunde und Kartenfüchse, jung und alt.

Wenn du neugierig bist kannst du dir alle Karten auf http://www.elementalclash.com/cards/ec-sagenwelten-2/ ansehen!!
categories: Card Game, Educational, Fantasy, Fighting, Medieval, Mythology
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: Struck
description:
Struck's shape shifting checkerboard will offer new and puzzling challenges with each game you play. To win, all four of your playing pieces must occupy the four goals at the opposing end of the board.

The amount of moves each player will make during their turn is determined by the roll of the unique Struck Die. A "move" can be one of three actions: move a playing piece, change the color of a playing piece, or change the color on the checkerboard. By rolling three or higher, all actions can be used during a turn.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement

name: Retreat to Waterbury Falls
description:
Retreat to Woodbury Falls takes place days after a catastrophic yet preternatural tectonic plate shift left the land riddled with sinkholes and worse... a collapsed society.

On the board you control three different survivalist leaders on their quest to take over competing base camps. Players survive by gathering and trading resources to recruit other survivors to their own camps and exile those who hold them back.

Once players have recruited an efficient survival group and have equipped themselves with enough tools and utilities by way of deck building they can move towards the final goal... take over a rival base camp.

Retreat to Woodbury Falls utilizes the popular deck management mechanic but still allows players control of physical board pieces. The most unique aspect to the game is building a deck based around card combat. You will be able to select different class survivor cards throught the game. You will find synergies and combos between the survivors and the items you equip to them both during deck building and combat. Yes, You actually get to use your deck in combat against other players to win the game!

Retreat to Woodbury Falls is an easy to learn game that still maintains a high level of strategic command and decision-making.
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board, Rock-Paper-Scissors

name: Bonanza
description:
objective: be the first reaching target space
- moving by turns -
simple 'roll & move' game: ending on a marked space follow instructions;
categories: American West, Children's Game, Dice, Racing
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move

name: Malifaux: Ten Thunders Archers
description:
From the Malifaux Tactica Wiki:

A long ranged minion that can hit hard from a distance at a medium cost. This minion can be hired by any Ten Thunders Crew. This Minion is best used away from the main fighting. It has some very good tricks to get shots in but only has bash in melee. It has a couple of good zero point actions to bolster its attacks and also a 1 point action called Take Aim. This is a (1) action focus strike giving you a positive flip on your shot but can only be used once per activation.

The best thing about this model is that its ranged attacks are usually further than an opposing minions range. This enables you to move it in to place to cover your melee fighters. Remember to use the Threading the Needle ability by moving it with something like a Torokage as it can effectively shoot through the model to the enemy. Remeber the Take Aim will usually be your first shot and then decide whether you need to use Reading the Wind if you have low cards in your hand or if the model you are shooting at is in cover or the Spell Yajiri with the second attack to bolster its damage or cause non living models to slow down.
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven

name: Red October
description:
Red October was published in Combat! #5. It is a highly abstracted political conflict game about the situation in Russia from February-October 1917.

The four players represent the Provisional Government, the General Staff, the Bolsheviks, and the Anarchists. They all can place political factors in the boxes in the various areas on the board and attack other player's factors (using a standard wargame CRT). Some players have other options: the Provisional Government can announce an offensive against the Central Powers, the General Staff can try for a coup in a given area, and the Bolsheviks can try to seize power, which may result in their getting control of some areas (and ends the game regardless).

Each player has a different set of moderate and decisive victory conditions. It is possible for more than one player to achieve a victory condition. Negotiations are encouraged by the rules.
categories: Civil War, Negotiation, Political, Wargame, World War I
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling

name: CiRKiTRY
description:
In CiRKiTRY, players have been invited to a local electronics competition. Your goal is to create a electronic circuit that uses all 5 of the following components: a Battery, a Resistor, an Inductor, a Capacitor, and an LED bulb. However, to make things more difficult, everyone will be competing on the same circuit board.

Players take turns uncovering circuit board tiles and placing their electronic components along the conductive paths. But be careful! The Voltage on the Volt-a-Meter fluctuates as components are played. If the Voltage gets raised too high, you might cause a destructive power surge.

Use Solder pieces to create pathways and make new connections. Not all 5 of the electronic components need to be your own, and you can attempt to piggyback off of your opponents' placement.

CiRKiTRY does not require prior knowledge of electronic engineering to play.
mechanics: Network and Route Building, Tile Placement

name: Geodeto
description:
Geodeto Geodeto is an EASY-FAST-FUN card game with pyramids for 2-6 players (age 8+) that takes the best from Pyramideto game and increases the gaming experience for older players.

There are six Continent cards in six colors in the game representing Europe, Asia, America, Oceania, Antarctica and Africa.
Every continent is connected to two neighboring continents and to the World Ocean in the middle of the board.

Players set for how many fulfilled goals they want to play to control the length of the game. (Publisher recommands 10-15 goals per game.)

Once the last game is fulfilled, players count their points. The one with the most points wins the game.

Motto: Travelers, globetrotters, set the sails and sail the seven seas. Can you circumnavigate the world in 20 minutes?

You need one set of iGo pyramids (= 18 pyramids) and a deck of Geodeto cards to play Geodeto.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Open Drafting, Set Collection

name: Mind Your Step!
description:
Mind Your Step! is a press-your-luck card game where players try to earn the most money collecting flowers in the desert to sell. This Game was designed for the 24 hour contest - May 2013

"They said it would be easy, you thought it would be simple, go and collect flowers to sell at the market - what could go wrong!? That was until you met the Rats, no ordinary rats - these are definitely of an unusual size, but they are nothing compared to the fearsome Scorpions."

Players take turns to roll the dice and spend those points on drawing cards. There are four decks to choose from, each deck costs a different amount to draw a card. The more expensive the cards the greater the value of the flowers in the decks, but the higher the risk of drawing a scorpion and leaving with nothing. Players must decide whether to risk it and draw from the more valuable decks or play it safe with a cheap deck that guarantees they earn at least some money. Rolling a double on the dice will let you choose between 2 cards so should be safer, but do you keep trying for a double or take the bonus for leaving without uncovering a Rat. Ending your turn lets you sell your flowers at the market for coin, and at the end of the game whoever has the most coin wins.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck

name: Tuesday Night Tanks
description:
In 1955 the United States Army needed to find a use for surplus tanks and trained crews. The Combat Tankers Division was formed and quickly became the most watched sport in American history. Tank-on-tank combat gave tankers a place to practice their skills while the American public helped fund the armored military.

Tuesday Night Tanks is a fast paced, dice-less combat game for 2 to 4 tank commanders. Players compete on a board made of four random map pieces which means the game changes every time you play. Terrain features have various effects on play: water is impassible, buildings provide permanent protection, while hedges and barrels provide temporary cover. To win the game, you must either eliminate all opposing tanks or spend a full turn atop The Hill. Either way, you must survive to win.
mechanics: Action Queue, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Player Elimination, Simultaneous Action Selection
publishers: (Self-Published), Chevee Dodd, LLC, The Game Crafter, LLC

name: Say Uncle
description: Say Uncle is a card game where all the players are attempting to spell the word "UNCLE" in front of their opponents.The game comes with 80 cards, which contains Letter cards (that have the letters needed to spell UNCLE) and Action cards that allow the player to move and discard Letter card in front of them. If a player has the word "UNCLE" spelled in front of them at the end of their turn, they are out of the game. The last player remaining wins.
mechanics: Player Elimination, Take That

name: Alchemy Dice
description:
Alchemy dice is a strategic dice allocation/worker placement game in which the players will use their dice to collect precious stones as resources for their alchemical studies, increase their influence by buying new cards and dice and finally earn victory points to win the game.







"The Patriarch of Rishadan was an impressive man who had used his secret knowledge to prolong his life well beyond his natural span. But in the end even he could not escape the last voyage and now the alchemist guild is without a leader.
A council of 111 alchemists has chosen the few who are deemed worthy enough to become the new patriarch and the most powerful man in the whole city. But which one is the best? Which one knows the secrets of the transmutation like no other? Which one can use his influence in the city best to strengthen his position? And which one will be triumphant in the secret rituals known as “chucking the dice”?
Let the competition begin and the council will elect the most successful alchemist as the new patriarch."







In Alchemy Dice, the player start out with three different cards, three dice, an unique Character and an unique assortment of resources. During each round the players are rolling their dice and allocate them to their cards where they, based on the dice-roll will be able to use different actions - like collecting resources, modifying another die, tranforming one kind of resource into another one and so on.
During the later phases of the game each player can use the collected resources to buy a new card and/or die which will improve his abilities during future rounds.

The game can end in several ways (e.g. if all dice from 2 of the 4 dice markets have been bought, the last card from the deck has been drawn or one player has bought 8 cards) and the player with the most victory points (granted by the cards and through bonus conditions) wins the game.







Currently there are 2 versions of the game which will both be available through the Gamecrafter later this year:

The Deluxe version:
This version includes all the cards and all the other components needed to play the game. The resource tokens are glass beads and the game comes with cloth bags to store all the dice and gems for a high production quality version of the game.

Included in the deluxe version are:
- 56 cards
- 48 dice
- 60 gems
- 40 markers
- 4 cloth bags
- 1 start player marker
- 1 rulebook

The Redux version:
This is the version for the gamer on a small budget but with plenty of spare parts at home. The redux version comes in a small tuck-box and contains only the 56 cards and the rules. In order to play with this version who will have to provide your own dice, gems and markers. But as most people will have these things at hand already the redux version offers a very affordable way to get Alchemy Dice.
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers, Worker Placement

name: Title Chase: Football
description:
Title Chase Football is another fast-paced game using may of the techniques used in Title Chase: Basketball this time in the arena of American football. The game focuses on team building, getting into the playoffs and winning it all. Like its predecessor, Title Chase: Football should not be confused with a simulation. It is a game meant to pit players against each other and as such can be completed from the start of the season to the championship game in less than an hour.

The first half of the game is a card-driven game where you build up your team by improving aspects of the game, winning key games and gaining ground in the standings. Not every team can make the playoffs but is it worth it to you to avoid the dreaded cellar spots in each division? Do you build a powerful dynasty? Can coaching and luck to carry you through? Or maybe you just decide to rely on your defense to lock the opponent's down. The way that you build your team is up to you.

At the end of the regular season, the game switches to a full-on dice game using the teams you created during the regular season. Teams match up for playoff games where your dice are the ones you labored to improve earlier. As your dice are expended in each quarter, the game gets more and more tense and often it comes down to one final toss of the die.

Although the game does not use hard and fast statistics and has no built in way to produce them, I find that it really scratches that sports itch that I used to spend hours on back in the day with Statis-Pro Football and Football Strategy. With Title Chase Football Carla & I can play it together even though she has only a passing knowledge of the sport. The game is meant to be played by players of all levels of sporting knowledge and still be fun.
mechanics: Dice Rolling

name: Squadron Forward: A Dynamic Campaign System for WWII Aerial Games
description:
Squadron Forward is a character-based campaign system that allows you to add personality to your WWII aerial games.

Written for aerial wargames set in the Second World War, Squadron Forward focusses on the characters within your force. Its three sections allow the gamer to generate characters, to generate a range of scenarios and follow their force through a range of missions with a broad selection of events that can affect their performance in combat and interaction with other characters in a campaign setting.

This is the perfect addition to solo games as the dynamic system presents the player with a hidden enemy and provides a huge variety of potential outcomes, keeping the games interesting and allowing the unexpected to occur.

Squadron Forward is designed to bolt on to whatever set of WWII aerial rules you are using and may be easily adjusted to match your choice of game.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Book, Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Role Playing, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Götterdämmerung: Death Throes of the Reich – A Supplement for I Ain't Been Shot, Mum!
description: Götterdämmerung - This supplement gives details of how to organise and best represent your late war forces with I Ain't Been Shot Mum. Running from the start of 1943 on the banks of the Volga to the final end in Berlin, Forces covered include Brazil, Finland, France, Germany, Great Britain, Hungary, Italy, Romania, the Soviet Union and the United States. AFV and weapon stats are included along with national characteristics and what cards to use in the game deck to best represent your armies.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Stout Hearts & Iron Troopers
description:
Containing twenty scenarios, this supplement also has an extensive section on tactics of the Great War and the first six scenarios are taken directly from military training manuals of the period, giving the gamer the opportunity to learn the ropes before progressing on the the extensive selection of historical scenarios.

These range from Rommel's first ever battle in August of 1914 to the exploits of the US “Lost Battalion” in October 1918, with lots more in between covering the whole war on the Western Front, from Loos, to Verdun, the Somme, Cambrai, Passchendaele and Belleau Wood with Germans, French, British, US, Canadian, New Zealand and Australians all represented.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War I
mechanics: Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation

name: The ChangPing Campaign
description:
The ChangPing Campaign is the first free wargame to be published by War Drum Games.

The Battle of Changping (長平之戰) was a military campaign that took place during the Warring States period in China. It concluded in 260 BC with a decisive victory by the State of Qin over the State of Zhao, and ultimately allowed Qin to conquer and unify China decades later. The campaign is considered one of the most lethal military operations in history, although most of the Zhao casualties were captured soldiers executed after the battle.
mechanics: Enclosure

name: Lohai
description:
Lohai is a trick-taking game for 3-5 (typically 4) players that combines the strategy of games games like Spades, Hearts, or Euchre, adding some additional mechanics and replacing Aces and 10s with special cards such as the Mover (moves a taken trick to a different player) or the Taker (automatically takes the current trick regardless of the other cards played). There are cards added and some removed to keep the size a standard 52-card deck. It is played with a special deck of cards, most of which are standard playing cards in the regular suits of hearts, spades, clubs and diamonds, but printed with some additional information such as point totals.

The available points vary between 50 and 450 for each round, randomly determined as printed on a card turned up before each round. The player with the most tricks and the player with the fewest tricks at the end of a round score the available points. If there is a tie for most or fewest, then no one scores the points for that position. The standard game has nine-card hands, so at least one person will always score the points. A standard game is played to 1,500 points, but players can agree to raise or lower this total as they see fit.
mechanics: Trick-taking

name: Gemstone Companion
description: Gemstone Companion is a supplement to the Gemstone Fantasy Miniature System that expands the original game rules to include a point-buy system, new terrain rules, two new hero types (assassins and priests), six new scenarios, 47 new spells and prayers, 17 sample non-player characters, and 32 new creature entries. Three new optional rules are also included, along with errata to the core rulebook.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Chit-Pull System, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Heavy Gear Badlands Rally
description:
Rally racing with Gears! This expandable board game features fast paced, full contact racing set on the desert world of Terra Nova. Race around the track, burn rubber to pull ahead, jump over terrain, shoot your opponent if he gets a bit to far ahead, take a swipe at him with your vibro blade or push him in the wall. All this along with spin-outs, skids and rattled pilots bring the exciting world of Gear Rally racing to your table top. Includes a new fast and easy to learn ruleset with lots of rule and game play examples.

Badlands Rally uses D6 dice to resolve both opposed and unopposed actions. Each model, called a Gear, has a number of Attributes that distinguish its own special characteristics and advantages in the game. Players must choose what combination of attack, special movement or other actions will lead them to victory. Dice mechanics allow for quick resolution of these actions through simple rolls of varying numbers of dice depending on the modifiers that apply. All modifiers either add dice to a roll or subtract them. There are two kinds of roll: A Roll and a Check. A Roll is an unopposed test which uses a simple comparison of dice to an Attribute for a number of successes. A Check is an opposed test between players that uses the high dice in a roll and adds a bonus based on the other dice compared to an Attribute. In each lap of a game a Gear may resolve between four and six actions depending on player choices. A standard match is 2-3 laps. Variable Gear upgrades, Gear choices, and Scenarios allow for an almost infinite variety of game conditions. Additional Gear data cards are provided that allow player to use almost the entire Heavy Gear line of miniatures from Dream Pod 9 to add even more variety to their games. Up to Eight Gears can race at once with two to four players being the norm.
The box set includes rules booklet, full color hex map, 4 easy to assemble racing gear miniatures of the Rally Viper, Rally Pitbull, Rally Jerboa and Rally Ferret cast in pewter with plastic hex bases, 8 double-sided datacards (Rally Viper/Viper II, Rally Pitbull/Pitbull II, Rally Jerboa/Jerboa II, Rally Ferret/Ferret II, Rally Grizzly/Mamba, Rally Cobra/Chasseur MkII, Rally Sapeur/Iguana, and Rally Hunter/Dart Jager), assorted counters (rattled tracker gears, rattled, rally, damage, and upgrades) , 2 double-sided quick reference cards (rules and weapons/upgrades), and 6 dice. The double-sided Rally Grizzly/Mamba, Rally Cobra/Chasseur MkII, Rally Sapeur/Iguana, and Rally Hunter/Dart Jager datacards can also be used to proxy in other similar size gears from the Heavy Gear Blitz and Arena miniature lines.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Push Your Luck, Variable Phase Order, Variable Player Powers

name: The Tenth Dragon
description:
When Godd created the Wurld, she saw that it was beautiful, full of green mountains, white shores, and blue seas. Godd wanted to display the Wurld to all Creation, and so she hung the Wurld in the Heavens, suspended by nine gold chains gripped by nine dragons. A great Torch was placed in the mouth of a tenth dragon, who circled the Wurl to give it warmth and light.

But now, something is wrong with the tenth dragon. The great torch appears to be receding from the Wurld. It is growing colder and darker. Snow is falling in the harvest month. The crops are withering and dying. Furred beasts are descending from the north, wild and ravenous.

You are the Dragon Priestess of your village, a healer of great skill. The people under your care look to you for hope. Knowing that time is precious, you gather supplies and prepare for a journey north, to the Shrine of the Tenth Dragon. Only there do you have any hope of conversing with Godd and the Tenth Dragon. Only there can you learn what must be done to return warmth to the Wurld and save your village.

The Tenth Dragon is a solitaire card-based push-your-luck game in which you, the player, must overcome harsh winds, blinding snow, and hungry beasts in order to reach the Shrine of the Tenth Dragon. Each card has multiple purposes, with an event, a twist, and an item or boon to help you through your quest. Progress through the deck three times, each time with slightly different rules. If you survive, you win!
mechanics: Push Your Luck

name: Psycho-Slasher: The Game
description:
Psycho-Slasher: The Game is a 30-page miniatures game homage to the low budget slasher films of the 1970's and 1980's, playable in any scale from 15mm to 54mm.

Psycho-Slasher is easy to learn, and fun to play, with each player acting as a Writer and running their own Slasher. The competing Slashers don't interact directly, but the Writers have the ability to hinder or help other Slashers with the placement of new weapons, or, more importantly, manipulating the horde of Pawns (Victims) that populate the Slasher film tableau.

You say that you love the idea, but that you don't have miniatures for a game like this? No problem! Included with the game are printable paper miniatures... you get 5 distinct Slashers, a Cop, and 4 distinct Pawns. Print as many Pawns and Cops as you need, snip, fold, glue, and you are all set! Also included are printable Weapon counters, and Pawn Special counters that introduce twists to the game like Phones (self-explanatory,) Beer (dangerous for Pawns), and Hysteria (AHHHHH!!!).

Whenever a Slasher ends his/her movement in contact with a Pawn or Cop, the Slasher must conduct an attack. If the Attack is successful your Slasher removes the Pawn from the board, earning Collection Points.

Collection Points translate into ratings, or popularity, for the Writer’s Slasher and Slasher story line. So, earning Collection Points in the game, while preventing rival Slashers from collecting points when you can, is how you can win the game.

Not recommended for children under the age of 16. This is meant to be a fun game, based on a movie genre, and does not take itself seriously... still, the subject matter may not be appropriate for everyone.
categories: Dice, Exploration, Fighting, Horror, Mature / Adult, Print & Play
mechanics: Action Points, Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Paper-and-Pencil, Role Playing, Roll / Spin and Move, Variable Phase Order, Variable Player Powers

name: Bulwark: Fires of Fury
description:
From publisher description:

Heroic Co-operative Deck-Building!

Armies boast about their strength and courage, but none are so fool-hardy as to boast that they could fight a dragon. You're tougher than an army, though, right?

More Options

Fires of Fury is a Foe deck with particularly powerful crown Foes. Although you don't have to kill them at first, they inflict damage on their way past and at the climax of the game they all appear at once.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Variable Player Powers

name: Bulwark: Jedrzej the Hurler
description:
From publisher description:

Heroic Co-operative Deck-Building!

Jedrzej lived to fight, and that meant death for those he fought. After years building a reputation as a combatant to be feared, there was little left that could stand against him. When at last he returned to his home, he found his tribe annihilated and its customs forgotten. In his zeal for the thrill of battle, he had lost sight of its cost. He resolved to keep his axes at his side unless he found a good enough reason to heft them.

More Options

Jedrzej the Hurler is a new Hero deck, fully compatible with the base game. He brings a little of everything to the table - multiple attacks, strong attacks, ranged attacks, Wound removal and Wound denial.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Variable Player Powers

name: VOR: The Maelstrom – Union
description:
Leave no Man Behind!

Earth is facing its most desperate hour. The Union Armed Forces, well trained and equipped with the best weapons technology can offer, have mobilized to defend their world from the sinister Neo-Soviet empire and all Maelstrom-borne threats. Orbital strikes, high-powered laser cannons and specialized missiles allow the Union to dominate a battle from a distance as their special forces squads, drones, and power-armored troops close with the enemy to deliver the decisive blow!

The Union Forcebook describes the fierce and determined Union Armed Forces, providing background on the formation of the Union and describing its unparalleled military organization and weaponry. The Union Force List offers new units, drones and the Ares assault suits. This book also contains a North America Battle Terrain Table, rules for orbital strikes and deployment, and new campaign rules, including force traits.
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Secret Unit Deployment, Simulation, Variable Player Powers

name: Fissile Commander
description:
Two civilizations are on the brink of destruction. It has come down to this, the final battle that will determine the fate of both. Desperate for victory, all cities have become launch sites for the most advanced missile systems ever seen.

The winner must exhibit equal parts power and cunning in order to survive the coming maelstrom. Fissile Commander is a new generation of deck building game. Use your deck to launch missiles at your enemy and prepare your defenses against their attacks.

Balance military might, financial prowess, cunning gadgets, and scientific advancement to win the day by destroying three enemy cities.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Card Game, Science Fiction, Space Exploration, Video Game Theme, Wargame
mechanics: Action Queue, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Grid Movement, Take That

name: Schnucksopoly
description:
A Late for the Sky "-opoly" game based on the Schnucks chain of Supermarkets located in and around the Saint Louis, Missouri area, in honor of their 75th Anniversary.

Game includes:

Metal Pewter Tokens (Shopping Cart [or Buggy], Mortar & Pestle, Steak, Milk Bottle, Schnucks Toy Solider, a Hand of Bananas, Schnucks Truck [Semi, Big Rig, Tractor Trailer, 18-wheeler style], and the Schnucks "S" Logo)

Red Houses and Blue Hotels

Red & Yellow themed board, featuring "departments" as properties, "Paper" and "Plastic" as draw-a-card spaces (like "Chance" and "Community Chest"), "Cart Corral / Get a Cart" (like "Jail / Just Visiting"), "Go to Cart Corral", and "Customer Parking" (like "Free Parking")

The Department Deed Cards (property cards) have "Fun Facts" about Schnucks on the reverse/mortgaged side.

Instructions (including 1-hour version) & 2-dice

Back-of-the-box description:

Schnucks 75 Anniversary 1939 - 2014

Win Big Every Time You Shop!
Scnucksopoly is a classic property trading game we created to have fun and celebrate our 75th Anniversary!

In 1939, Edwin (Pop) and Anna (Mom) Schnuck started a small confectionery in North St. Louis. Since then, the Schnuck family has been committed to bringing you quality fresh foods, value, variety, and service for 75 years. We wouldn't have been able to without all of our dedicated teammates and you, our customers. Thank you for your loyalty, business, and support.

We want YOU to help us celebrate - so play along and learn a thing or two about Schnucks over the past 75 years. Just be sure to shop wisely and look for spectacular food experiences along the way... and Customer Parking!

Here's a Quick Idea on How to Play:

Take a trip around Schnucksopoly and buy your favorite departments from Nancy Anne Lane to Meat Masters Way. Make a stop at Rose Road and Wellness Way. Increase your rent by buying homes and trading them in for hotels.

So choose a Schnucks Truck or Soldier and START SHOPPING! Fill your cart with the most money, and YOU WIN!

Let's have fun! We're celebrating Schnucks grocery store 75th Anniversary - and it's YOUR ROLL!

Made in the U.S.A.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Dice Rolling, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Stock Holding, Trading
publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company

name: Zeppeldrome: Faceoff
description:
Zeppeldrome: Faceoff is set in the same steam punk world as its multi-player namesake, Zeppeldrome. It is a serious race through silly obstacles for two-players, with a hazardous board and cards that are used to help you or mess with your opponent as you both race to be the first to travel the length of the airship raceway.

The first player over the finish line is the winner!

The boards one center piece contains a mixture of hazards. Additionally, 2/3 of the deck are variants of Zeppeldrome's cards, but the remaining 1/3 are all new.
mechanics: Action Queue

name: Duelga
description:
Duelga is a dueling card game based on martial arts from history, lore, and myth.

Two to four players choose a duelist, give them a unique combination of Weapons and Styles, then build twenty card decks with half offense and half defense Action cards. With 8 duelists, 20 Styles, 12 Weapons, and over 120 Action cards the possibilities are nearly endless.

Duelist cards are placed in play head to head. All four character sides have a separate offense and a defense rating from 0-6. Each player draws their starting hand and the game begins.

During a turn a player draws two cards and can perform two actions, a Move and a Strike. A player may Move their duelist by either rotating 90 degrees or stepping diagonally - maintaining contact with the opponent. Striking requires that you line up one of your Duelist's attack angles toward his opponent. Both Movement and Strike actions can be modified by offensive cards in hand. After a Strike is declared the opposing player may play defense cards from their hand to mitigate or even cancel the damage. If the Strike is successful the attack value is compared to the defense value and the difference is the damage dealt to the opposing Duelist. Each Duelist starts out with 40 hit points. The last Duelist standing wins.
mechanics: Grid Movement, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: King's Pouch
description:
King's Pouch is pouch-building strategy game set in a medieval kingdom. Each round offers tough choices on how to expand your pool of citizens and buildings. Using the resources you acquire, you may raise powerful armies or secure the support of powerful characters.

Will you be a peaceful protector of the royal family? Or maybe a warlord, taking what he wants by force? Or will you make a wrong step and fail to write your name in the annals of history? Take up the King's Pouch and find out!
categories: City Building, Medieval, Print & Play, Territory Building
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Worker Placement

name: What's The Question?
description:
What's The Question? is a party game involving discussion and debate. Two players represent two sides. The rest of the player are voters. All players write down a subject of a topic. In this example, we'll say "Fictional Characters". After everyone has written something on a piece of paper (Or in our prototype version, our curved white boards) and placed it in the middle of the table, they are shuffled and the two players choose one. That choice will be the sides they are representing. In this example, we will say "Superman" and "Darth Vader". On the other side of the card is the question. In this example, the question may be "Who would win in a fight?" Now is the time that it is revealed and the two players begin the debate. Players may do anything in their power to get the other players to vote for their side. Points are earned by winning a debate and voting for a winner.

What's The Question? is a great game for any crowd. Because the players create the content, the game can be used in a family atmosphere, or amongst your friends over a long night of drinks. This game takes the idea of sitting around with your friends while you debate about things that don't matter, then adding a random element to it fueled by the players.

Planned expansions include adult themed pack, intelligence pack, and much more!
mechanics: Voting

name: Gunman's Law
description:
In the West, there’s only one law that everyone understands; that guarantees a quick and decisive verdict; and that treats all people as equals . . . and that’s the Gunman’s Law!

Not since the inception of TSR’s classic Boot Hill has there been a game that captures the flavor and deadliness of the old West like Gunman’s Law. Carefully blending the historic with the cinematic, Gunman’s Law recreates the gunfights of the mid-to-late 1800s with an unprecedented mix of versatility and verisimilitude.

Gunman’s Law allows both the solo player and multiple players (either "versus" or cooperatively) to recreate everything from the classic one-on-one showdown in a town’s main street to deadly ambushes. Hire your gun out to farmers being pushed off their land by a local cattle baron, or go to the aid of the town’s lawman who has to ride out to where a group of stagecoach robbers are reputedly hiding.

Part board game, part RPG and great for use with miniatures, Gunman’s Law breaks new ground by using a multi-purpose Fast Action Card deck to determine everything from a shootist’s speed and accuracy, reaction to danger, damage done and effect of that damage.
mechanics: Role Playing, Simulation

name: Brangle
description:
Brangle is a party game for four or more players. The game is played with a deck of 54 cards, each with three topics or categories written on one side. One player draws a card and selects the first, second, or third category (by choice or convention, depending on which set of rules is used). The player then names something that belongs to the category, prompting the next player to do the same, and so on. Play continues in this fashion until a player cannot give an answer in a reasonable amount of time (typically about 2 seconds) or repeats an answer previously used during the round. Once a player loses the round, they place the card in front of them, and draw a new card to begin the next round. The player with the fewest cards in front of them after 54 rounds is the winner.

The rules included in Brangle offer suggestions for modifying gameplay. One example is to play an "elimination game" in which players are removed from the game after accumulating three cards. The last player remaining is the winner. It is also suggested that the game can end after a predetermined amount of time (30 minutes) instead of playing through the entire deck of cards. Another suggestion is to allow players to choose which of the three categories on each card they want to play, rather than always choosing the first, second or third.

Creative or unusual answers and responses are highly encouraged. An excerpt from the rules: "For the category, “things that roll”, a creative answer could be “stones” (Rolling Stones), “Rick Astley” (Rick Roll), or “spring” (spring-roll) ".

Brangle was created by a small group of US Marines and RAF Airmen in Afghanistan in 2011, and later developed into a commercial product by a member of that group after his service was completed in 2013.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles: Adventures Under Turtleopolis
description:
Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles: Adventures Under Turtleopolis, is graphically based on the late 80's cartoon that originated from the comic book by Kevin Eastman and Peter Laird.

2 to 4 players play as one of the four Turtles competing around the board while trying to avoid traps and bad luck spaces. The object of the game is to reach the end of each game board, which supposedly represent a different mission:

Game 1: Rescue April
Game 2: Take Over The Technodrome
Game 3: Battle to Stop the Ooze
Game 4: Race for the Pizza Parlor

These four boards came on the back of the Ralston Cereal Boxes and as such are in conjunction a very simplistic version of similar games like "Snakes and Ladders". Just throw the dice and let luck decide in which space you´ll end up. Some spaces have rewards while others punishments. In reality is what you can expect from a board game that came on a cereal box, but it has a lot of charm and richness of details in the drawings and graphic design.

There was another Ralston´s TMNT cereal box board game called "Adventures In Turtleopolis" that came out during the same time, but it didn´t have art as nice as this nor as much TMNT thematic enemies and elements such as the Technodrome or the sewers.
categories: Animals, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Racing
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move

name: Kruglowka Railway
description:
A previously unpublished expansion for the ASL system. Included as an insert to Tactical Wargamer's Journal, Issue 1.

Kruglowka Railway is a two-player scenario depicting the fighting near the Dneiper River in July 1941. In addition to the scenario, extensive playtest notes and historical articles are included.

Tactical Wargamer's Journal (ISSN 1918-9729), published on a non-regular schedule, covers topics of interest on all aspects of the world of commercial tactical wargaming, with its focus set on warfare at the man-to-man, squad and platoon level in the 20th Century and contemporary era. Tactical Wargamer's Journal (TWJ) places emphasis on both military history and the history of tactical level gaming itself.

Issue 1 focuses on the history of the Großdeutschland Regiment from 1939-1942, and the GD is featured prominently in this scenario.
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Line of Sight

name: Anima Tactics: Type-020 – Verrier
description:
Publisher Blurb:

Type-20 is the troop transport from hell. Everything about this unit is geared towards dropping something really nasty off right where you don't want it. A combination of Infiltration and Flight means that Type-20 can really get wherever it wants to go. Along with this, it brings a few painful tricks to make your opponents wince every time they see it on the table.

Neutral Black Sun Warrior Undead — Lv. 30+
At 4/5 | Dm 4/5 | Df 9 | Ar 2 | LP 15 | Re 10 | Mo 8/12 | AP 3/4
Influence: 1 Uncontrollable: 10+
Availability: Type-020's aren’t unique and you may include 1 for every 150 levels available to your party.
Innate Abilities: Advanced Deployment, Damage Resistance, Flight, Infiltration.
Decay: At the end of the Maintenance Phase, enemy units within the Type-020's Control Zone lose 1 LP. Effect 14.
oo — Shadow Wings (Magic, Effect)
Enemy units within the Type-020's Control Zone suffer Blind Lv. 1. Effect 15.
ooo — Gaunt Wings (Magic, Charge)
+2 Attack. If this Charge causes damage, and the targeted unit doesn't have a larger base than Type-020's, the target is moved from the Type-020 along its line of charge the same distance that the Type-020 charged. This movement doesn't affect intervening units or terrain, so no collisions will result.
oo — Deployment Wings (Magic, Effect)
Move any number of Undead units, of level 40 or lower, in your party to be within Type-020's Control Zone. Each unit is moved and repositioned separately and may be anywhere within Type-020's Control Zone, though they can't be placed within 2 inches of an enemy unit. This ability can't affect engaged units. Limit: Once per game.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling

name: Morph Chess
description: 6 pieces per player, 6 chess-like movement types, and a special twist: you must roll to determine which piece to move, or optionally, move your King in the same way as another piece. Capture the opposing King and win.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Doom Tomb Tactics
description:
Journey treacherous tombs, vanquish vile creatures, defend your homeland from ancient evil. Oh, and don't forget to grab the loot!

Doom Tomb Tactics is a strategy-adventure game which pits one or two players against The Wretched, a dark and powerful force who has returned from the grave to strike fear into the hearts of the peaceful Onakwan people.

Each player assumes the role of one of four classic characters, each with their own unique skills and abilities. Heroes traverse four different Levels, infiltrating Tombs in an attempt to slay the abominations within, and if successful, claim defeated Wretchs' Loot, which can later be used to purchase Artifacts including weapons, armor, and spells. During exploration and combat, Heroes spend Power Tokens to activate and resolve Artifacts and Special Abilities, and can also seek out Treasure, including more Loot and Power Tokens, but beware. Sometimes it's a Trap!

Each level is constructed with four Maps. The first three of these maps are completely randomized, and contain various obstacles and enemies, while the last map contains the level's Tomb Boss. To accomplish their Quest, the Heroes of Onakwa must fight their way through these Forbidden Tombs and defeat all four Tomb Bosses, including the dreaded Zhakoros.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Modular Board

name: The Three Pillars: Allies & Adversaries Expansion Set
description:
With six additional locations to investigate, and twenty-four new event cards, including a sub-class of Personalities to encounter, this fun expansion will certainly add a new twist to the game. Now you will be able to utilize abilities from a Support Team to help you close cases, but be advised your opponent will also have access to them as well. And beware, not everyone you encounter will be on your on your side!
You can add these new cards to your core set, or choose to supplement the Cases and Events Decks with the Allies & Adversaries expansion.
mechanics: Pick-up and Deliver, Take That

name: Crossfire Hurricane: The Battle of Long Tan – August 18, 1966
description:
The High Flying Dice Games edition has multiple changes from the previous Firefight Games edition. For example, it has changes to line of sight rules, some OOB revisions (making the entry of the Australian reinforcements a bit more "worrisome"), and the map is completely redone.


Revised edition of the largest battle between the Australians and NVA in 1966 Vietnam.
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Line of Sight

name: Bulwark: Ahuli of the Tin Clan
description:
From publisher description:

Heroic Co-operative Deck-Building!

Ahuli is hard-working guardsdwarf from a minor Clan, with one hell of a reputation for controlled violence and shrugging off attacks that would kill feeble humans. Strap on his heavy armour, take up his warhammer and demonstrate exactly why dwarves shuld never be taken lightly.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Variable Player Powers

name: Jump Sturdy
description:
Jump Sturdy is a game originally designed by MindSports. The game is played on an 8×8 board with corners removed. Each player starts with twelve pieces positioned in the center six columns of their two home rows.

Over the course of the game, pieces can form stacks of two pieces. The player who owns the top piece in the stack owns that stack. Single pieces can move one space sideways or forward. They capture one space forward diagonally. Stacks of two pieces move and capture with the four forward moves of a chess knight. Only the top piece in the stack executes the movement or capture; the bottom piece does not move.

A player can complete a movement onto either an empty space or a single friendly piece. A capture can be executed onto any enemy piece or stack. In both cases, capture occurs by replacement; the enemy piece is removed and the friendly piece is put in its place. In the case of a stack, only the top piece is replaced.

The player who reaches the opponent’s home row first wins.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement

name: Hurt Locker
description:
All begins at the time you enter the KILL ZONE. KILL ZONE, an area where a bomb is planted within a radius of 25m, is so dangerous because of the possibility of an explosion. You, as an EOD agent, must render the bomb safe. But be careful! There is a spy in your team who wants the bomb to be set off. I wish you could carry out the duty and come back…

Goal
Each player will be a dealer (spy) in turn. Players including the dealer are charged with the bomb disposal mission. There are 8 wires on the bomb, but only one of them is a detonator. If you successfully cut the wire except the detonator, you will be promoted to the next rank as a reward. Otherwise, however, you and your companion will be demoted if the bomb is exploded. With several missions, the player with the highest rank wins the game.

Game Play
At the start of game, each player takes own rank tiles. The player with the lowest rank takes the Dealer Tile and starts the game as a first dealer (spy).
The player with the lowest rank starts the turn. Each player performs one of the following actions on their turn: Cutting a wire or Play a card.

Cutting a wire: Place a Nipper Tile on one of the wires of the Game Board. You cannot place a Nipper Tile on previously cut wires. If a player cut a non-detonator wire, the dealer should announce ‘Promotion’ (Or should say some words to announce such as ‘Success’ or ‘Safe’). The player is promoted one step higher. The turn goes to the next player (the player with the lowest rank).
Bomb Disposal: If all wires except the detonator are cut, the bomb is rendered safe. All players successfully complete their mission, and the round ends. However, the dealer is caught being a spy, and he will be demoted one step lower.
Bomb Explosion (Cutting a detonator): While playing a round, if a player cut the detonator, the dealer announces ‘Boom!’ The bomb is exploded, and the round ends immediately. The player who cut the detonator will be demoted two steps lower. Also, the player(s) on his left/right side will be demoted a step lower.


The round ends when the bomb is disposed or exploded. Start the next round with the current rank.

Game ends
The game ends if any of the following situations occur:

All players played as a dealer once each. (The round is played as the number of players.)
A player achieved the rank ‘General of the Army (Lv. 23)’ (The game ends immediately.)
A player is demoted even lower than the rank ‘Private (Lv. 0)’ (The game ends immediately.)


After the game ends, the player with the highest rank wins the game.
mechanics: Hand Management, Push Your Luck, Tile Placement

name: Nervíky
description:
A dexterity game.

NOTE: Nervíky (Czech/Slovak) = nerves (to be more precise: little nerves).

Set-up: One player (the catcher) has a small cup, and a die with different colours on its faces. The other players each have a differently-coloured wooden piece (yellow, red, green, or blue) with a string attached to it.

Aim of the game: Players try to receive the least amount of penalty points for their poor reaction times.

Game play:

Variant no. 1

The catcher rolls the die, if the roll is yellow, red, green, or blue, he/she tries to catch, with his/her cup, the colour rolled. If he/she rolls white, he/she attempts to catch all of the colours; if he/she rolls black, he/she is not allowed to catch anything. The other players, according to the result of the roll, either try to escape (by pulling on the string) or do nothing.

Variant no. 2

The catcher says three colours at random (e.g., green, blue, black) and rolls the die.
If he/she rolls one of the colours he/she said, he/she tries to catch as many of the other players as possible and the other players try to escape as quickly as possible (again by pulling on the string). If the catcher rolls a different colour than he/she said, the other players do nothing.

Scoring Points:

There is a penalty point to the catcher if he/she does not catch any of the other players, or if he/she accidentally catches any of the other players.

There is a penalty point to the other players (with coloured pieces with strings) if they are caught by the catcher, or if they accidentally pull their pieces back.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Outflank
description:
From the creator:

A border-less strategy game where players attempt to surround and outflank their opponent(s) without leaving themselves open to attack in kind. No formation can be strong everywhere though, and advancing and retreating can be equally important. Expand around your opponent's placements and leave your options open while closing off your opponent's. Outflank lasts between 30 minutes and an hour on average and plays either two player or four players in teams.

Theme:

Outflank is themed towards medieval pike warfare, advancing in formations linked back to their starting formation and attempting to find the weak spots in enemy formations.

The theme is light since the game is an abstract.

Gameplay:

Starting from fixed positions, players build out formations to surround and entrap their opponent using limited number of actions each turn. With seven actions a turn you can advance or withdraw cards from the field based on the number of soldiers on the individual tiles. You can also use your actions to draw additional tiles or mercenaries that can augment your cards for further costs. The aim of the game is to take four of your opponent's tiles in a four player game and 6 in a four player team game (combined total with your ally).
mechanics: Action Points, Enclosure, Tile Placement

name: Shibumi Rule Book
description: The Shibumi set is the simplest and most elegant of game systems, yet it hides surprising depth. This book introduces the system, its philosophy and mechanisms, and describes the complete rules for over 30 games. These include the best entries from the Shibumi Challenge game design contest, along with several solitaire puzzles and multi-player games.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Mini Prix
description:
In Mini Prix, you are both team manager & driver for your team. The object of the game is that each player should try to qualify his cars as far up the grid as possible & then beat all the other cars in the race. The winner is the first car to cross the finish line.

A motor racing roll and move with a push your luck element.
Using 3d6 to determine your speed off the line, you can then accelerate & decelerate during your turn in order to safely negotiate the track. Attempting to take a corner at too high a speed results in rolling the dice against your car's current roadworthiness which can result in further damage or even crashing out of the race.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Push Your Luck, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Empyrion
description:
The world is not as it once was. After years of tension between the mega corporations and corrupt bureaucrats, civilization is made up of vast independent city-states. You are the leader of one of Empyrion’s ruling classes, a Scion of the state. The current Grand Scion, and his ruling faction, have grown fat and ignorant in their affluence. This indulgence is weakness, an opportunity a shrewd Scion would be able to turn into advantage. You are not the only one to have seen it; the other castes have noticed, so make certain you are swift to act. Through cunning and intrigue, and perhaps even diplomacy, navigate the unforgiving political realities of this new world to position your faction as the next ruling class. Only one may be the Grand Scion of Empyrion; make sure it is you.

Empyrion is a deck-building resource gathering card game where you compete against 2-5 rival Scions by gathering or stealing resources and shoring up your faction by recruiting specialized citizens to work for you or building unique buildings which confer long lasting and expansive powers. Focus on building, or blocking your opponents building as you vie to gain enough influence points to claim the title of Grand Scion and ruler over all of Empyrion!
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Colonial Space Wars: Flesh and Steel
description:
Colonial Space Wars: Flesh and Steel is an expansion for the sci-fi wargame Colonial Space Wars: New Horizons.

Several new units, skills and missions are now available for this strategic game without dice.

Each player takes the role of one Commander, leading his army and challenging others in a desperate massive ground battle. Only a leader that excels in strategic planning, military tactics and resource management will prevail.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board

name: Bizoo
description:
Bizoo consists 112 cards with different animals.
The aim is to form the couples with the same type of animals to achieve the highest score at the end of the game.

Each player gets 8 cards at the beginning of the game and in his turn player may perform one of the 2 possible actions:
a) form a couple and draw 2 new cards from the deck
or
b) activate an action of any of his cards.
Each animal species have its own ability.

The game ends when a player:

reaches the score of 45 points with couples;
or lays his last card on the table.


The winner is the one that has the most points.
mechanics: Hand Management, Set Collection

name: Slaughterball: Team Gruesomes
description:
Perhaps the toughest team in the league, the Gruesomes have yet to prove themselves as contenders to the Slaughterbrawl crown. Like their other teams inspired by classic literature, Chemozoic Incorporated contracted Honeydew Labs to create this team genetic template. And while the athletes certainly look the part, their traits and skills have made it difficult to rack up the victories necessary to snag the championship.

The Gruesomes as a team rely on their resilience and sheer strength to dominate opponents and survive attacks. Unfortunately, they lack the hand-eye coordination and speed to have full access to all possible Slaughterball strategies. Indeed, their shooting game is perennially inadequate. Even so, previous coaches have managed to build them into a respectable foe over the course of a season by training them with new skills and concentrating on the strategies explained below.

Coaching the Gruesomes is a challenging task, but your victories will be that much sweeter knowing it was your coaching ability, not the athleticism of your athletes, that won the day. They are slower and less accurate than other teams, and as such you cannot rely on a shooting game to win. Instead, you should doggedly attack your opponents, even taking risky chops to knock them down. You should be chopping every turn. And get everyone moved toward the center of the pit as soon as possible. Field coverage is imperative for the Gruesomes, so they are always in range to attack someone.

Your athletes’ resilience will help them stay out of the Slaughter Box, and the great Brawling values will usually result in chop success. Once you have your opponent on the ground, send your slashers and butchers over to foul them on the ground and then cancel any Penalty cards with the Scare Ref skill.

Interrupt cards are very important to your fouling strategy, so be sure to cycle through your hand quickly. If you don’t have any Interrupt cards, discard your whole hand to find some. Being able to attack prone opponents and get four extra dice is paramount. Especially when you can avoid Penalties.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Sports
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Armor & Ash
description:
Armor & Ash is a medieval fantasy themed battle card game for two players. The base set contains four different factions, each with its own unique warriors, heroes, spells, and arcane items.

Control a band of Vikings, Forest Elves, Ghob-lings, or Undead and unleash havoc and devastation on your foes. Defeat the opposing Hero or eliminate their army and declare yourself the victor.

Faction decks are pre-constructed, so there is nothing to collect or anything additional to buy. Each faction deck contains:
19 Common Units
1 Elite Unit
3 Heroes (only 1 is used during game play)
5 Spells
2 Items

In Armor & Ash, players roll dice to score wounds on opposing units. Units remain on the Battlefield until they receive enough wounds to be defeated.
Spells may be played at any time.
Heroes can move freely in and out of battle.
There is no resource pool threshold needed to recruit units.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Valour
description:
BCE 58: Julius Caesar is broke. His time as proconsul has cost him most of his personal fortune, and much of his clout within the Republic. Luckily, he is still in command of Rome’s most prestigious army. He has heard rumors of the riches coming back with the traders from Gaul. When reports of unrest among the Helvetii and a threat of invasion from the Germanic Suebi, the opportunity could be ripe for him to “help” the Gauls…

Take on the role of a Gallic chieftain as you rally your tribe in an ultimately futile attempt to turn back the tides of history. You will navigate your chieftain pawn around the map while generating and spending site-located resources (food, wood, wine, and gold) to amass an army and build the roads for them to travel. As you choose where to deploy your your defenses, Caesar and his generals begin a slow buy inexorable march from Rome, taking city by city until nothing is left. Do you race to the front? Or do you hunker down and wait for the final battle? Or do you use one of the small selection of political action cards to collaborate with the invading forces and hope for the best?

Make sure Caesar tells the world about you and your tribe as he executes his campaign of glory, and guarantee your place in history.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Football
description: Board game Football is a simulation of the real sport football (soccer). Each player has 11 figurines (10 players and one goalkeeper). In one move player rolls two dices, black determines how many fields one figurine moves and white for how many fields moves the ball. The ball can be moved only if a figurine of a player is next to it. When figurine player is moving - it can push the ball with it. At the end of its movement ball can be 'shot' to another own figurine or into the net. When the ball figurine enters the 'goal' that is score. The opponent puts the ball on the center of the board and begins new action. Players agree on how long the game lasts.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Simulation

name: Supersonična trka
description:
Supersonična trka is a very simple game for 2 to 4 players. Board has 3D elements.

Each player has one plane. All planes circle around the airport. There are several paths that are intertwined. Shorter paths have more obstacles (clouds) that slow down the planes. The winner is the player whose plane first gets to the finish line.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement

name: IFC: Intergalactic Fight Club
description:
Let's bring the past and the future to the present with this awesome fighting card and dice game. Come join the action packed, fast paced, imaginary galaxy described as Street Fighter meets pro wrestling! Welcome to the IFC!

This game takes elements of various games and molded its own to create what is now the IFC. It's a simple fight game that has no crazy charts, move cards or other wacky add ons...just simple cards with vibrant characters, dice and your imagination.

Set up a fight card, play the matches, create the drama...it's all about letting your imagination run wild!
categories: Card Game, Fighting, Science Fiction, Sports
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Storytelling, Take That

name: Star Trails
description:
Star trails is a simple game for younger players. While playing children can learn about the solar system. The task to orbit the solar system with space shuttle and make photos of planets and asteroids.

Points are collected in two ways. The first way by reaching finish line (first gets 12 points, second 10, third 8 ...). Another way is to collect counters. Each counter brings 1 point. The winner is the player who ends up with the most points.
categories: Children's Game, Collectible Components, Educational, Space Exploration
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement

name: Sergeants D-Day: Chapter 4 Merderet Fields
description:
The fields near the Merderet River are flooded, leaving winding paths mixed with deep pools that hamper movement.

Includes: 16 Story cards and Map Tiles 65, 66, 67, 68, 69, 70, 79, 80

(Contains; 8 tiles and 16 cards)

First sold during Kickstarter for the base game.
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven

name: Viteška trka
description:
Knight race. The game presents racing of knights. There are different paths. Players roll dice and move figurines in direction of paths.

First who reach finish gets the most points, but points are also received by collecting counters along the path, by standing on marked field next to counter. The winner is the player who ends up with the most points.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement

name: Wild West Exodus: Unfinished Business – Confederate Rebellion Faction Bundle
description:
Wild West Exodus is a table top miniatures game set in a sci-fi filled 1800's America. Technology and greed rule the old west. Wild West Exodus: Unfinished Business introduces 4 new factions to the game; The Confederate Rebellion, Dark Nation, Golden Army, and The Watchers.

About The Confederate Rebellion:
The Confederate Rebellion army has seen death and destruction ravage their states.
