Command and control cards drive the action, enabling a player to tailor his emphasis on building units, gathering intelligence, conducting operations, or building up supplies. The map has been given a graphic update. The air war is updated and enhanced and the OOB presents the latest research with all units at a battalion level (armor in companies and air units in squadrons). Now it's the ultimate North Africa simulation.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Moody Cat
description:
This cat is soooo moody!
He'll switch from happy to angry in one step.

In this game you play as a mischievous alley spirit on a mission to earn silver feather points by affecting Moody Cat's mood as he's prancing down your alley. As a spirit you are forbidden to affect the cat’s mood directly so you'll have to enlist help from other creatures. Keep in mind that there are other alley spirits competing for the points and will try to outsmart you in their efforts to earn more points than you. So unleash your spirit power to meddle with the Moody Cat.

Typically played as a set number of game rounds with score keeping after each game. The winner is determined after the last game in a set.
mechanics: Open Drafting, Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition

name: Quatsch Koffer packen
description:
From the Publisher:

"I'm packing into my suitcase ..." - and the number of things being remembered is getting longer! Now two games in one: classic with travel luggage or even witty with crazy grimaces and movements!

"I pack in my suitcase ..." and the series of memorized things is getting longer. Now two games in one: classic with travel luggage or even witty with crazy grimaces and movements!
The classic is even more fun now!
mechanics: Memory, Pattern Building

name: Dust Tactics: Iron Joe
description: A legend among the GRU Spetsnaz, “Iron Joe” leads all SSU special operations in Africa and the Middle-East at the same time. Which is pretty much all the Soviets can afford in the region, since they fight on too many fronts for their own good. Definitely one of the craftiest generals on the planet, Kameron makes the best out of it and maintains the pressure with the limited amount of troops he has. But these are the most elite of soldiers, and their general makes sure that every operation is carefully planned: they make up their number in efficiency.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Modular Board

name: Bushido: Ghost
description:
From where he came from and who he is a mystery to all in the Kage Kaze Zoku save for the grand master. He never speaks and is never seen without his mask, it seems to the rest of his fellow shadow crows that he neither has need to eat nor sleep, spending most of his time on the training fields. None would ever consider questioning his place amongst them though. The word of the grand master is unquestioned and beside that fact the man fights like a demon.

Blister contains one model, one 30mm base and one full colour profile card.
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Dust Tactics: Spetsnaz Command Squad – "Task Force Command"
description: The Spetsnaz SSU special forces have infiltrated deep in Mesopotamia. The newly formed chaos of Operation Babylon will be a new hunting ground for these ruthless men... The Spetsnaz Command Squad is a special unit of field officers whose skills are invaluable. They are equipped with automatic rifles, a machine gun and a flamethrower, and their presence on the battlefield can change the entire course of battle, thanks to their invaluable skills. A wise general should take care to protect these experienced officers.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Modular Board

name: Dust Tactics: Spetsnaz Saboteur Squad – "Saboteurs"
description: Today the missions of the Spetsnaz Saboteur Squad have changed a bit, but the basics are the same: making big explosions that will cripple the enemy. Like other Spetsnaz forces, the Saboteurs use the AK-45 as their main weapon, though they don’t use it much - when they open fire it’s because they have been discovered, or it’s too late and they already have planted their charges.
categories: Miniatures, Science Fiction, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Modular Board

name: Dust Tactics: KV-47K (TSH) Light Gatling Walker – "Aleksei"
description: Special men with special missions need special equipment. The KV-47K (TSH - Tropicheskiy Shagokhod or ‘Tropical Walker’), codenamed ‘Aleksei’ is the perfect example of this maxim, as it was developed specifically for Spetsnaz units. Thanks to the walker being open-topped, its pilot suffers much less from the heat and has a better view and understanding of his surroundings. It sure makes him more vulnerable, but at least he’s not completely cooked at the end of the day. It also makes the walker lighter, which greatly increases its capacity to be transported to remote places.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Modular Board

name: Dust Tactics: IS-5D Heavy Tesla Tank – "Aleksandr Vasilevsky"
description:
For hundreds of millions of citizens of the Sino-Soviet Union, Iosef Stalin is the Supreme Leader, whose wisdom will guide them to victory. For the enemies of the SSU, the name means death. Many of the SSU’s early heavy tanks were named after Kliment Voroshilov, the Defense Commissar. When it was time for a new and improved series, who better to name it after than the Supreme Leader himself?
The “Aleksandr” is the latest version of the IS-5, mounting two impressive Tesla Guns that fire on the same target. The result is devastating again any type of target but particularly against armor. The vehicle is presented here in its Babylon pattern camouflage, as observed around Mesopotamia circa 1947.
categories: Miniatures, Science Fiction, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Modular Board

name: Buck: Legacy – Playing with Fire
description:
Description from the publisher:

Out of the Frying Pan and Into the Oven! Things are heating up in the latest expansion in Buck: Legacy!
Features the new race- Nagapon!
The pack features 13 new cards, adding new items, treasures, dungeons and areas to explore!
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling

name: Kingdom Death: Monster – False Messengers Promo
description:
Description from the publisher:

Contains:

1 x Messenger of Courage miniature
1 x Messenger of the First Story miniature
1 x Messenger of Humanity miniature
1 x Messenger of the Spiral Path miniature

Also includes newly-developed rules for the False Messengers.
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Horror, Mature / Adult, Miniatures
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Role Playing, Storytelling

name: Dust Tactics: NDAK Battle Grenadier Squad – "Sand Vipers"
description:
A dedicated anti infantry squad of the Axis army, the Sand Vipers are devastating to any infantry and soft armored target. They have assault rifles and machine guns that can lay down some serious firepower. These marksmen are a feared sight for any enemy brave enough to face them.

These miniatures come with their own unit card, to use with Dust Tactics and Dust Tactics Battlefield rules and provide new tactic opportunities.
categories: Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Modular Board

name: Barbarians & Empires
description:
BARBARIANS & EMPIRES - OCCIDENT ARENA, takes you and your fellow players to the ancient world at the beginning of the third century BC. In this edition you are fighting for the supremacy in the western Mediterranean and Western Europe, the geographical area which the Romans and Byzantines designated as Occident. In the western Mediterranean powers, the Greeks, the Carthagians and the Romans compete for hegemony; in the north are powerful nations such as the Celts, Germans, and Dacians, who, if they are not at war to each other, aspire to the warm, sweet and rich regions of the South. The Iberians fight for their own survival. It was the time shortly after the Celtic storm on Rome, done by Brennus and after the death of Alexander the Great. It was the period of the Punic wars, followed by the beginning of the Germanic invasions of the Cimbri and Teutones, which once again placed Rome at a great danger. They were defeated only by consul Marius after his military reforms. Now you play for the supremacy in the Occident in those last pre-Christian centuries, in which the gates of the Roman Temple of Janus were only closed once. Choose your people and win!

While playing, you have to successfully develop several skills to win, namely those of a military strategist, a prudent economist and a skilled diplomat. Increase your empire revenue through urban development, conquests and through your navy, which dominates the trade revenue in sea zones. Use your diplomats and support your army leaders or trade with other players, instigate revolts, gain neutral provinces peacefully, manipulate the opposing army commander, or send huge sums of money to support your allies. Secure your domains by garrison troops and fortifications. Build powerful armies, recruit the best of your people to increase the performance of your army, and develop strategies to force your powerful enemies to their knees. Hope, that Fortuna favors you. May the gods be with you!

Reach the supremacy of your nation in the Occident. You can achieve this dominance by leading the victory-chart at the end of 8 rounds or you can eliminate one of your adversaries in a Deathmatch by conquering his last province. Several winners in different order categories are possible. If a last province of an opponent has been conquered by your army, you place one of your markers on the skulls on the game board. No matter how the game evolves, you are one of the game winners, as long as you do not lose your last province, too. Any player remains in the game until he has completely lost his last province (does not apply to the nation of BRITANNIA, they stay always in the game!)
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Drop the Puck
description:
Drop the Puck is a hockey themed board game. Drop the puck has turn based game play.
On a players turn they take 2 actions with 2 different team members. The turn actions let players move, pass, shoot, steal the puck and perform other hockey related actions.
The shooting and passing require a player to roll a die and beat a number depending on how far away the shot or pass is and how many opponents are trying to block it. Dice are also used to try and block shots, fight, and attempt penalties. Other actions involve moving team member figures on the board. Players also have cards to play that enhance the actions they take on their turn. After taking their turn the player advances their game clock token to keep track of game length.
After 3 periods of play the player who scored the most goals wins.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Rock-Paper-Scissors

name: Carder Harmonies: A Set Building Card Game From La Dispute
description:
La Dispute is enlisting your help in coming up with the ideal setlist. Mirroring the way the band builds performance sets in real life, you'll arrange themed subsections (called Blocks), using the right songs in the right combinations to earn the most Applause Points. However, Broken Strings and Technical Difficulties might disrupt your plans...

Carder Harmonies is a card game for 1-3 players (competitive or collaborative mode available for multiplayer games). Using various Song cards covering the entire discography of the post-hardcore band La Dispute, players use their hand of 3 cards to populate Set Blocks with Songs, abiding of course by that Block's special conditions (a variety of song counts, allowing songs of only certain records, or heavy/soft dynamics). When a Block condition is met, that Block becomes closed and those songs are safe from the banes of Technical Difficulties, Broken Strings, and other immediate action cards in the deck.

New to the game in 2nd edition are Block Modifiers, a type of card to add additional restrictions to a single block, granting bonus applause at the end of the game for achieving the listed goal or costing you the same amount upon failure.

Once all their Set Blocks are closed, players then tally their Applause Points, accounting for a Song's individual worth, any special conditions granting bonus points, and a streak of consecutive Songs from the same record. Solitaire players aim to surpass a given Applause threshold for their chosen difficulty level, while 2 player mode has the players aiming to score higher than their opponent.
mechanics: Hand Management, Push Your Luck, Set Collection

name: Founding Fathers: Ladies & Orators
description:
Ladies in the government, a new Orator ability, improved abilities for Generals, rules to cast out two-time presidential losers and the ability to try Statesmen for sedition are the new features in this Founding Fathers expansion.

Includes 18 cards and 5 plastic rings.

Fully compatible with Founding Fathers, Founding Fathers Green Edition and Founding Fathers: Offices & Statesmen.
mechanics: Simulation, Variable Player Powers, Voting

name: Who Wears the Crown?
description:
The First Crown of Miltania, first among monarchs, is dead. You, the monarchs of Miltania's eight realms, now must choose who among you shall be the next to wear the Eightfold Crown as First Crown. The Chancellor, the First Crown's chief supporter, also wields great power in the new regime. As you wager in this game of diplomacy and deception, never lose sight of the ultimate question: Who Wears the Crown?

Who Wears the Crown is a king-making, social-collusion, partial information, negotiation game of court politics and shifting alliances. In Who Wears the Crown there are two winners the First Crown who has the most Crown points and the Chancellor who has the most of the First Crown's influence. Players play Crown cards to either support or betray their rivals and players negotiate with their influence to score Crown points.

Do you want the Throne or the Power? Who Really Wears the Crown?

—description from the publisher:
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Battlegroup: Tobruk
description:
Description from the publisher:

LIBYA, 1941... Facing the disastrous loss of their North African colonies, the Italians accept the aid of their allies and the Germans deploy the Deutsche Afrika Korps to Libya, under the command of General Erwin Rommel. He quickly goes on the offensive and throws the British forces back into Egypt, leaving only the besieged port of Tobruk still in their hands.

A gruelling ten-month siege would follow, defying the Axis' attempts to break the defenders, whilst throughout 1941, repeated relief operations are thwarted in the eastern deserts of Libya.
As the battles raged in North Africa, in May the Germans launch an airborne invasion of Crete using their elite 7th Flieger Division.


BACKGROUND


A general overview of the early North Africa campaign, from the Italian invasion of Egypt, through the long siege of Tobruk, to Operation Crusader and the Afrika Korps' counterstroke that would bring them to the Gazala Line in early 1942. Also includes background on the invasion of Crete and the Italian campaign in East Africa.


ARMY LISTS


Nine army lists designed to be played with the character of the principal combatants for North Africa and Crete: the Deutsche Afrikakorps, the Italian Ariete armoured division, Italian Infantry divisions to face British (and Commonwealth) armoured and infantry divisions. Also, the LRDG and Auto Saharan patrols.

For Crete, army lists for the 7th Flieger Division facing the Commonwealth's beleaguered defenders of the island.

Also includes rules for alterations to the army lists to play the battles of the East African campaign.


SPECIAL RULES


New special rules to adapt the core Battlegroup rules to the North African battlefields. Recreating the character of desert fighting, with its dusty conditions, reliance on tank warfare and mobile formations, and the wearing effects of the harsh conditions, all helping to create games with the distinctive feel of the desert war.

Latest campaign supplement in the popular Battlegroup gaming system.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Chit-Pull System, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement

name: Void Pirates
description: Void Pirates presents a Sci-Fi skirmish miniature battle game using a streamlined version of the Goalsystem rules. Use whatever miniatures you own to play out exciting skirmishes in any future world! Build crews with as few as two miniatures, or as many as seven. These rules work in any scale between 10mm - 54mm, and offer flexible and fun character creation, furious combats, and rewarding campaign play. Gather your friends, a handful of six-sided dice, and your favorite miniatures, and blast-off for Sci-Fi fun!
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Chicken Run
description:
Chicken Run is a simple collection game that takes strategy, a little bit of luck, and a whole lot of fun.

Here are the facts: There’s chickens, roosters, and feed. Each player tries to pair four chickens of the same color along with a rooster and feed to complete a Chicken Run.

The game is fast paced– compete against other players to fill your chicken coops and complete your runs- the first to reach ten points wins. But watch out for action cards though as other players can steal or eat your chickens right from your coop.

While Chicken Run is simple, it is full of energy and excitement that develops as players attack one another with varmints, protect their coops from attacks with guard dogs, and trade with other players for the cards they need to complete a Chicken Run.
mechanics: Set Collection, Take That

name: Tau Ngau
description:
Tau Ngau (Bull Fighting) is a traditional Chinese game played with Chinese Dominoes similar to baccarat where the goal is to have the higher hand.

Each player is dealt 5 tiles and has to be able discard 3 of them where the pips add up to a multiple of 10, If the player can't make the three tile discard they automatically lose. Like Pai Gow and Tien Gow, the Gee Joon (4-2, 2-1) tiles are wild and equal either 3 or 6 and when scoring your two remaining tiles you drop the 10 spot. eg - 18 = 8, 22 = 2
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Hand Management

name: Deep: Enemy Frontier
description:
For a thousand years the Empire of Humanity has grown, conquered, and ruled with strength and order, but now resources grow scarce and unrest mutters under the thin veneer of tranquility. Out in the distant void, ancient enemies sense weakness and band together to bring down those who defeated them and sent them running. Humanity's only hope is to reach once more for the furthest stars, discover new worlds rich with resources, and build a new Empire that can survive for another thousand years.

Deep: Enemy Frontier is a highly asymmetric sci-fi strategy game for 2-4 players. Each player takes a unique role during a period of intense conflict in our quadrant of the galaxy. The Empire seeks to shore up its weaknesses and once more establish itself as the dominant force in the galaxy. The Usurper threatens to bring the Empire down from within and establish a free and open society ruled by the people rather than a dictator. The Rival sweeps in from the remote edges of the galaxy, a coalition of aliens burning with revenge against an Empire that conquered and harried them over the past hundreds of years. The Captain throws himself out into the stars, to explore and have grand adventures, his exploits broadcast to the entire Empire; perhaps his fame will lead him one day to sit upon the throne of all humanity...
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Mob Boss: Who's the Boss
description:
Welcomes to the slums where Mob bosses reign supreme! Can you take over enough territories to be the top boss?

HOW TO PLAY
Take over territories by playing cards that represent henchmen, mercenaries and bribes. The card with the highest point value wins the battle... or bribe your way to victory!

Henchmen are your foot soldiers. While they aren't always the strongest card, they are the most loyal and cannot be bribed.

Mercenaries are the ace up your sleeve, the strongest henchman. They can do any job or take care of any problem for the right price!

The Judge and the DA cannot be bribed. With this powerful card, you can immediately seize a territory.

Use money cards to bribe henchmen and pay mercenaries. Sometimes it only takes a little cash to get what you want!

The Mob Boss are powerful cards that can defeat most other cards but must remain out of play for a turn after use. Beware, if your Mob Boss is defeated in a fight, you lose the game!

HOW TO WIN
Be the first to collect a predetermined amount of territories to win!
mechanics: Hand Management, Player Elimination, Take That

name: Vermin Vendetta
description:
Vermin have invaded the backyard!

Choose different bug factions and battle it out to be the most adaptable bug in this backyard battlefield.

Each faction is trying to achieve a series of missions to become the victor in this deck building, tactical strategy game. The factions all play different with variable powers and cards that other factions don't have access to.

You will be acquiring DNA to upgrade the cards you have access to, acquiring food to get more units out on the board, and destroying your opposition in the struggle for survival.
mechanics: Action Points, Area Majority / Influence, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Modular Board, Tile Placement, Variable Player Powers

name: Ogre Stream Overlays
description:
Getting your treads wet . . .

This 4-page mini-supplement brings the stream terrain overlay to Ogre Sixth Edition. It includes the rules for streams in the game as well as suggested maps for use with the standard scenarios. In addition, there is a scenario designed to introduce these rules to new players. And best of all, it's free!

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Variable Phase Order

name: TSWW: Day of Infamy
description:
Publisher's blurb:

"DAY OF INFAMY is the second game of The Second World War Series (TSWW) from Diffraction Entertainment for the Pacific Theater of War.

"Day of Infamy (DOI) is the TSWW-series game covering the day that lived in infamy forever; Pearl Harbour and the first 3 years of the North Pacific and Central Pacific war. With over 2,200 counters, 11 maps (several at 75 mile SSZ scale) and the usual TSWW horde of At Starts (Pearl Harbour, Midway, Operation M (north), the Allied counter offensive in the North Pacific, Guam, etc., this is the ideal introduction to the Blue Water Naval System that is a core component to the TSWW game system.
Featuring the usual TSWW refinements including multiple modules and scenarios, DOI is the next release in the TSWW Game series, with massive fleet actions and a very special raid from Shangri-La.

"The awesome all-new release includes the following:

"- 2,280 high-quality counters on 8 sheets.
- 11 map segments – 7 at 15 miles to the hex, 4 at 75 miles to the hex
- Fully bound rules (expanded to handle the 75 mile hexes on the strategic displays)
- OBs (Axis, Allied, At Start, Production)
- Charts (also expanded to handle the 75 mile hexes on the strategic displays)
- North and Central Pacific theatres from Dec I 1941 turn through Oct II 1943
- Numerous scenarios from Pearl Harbor, Guam and the full Campaign Game"
mechanics: Hexagon Grid

name: The Contender: Politically Incorrect Mini Expansion
description:
Description from the publisher:

Learn how to cuss like a real American with 50 new cards of political filth, straight from the apple pie holes of real presidential candidates.

This expansion deck contains 45 politically incorrect Argument cards cataloging gaffes, rants, and political no-nos from Richard Nixon, George W. Bush, Thomas Jefferson, Pat Buchanan, Bill Clinton, Ronald Regan, Lyndon B. Johnson, and many more. Plus five Topic cards: Adultery, Genocide, Abortion, Your Child, and Prostitution.

The Politically Incorrect expansion pack has blue face cards so that they can easily be identified and removed for politically correct game play.
mechanics: Hand Management, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: The Contender: Hamilton Mini Expansion
description:
Description from the publisher:

14 card mini-expansion inspired by the smash hit musical and using real quotes from real historical figures themselves. Including Alexander Hamilton, George Washington, Aaron Burr, Angelica Schuyler, Marquis de Lafayette, and Thomas Jefferson.

BONUS! A card commemorating the Bowling Green Massacre as described by White House counsel to the president Kellyanne Conway.
mechanics: Hand Management, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: UFO Distruggete Base Luna
description: Based on the TV series UFO, this game is for up to 4 players, each representing an alien trying to penetrate Earth's Moonbase defenses with one player representing Ed Straker who is in charge of Moonbase and trying to defend it against the Aliens' attack.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Lacquered Coffins
description:
Lacquered Coffins is a simple and fast-play WW2 air combat game aimed at between 4 and 20 aircraft per side. The game focuses on the interaction of fighters, bombers, ground attack and utility aircraft, and can be played on a 4' X 4' or 4' X 6' table.

What does Lacquered Coffins offer?

• Good balance of historical accuracy and simplicity
• Bombing, Torpedo attacks and Reconnaissance all play an important role
• Based on the first-hand accounts of pilots
• 6 Missions included, land or sea battles can be fought
• Stats included for over 200 Aircraft
• Luftwaffe, RAF, Soviet, US, Japanese and Italian air forces all covered
• 3 Periods - Early Mid and Late, showing the evolution of aircraft during the war
• 4 Pilot qualities available - Poor quality pilots are less effective, aces are deadly
• Free-form squadron building; aircraft, pilots and ordnance have points values
• Simple to play, games take less than 2 hours

Lacquered Coffins is aimed at 1/600 or 1/300 scale miniatures, but 1/144 could be used just as easily. The game requires minimal equipment, just dice, a tape measure and a circular protractor - No fancy flying stands necessary!
categories: Aviation / Flight, Book, Dice, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement

name: The Jungle Book Game
description:
User summary:

Nicely produced game in a blue linen box -

Players 2 - 4
Pieces 1 pewter animal figure for each player
1 set of 5 wooden tokens representing monkeys
1 wooden 6 sided die
1 Story book Kaa's Hunting - 12 pages with 1 page rules for Kaa's Hunting
Nicely mounted game board with 8 folding pieces about 8.25 by 8.25 forming gameboard 2 squares by 4 squares
Nice interior smaller box - held in place contains the markers, animals and die

"Object of the Game - A race to capture Mowgli from the snake pit."
categories: Children's Game, Dice, Maze, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Pablo: De Bowies!
description: Promo pack #01 for the Pablo game, with 10 new cards for rock music.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Music, Party Game
mechanics: Hand Management, Memory, Singing

name: Stay Off My Lawn
description:
Stay Off My Lawn is a short (15-20 minute) card game designed for all ages, kids and adult. Players compete to have the best lawn, while trashing their opponent's lawn. When the parade comes, the best lawn wins the trophy!

Each turn players place a beneficial card from their hand into their own yard or a harmful card into their opponent's yard and then draw a card from the center deck. Each player has one "Clean Up" card that may be played at any time, but only once per game.

The game ends when the parade arrives and the lawns are judged. Players each total are points and relevant bonuses. The player with the most points wins!
mechanics: Push Your Luck, Take That, Tile Placement

name: Carcassonne: CutCassonne
description:
10 cut-n-play tiles for Carcassonne in the new art style introduced in 2014 that apparently were hidden on the bottom of the gift box "Hans im Päckchen" given at out Essen 2014.

There are 10 tiles (that have to be cut out from a sheet) and no meeples (the players have to use some substitutes). If you glue them on blanc tiles, you could use it as an expansion.
categories: City Building, Expansion for Base-game, Medieval
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Tile Placement

name: Samurai Dice
description:
A fast-paced, easy-to-learn but strategic game of honor and vengeance. Samurai Dice lets you play as heroic bushi, charismatic courtiers, wise ascetics and stealthy ninja.

Grab your four Hero character cards, one for each of the four elements of Earth, Fire, Water and Wind, line them up against the Enemy cards and get rolling.

Nominate one Hero to attack one Enemy, and roll the five dice. Three dice are white, one is blue and one is red. The Blue Die represents your hero; each White Die that rolls below or equal to the Blue Die does one damage to the Enemy. The White Dice that roll above the Blue Die do damage to your hero.

If the Red Die rolls over the Blue Die then the Enemy you're attacking gets to activate their ability. This can be anything from an energy shield that protects the Enemy to a devastating counterattack or more.

When you defeat an Enemy the Hero that you used gets to level up and heal, get stronger or gain powerful loot. Each Hero has two abilities that they can use to increase the chances of success. The only thing is that you have to choose which ability you want to activate, and you can only activate it once per game.

The goal of the game is to take out all of the Enemies before your opponent takes out all of theirs. You can play solo, too!
mechanics: Dice Rolling

name: Dust 1947: Operation Kondor
description:
Death from the skies! Operation Kondor, the aftermath of Operation Babylon has started! After the initial Axis invasion, things are getting heated in a hurry between the Tigris and the Euphrates. The Allies and SSU have now realized that the third Bloc wouldn't have committed so many forces for anything other than a prime objective. If the Axis sought oil, they would have attacked elsewhere like the Arabian Peninsula or Iran's oil fields. They sure are in for more than sand and old ruins, aren't they? NDAK forces have finally found their target: an isolated outpost on the outskirts of the desert held by a handful of French Foreign Legionnaires in an area crawling with Spetsnaz. Only the Luftwaffe boys can mount the fastest strike ever to take this objective before anyone else: Operation Kondor.

This new expansion for Dust 1947 describes all the Luftwaffe forces, with new characters, vehicles, Platoons, etc. With the Operation itself come three short stories by Andy Chambers himself, a must read for every Dust fan!
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Modular Board

name: Fields of Agincourt
description:
Description from the publisher:

October 25th, 1415 Artois, France
The woods were still and full of mist. Silent hills stood watch. A muddy field waited for the battle to begin. Near the small village of Agincourt, two armies faced each other in the chill of the early morning. Archers, Footmen, Scouts, and Cavalry ordered themselves for battle. The land was the prize that was sought. The cost must be paid in blood. Welcome to the Fields of Agincourt.

Agincourt is a combative tile-placement game for 2-5 players. The map will form as the game is played, with each player fighting for position for the final battle. The goal of the game is to defeat your enemies and claim the most victory points.

Playing Fields of Agincourt consists of two game stages:
Marshalling the Troops: Players take turns placing tiles, recruiting troops, and claiming Bastions. Once all the tiles are placed, the Final Battle will begin.
The Final Battle: Players are vying for superior battle positions within Bastions. Contested Bastions are resolved one at a time, with the winning player receiving victory points. The player with the most victory points will win the game.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Enclosure, Tile Placement

name: Riga: 5+6 Player Expansion
description: Riga: 5+6 Player Expansion does just what you might expect — allow for games of Riga to include up to six players. To do this, this expansion includes 55 cards, including 22 ware cards, 24 building cards, and 8 Riga-specific building cards.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Deities Domination
description:
The story for Deities Domination picks up at the end of a great war. The war to regain the 7 realms from the darkness felled many, including the First of the Gods. As the realms recover, the Gods that once fought together now vie against each other to claim the empty throne.

As a player in the game, choose to be one of several Gods from different clans, each with unique powers and abilities. Players direct their tribe to build, battle monsters, and explore new territories. As a God, players can choose to be Benevolent, focusing on building their tribe or giving gifts to other tribes, or Malevolent, striking down the resources and Heroes of their own or that of other tribes.

The game combines elements of 4x with a deck building mechanic. Each game play is designed to be unique, with multiple characters, a modular map, and several actions for each player to choose from each turn. The race to claim the throne is won by the first player to achieve 12 Victory Points. You can choose to expand your tribes through villages and shrines, build a magnificent temple and collect tributes, go the battle route and fight monsters, take a balanced approach or more.

Deities Domination is a versatile game, designed to maximize replayability. While players may have temporary setbacks, no one is eliminated from the game, and the structure of the game allows for recovery from asymmetric distribution of power, giving players the ability to recoup from disadvantageous situations. The combination of new map layouts, Gods’ abilities, and multiple paths to victory creates an inimitable experience each game.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Modular Board, Open Drafting, Variable Player Powers

name: Mars Attacks: The Miniatures Game – Take Me To Your Leader
description:
This expansion contains five one-piece miniatures representing these powerful heroes from the Mars Attacks universe, so you can use them in your games.

Contains:
Craig, Tunga, Beloss Bel, Standard-bearer, Regent supreme.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hand Management

name: Primeval: A Tribal Supplement
description:
Primeval is a prehistoric gaming supplement for the Tribal rules - a skirmish-style wargame which focuses on the heroic deeds of units and individuals in battle. Primeval continues the theme of 'honour' as a fundamental element of tribal life and combat - which determines who actually 'wins' a game, through the actions of the protagonists in battle.

Primeval goes back to the ere of the Dawn of Man, when humanity was first establishing itself across the harsh landscapes of a prehistoric world. Humanity's fight for survival and ultimately supremacy provides a world of interesting gaming opportunities! The constantly emerging finds in the field, which challenges us all to reassess who we are, and where we come from, inspired us to research and game in the era of Primeval man.

In Primeval there are: new skills (including rules for dog companions); 4 new prehistoric factions (Neanderthal, Cro-Magnon, Hominids and Denisovans); 4 new scenarios; a mini-campaign called 'The Hunt'; and rules for playing animals in scenarios.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Prehistoric, Wargame
mechanics: Measurement Movement, Open Drafting, Simulation

name: Za
description:
Za is a fully-collaborative crossword building game. Players pull objective cards from the Za deck, plus a selection of letter tiles, and work together to build a crossword that satisfies the objectives. Whenever they do, they draw more letter tiles and objectives.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Tile Placement

name: The Crinimals Card Game
description:
The Crinimals plays the story of 4 Crinimals (criminal animals) who successfully did their last heist. After the heist, they turn against each.

Players take turns trying to expose four connected pieces of evidence against each other either by expanding the board with the same color or overriding evidences with the same icon.

There are action card that will manipulate the flow of the game such as swapping hands, swapping IDs, swapping cards on the table, drawing cards and skipping turns.

This is a 2 to 4 player game. The game is family friendly, super fun and easy to learn with lots of depth to the gameplay.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Player Elimination, Take That, Team-Based Game

name: Bushido: Minato Jung
description:
Although trained in the ways of the Samurai, Minato was always destined to follow his own unique path. A brute of a man, more at home in a water house than the courts. His body tells the stories of countless battles, wearing each scar proudly as a mark of honour to his physical prowess. That is not to say that he is all brawn, a cunning and clever leader, hiding from the Prefecture in plain sight. In battle he wields his trademark anchor, launching it through the air making it appear as light as a Tengu feather. Those unlucky enough to be caught by his attentions sent sprawling, dazed and disorientated.
—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Mischief Media: The Game of Fake News
description:
Mischief Media is a social deduction, tabletop game designed around the deceptive world of journalism and politics where players try to manipulate each other in an attempt to push their agenda.

Each player takes on the role of a "Philanthropist" who influences different key characters of the media world to gain control over the public's interest. To gain control of a news cycle (ROUND), the player must gain a majority of the available viewers, be the only one left with viewers, or be the only one left with credibility. Win three news cycles and you have successfully pushed your agenda changing the public's opinion.

Each player starts the round with 2 Credibility Cards, 1 Collusion Card, 7 viewer chips, and 1 Action Card. These are the tools that are used to push your agenda.

There are six Credibility Cards, each with their own action, that are used to affect viewership or credibility. On your turn, you may choose to take an action of any Credibility Card whether you have that card or not. If you lose both Credibility Cards, you no longer have a reputable opinion and are out for the round.

Viewer chips represent how many people believe in your movement. Each player starts with 7 viewer chips. If you gain 20 viewer chips, then a majority agree with your opinions and you win the round. If you lose all of your viewer chips, then you have become no longer relevant and are out for the round.

If a player does an action of a Credibility Card that they do not have, then they are susceptible to being called out for their Fake News! If correctly called out for Fake News by an opponent, the player loses one of their Credibility Cards. If incorrectly called out for Fake News by an opponent, the opponent loses a Credibility Card.

Management of both viewers and credibility are key to success. Focus too much on credibility and a player could lose all their viewers. Focus too much on viewers and a player could lose all their credibility.

To turn the tide of the game, a player can use a Collusion Card. Collusion Cards come with a higher risk because it requires a specific set of Credibility Cards. Yet the reward is well worth it because the player gets to follow through with a special action.

As you become close to winning, the media has more watchful eye on your actions forcing you to draw a hidden Scrutiny Card. Scrutiny Cards change the way you play the game possibly forcing you to play truthfully or to play as a full on liar.

Once you have won three news cycles and successfully pushed your agenda, you get to tell your fellow melancholy media members what is now commonly accepted as truth i.e. "It is considered rude to greet a friend without using excessive JAZZ HANDS".

—description from the publisher
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Deduction, Party Game, Political
mechanics: Open Drafting, Player Elimination, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: Walls of Scydonia
description:
Walls of Scydonia is a unique boardgame created by ScyDes and takes place in a medieval fantasy setting.
Physics, building and shooting skills as well as strategy, are the core elements of the game.

In Scydonia, an intercontinental city war is raging, carried out by relic driven giant catapults as well as sabotage, magic and other trickery.
Your goal as a city leader, is to destroy your opponents 4 guild towers that contain the knowledge about their crafts and perhaps insight about Scydonias fate and why the world is coming to an end...

Each player starts with 4 guild towers, providing him with certain support components. If you lose a tower, you lose the supports.
Everyone gets 24 wall stones to start with.
Build your wall using stones and supports to protect your towers. But hurry up, the clock is ticking!

Shoot your dice at the opponents towers and take them down using the feature loaded catapult!
Obtain coins and spend them on tower upgrades and strategy cards to gain access to your towers super shots or to play foul tricks on your enemy using the strategy cards.

Be wise in spending your actionpoints, each decision can be your last.
Grind those walls and rebuild your own, for as long as you can!
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, City Building, Dice, Fantasy, Medieval, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Acting, Action Points, Dice Rolling, Finale Ending, Hexagon Grid, Income, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Physical Removal, Sudden Death Ending, Variable Set-up

name: ASL: March Madness 2017 Hollis Pack
description:
Each year the Kansas City ASL club hosts the March Madness ASL tournament and the club releases a themed scenario pack at the tournament.

The March Madness Hollis Pack contains nine historical scenarios and one fun scenario.

MM33: ARIETE ON TOTENSONNTAG, South of Sidi Rezegh, Libya, 23 November, 1941
MM34: YEVPATORIYA MOP UP, Yevpatiriya, Crimea, 6 January, 1942
MM35: 10th PANZER TAKES THE HIGH GROUND, East of El Guettar, Tunisia, 26 March, 1943
MM36: THE 9th SEES THE ELEPHANT, East of El Guettar, Tunisia, 28 March, 1943
MM37: NINETY NIGHT, Cassibile, Sicily, 10 July, 1943
MM38: ELIMINATING THE LVR, Murowana Oszmianka, Poland, 13 May, 1944
MM39: BICYLE RACE: St. Aubin-d'Arquenay, 6 June, 1944
MM40: OCHOTA REVENGE, Warsaw, Poland, 9 August 1944
MM41: FINAL VICTORY, Warsaw, Poland, 20 August, 1944
MM FOR FUN 1: ROOTING THEM OUT, Kansas City, USA, present day (a special map for this scenario is enclosed in the game)
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid

name: Bloody Big European Battles!
description:
A 54 page softback book featuring Wargame scenarios for the late nineteenth century

Bloody Big European Battles! (BBEB) lets you refight sixteen of the biggest battles fought in Europe between 1850 and 1900. Each scenario gives you:

A clear and accurate historical situation
Fascinating strategic choices for both sides
Simple but ingenious victory conditions
A battle you can fight to the finish in an evening
A great game that will ebb and flow to the last turn

BBEB includes full campaigns of linked scenarios for the Crimean War (4 battles), for Austrian Decline 1859-1866 (5 battles), and for the Russo-Turkish War (4 battles)

Famous epic auctions such as Solferino and Koniggratz are induced alongside the decisive battles from lesser known conflicts like the Serbo-Bulgarian War of 1885 or the Greco-Turkish War of 1897

BBEB is a scenario book intended for use with Bloody Big Battles!
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Post-Napoleonic, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Line of Sight, Measurement Movement, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation

name: The Walking Dead: All Out War – Lee & Clementine
description:
The Lee and Clementine Booster Pack, which also includes a gruesome Walker miniature, will only be available at selected shows and special events. In North America the Lee and Clementine Booster Pack will launch at Adepticon in March, while the UK launch will follow in April at Salute. From then the booster will be available at shows around the world.
--From the publisher

This booster pack contains 3 unique, collectible miniatures allowing you to add Telltale Games’ Lee and Clementine to your games, along with an extra Walker to bulk out your herd.

Contents:
Plastic Lee Miniature
Plastic Clementine Miniature
Plastic Walker Miniature
Lee and Clementine Character Cards
Fire Axe, Claw Hammer, Radio, and Backpack Equipment Cards
Mantic Point Card
mechanics: Dice Rolling

name: National Razor
description:
In the early morning’s mist, the clatter of the tumbril’s wheels on the cobblestone echo through the streets of Paris. It brings a gruesome feast -consumed in rhythmic chopping- the National Razor is the gluttonous ouroboros of the revolution. Over the paranoid whisperings in the breadlines, and plastered rumors on the broadsheets, you sense that the revolution hangs by a thread. Will you be able to draw it back from the abyss, or will the final thump on the scaffold see your head in a basket?

Giving careful homage to the themes of the period, play one of six factions vying for dominance of revolutionary France. Each faction has eight historical leaders to choose from and five unique asymmetrical agendas to push though in an attempt to gain control of the revolution.

The game includes mechanics to coerce obedience, punish betrayal, or cooperatively reach mutual goals- allowing players to pick a path forward that best suits them. Each agenda proposed comes with a pool of 'largess' for players to distribute to win support for their machinations. Conversely, successfully sending an opposing faction's leader 'to the Chop' gains them, in addition the points scored, the trophy of a head on a pike.

National Razor is played in five rounds. Each round begins with players simultaneously selecting a leader for their faction and secretly choosing what their faction will focus on that round. All players then reveal their leaders, and the leader with the best rank becomes the First Citizen to begin the game play.

On a player's turn they can play any number of follower cards, buy improvements and titles, but they must play one of their five Agenda cards. Agendas come with a pool of Largess -follower cards- that the active player proposes to give to players if her Agenda passes. Players then simultaneously vote on the fate of the Agenda using Yes and No cards and may add modifiers if they feel particularly strongly about the outcome.

Player decisions also advance a token along the Terror Track. When a Terror hits, the game state changes in unforeseen ways that encourage and reward aggressive behavior. The most aggressive behavior being attempting to send an opposing faction leader 'to the Chop.' This is done by proving that your incriminating evidence is legit by naming what the faction's chosen focus for the round is (thereby showing you have successfully infiltrated their faction). If the opposing faction is able to show the named focus from their unselected pile, the Chop attempt fails. If the named focus is correct however, the opposing faction leader is removed from the game, the accuser gets the bounty listed on the deceased character's card, and gains a trophy card showing a head on a pike to demonstrate how brutal their faction is.

After all factions have taken a turn, the round is over. All players with leaders still alive reveal their chosen focus, gaining the special benefits they provide. If its the 5th round of the game, total VP's are added up, with the highest being deemed the victor.
mechanics: Hand Management, Simultaneous Action Selection, Voting

name: Smugglers of the Galaxy: Alpha Expansion
description:
This is a free print-and-play expansion to the base game.

It contains enhanced, optional strategy and solo play rules. It also enables the creation of custom characters for game play.
categories: Adventure, Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Pirates, Print & Play, Science Fiction, Space Exploration
mechanics: Commodity Speculation, Hexagon Grid, Pick-up and Deliver, Trading, Variable Player Powers

name: TOR: Tales of Resurrection
description:
Tales of Resurrection is a cooperative civilization boardgame for 1-6 players.

TOR is a cooperative Strategy-game in which players must build and develop their settlement in a story-driven campaign. Choose one of 3 individual Paths with unique and exciting quests for you to play. Over 30 hours of playtime are guaranteed on your journey through Adra!

Fight and kill an ancient monster to be the next leader of Adra!
mechanics: Cooperative Game

name: Gone to Pieces: The Battle of Binh Gia
description:
“After the Ap Bac battle the enemy realized that it would be difficult to defeat us. After Binh Gia the enemy realized that they would lose to us.” ---Le Duan, Communist Party Secretary in Hanoi about the significance of the battle of Binh Gia.

Following the disastrous 1963 battle of Ap Bac, more military equipment and advisors were sent by the United States to the Republic of South Vietnam in the hopes that better armaments and training could defeat the obviously growing strength of the Communist forces in that embattled country. The Battle of Binh Gia was the first major test of the effects of the escalating US presence in South Vietnam, and its outcome had a telling effect on the US role in the conflict. Perhaps you can do as well or better?

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Open Drafting

name: Taco Party!
description:
Taco Party is a family-friendly game for 2-6 players and takes about 30-60 minutes to play. The goal is to make a taco then be the first to eat it. Perform a variety of dexterity and speed challenges with a handful of dice. Draw a card, dice ingredients and collect the necessary ingredients to make your taco. Then you must get rid of all your ingredients to win. Sounds easy but don’t flauta yourself. This game will test your physical ability, strategy, and luck. Plus, it just so happens that the other players will be jalapeno business. There will be steals, swaps, out-crunching, and messy food fights! Join the shellebration!

—description from the designer
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Dice, Humor, Party Game
mechanics: Dice Rolling

name: Eldenia: Counterattack of Asmodians
description:
Counterattack of the Asmodians began.
Devil Kartu and his colleagues came back to regain their lost power.
You will venture into the world of Eldenia with the more powerful Asmodians.

Devil Kartu pains his opponent and raises his abilities.
Black Knight Tamil is able to maximize his attack power while suffering himself.
Pickpocket peter can steal your opponent's abilities.
Blacksmith Chakram has an ability to turn gold into a sword's offensive power.

Newly appeared monsters are powerful. However, you can make your ability more powerful.
Those new items are powerful and dangerous. You must pay attention to its use.

Stronger interaction makes it difficult to predict who will win.
Win the victory while blocking the opponent with various abilities.
The game became more difficult with more injuries and fatalities than before.
But do not worry. A healer may appear soon.

—description from the designer
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Set Collection

name: But Wait, There's Even More
description:
Have you ever wanted a sleeping bag that promotes spine alignment, or a baby stroller, that comes with a turbo boost? In But Wait, There's Even More!, players pitch wacky products to each other for fun and profit.

But Wait, There's, Even More, is the follow-on game to But Wait, There's More. But Wait, There's, Even More, can be combined with the original game, or it can be played on its own!

At the start of the game, each player receives three "Feature" cards. Each round starts with one Product card being revealed from the deck, e.g., Fork. Each player, in turn, has thirty seconds to play one of their Feature cards – say, "Voice Activated" – and pitch their own version of a fork. At some point during these thirty seconds, this player must say, "But wait, there's more!", then reveal the top Feature card from the deck – say, "inflates in under 6 Minutes" – and incorporate that Feature into their Product. Once all players have pitched their unique version of a fork, everyone votes simultaneously for which pitches they liked the best. The top vote-getter after three rounds wins the game!

With six or more people, play in teams, with the first player on a team starting the pitch with one of their Feature cards and the second player finishing the pitch with a Feature card of their own, but neither player knows what the other Feature is until they are revealed!

—description from the publisher
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Sea of Clouds: Petit Chat Promo Card
description:
Sea of Clouds: Kitty is a promotional card for Sea of Clouds.

Simply shuffle it with the other Loot cards after setup. Whenever it shows up on top of the draw pile, the game is momentarily interrupted. The active player picks the card, reads it aloud and immediately applies its effects. Then, the card is discarded and the game goes on normally.

The card was actually given away separately from the others (Sea of Clouds: Kitty, Unicorn, Love Ray) by Ludovox as part of their Tipeee (~patreon) campaign.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Pirates
mechanics: Open Drafting, Push Your Luck, Set Collection

name: Dirt Track Saturday Night
description:
Play the role of the owner and driver of a 900 horsepower engine in a 1200 pound chassis on dirt ovals from one quarter to one mile in length. Conduct a series of races for the Season Championship. Stand on the gas and turn right to go left. If that's not a recipe for excitement and danger, I don't know what is. Dirt Track Saturday Night is the game of Sprint Car, Supermodified and Stock Racing on dirt ovals which take place all over America. You set up your car to be tuned for the track conditions. Tracks can be wet and mushy all the way to dry and abrasive with other conditions in between. Choose your gear ratios, suspension setting and tire selection and your wing angle if the car has one; then go like hell. The playing surface is a three foot by four foot rectangle. You can buy and print pre-made tracks or make your own living diorama with the information provided in the rules. Included in the rules are all the charts you'll need to run a single race or, one night of racing where you have to do well in order to make it into the feature event, or run a full season of events to determine the winner of the season championship.
—description from the publisher

On their turn, players roll two d6, which determines how far they can move. They can move one more space beyond what they are entitled to move, but doing so carries a chance of spinning out and/or crashing. Maneuvers can be performed to pass other racers, but the more fancy the maneuver, the more likely the car will not successfully execute it. Players must fight to gain and maintain the lead for 6 laps, after which the winner is determined.
—user summary
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Push Your Luck, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Tinderbox Tales
description:
Tinderbox Tales expands on the setting for The Brigade, with this three-game set being presented like a boxed set of books. The games included are:

• The Barmaid's Tale

Set in the "Rat Catcher's Rest", this is a social game for 4-6 players. Players assign blame to each other for the failure of a recent quest while literally "passing the buck".

• The Trader's Tale

Play out the events of one of the most famous days in the history of the merchant's district. "Ruby Twosday" saw every adventurer in Tinderbox racing to equip themselves for the quest to rescue the Princess making a lot of traders very rich in the process. This resource management game challenges 2-4 adventuring agents to trade carefully to be the first to build and outfit their team for the quest.

• The Damsel's Tale

Damsel etiquette will tell you that you can never really trust a knight to save you properly, but as long as your dragon needs feeding, you should let them have a go. In this two-player asymmetrical strategy game of hide and sneak, the dragon is trying to alert his mother to the presence of a cunning knight sent to steal from the horde.

Tinderbox Tales is the second release from Red Genie Games set in "The Vague World".
mechanics: Action Queue, Area Majority / Influence, Push Your Luck, Set Collection, Simultaneous Action Selection, Storytelling, Trading, Worker Placement

name: Gangs of Rome: Blood on the Aventine
description:
Senator Caius Norbanus Flaccus has not only commissioned a temple to the god Apollo, but he has also provided a beautiful—not to mention expensive—statue of the god to watch over the temple’s construction.

Two rivals for Flaccus’ position on the Senate have both dispatched small gangs of fighters to sack the temple and steal the statue, the disappearance of which will cause embarrassment to the Senator.

However, Flaccus is not quite as naïve as these Domini would believe, and he has invested in a little insurance for his temple and the statue therein: the imposing—and obstinate—Gaul, Talavus...

This scenario box set for Gangs of Rome – Blood on the Aventine contains everything you need to play this innovative tabletop skirmish game. This starter scenario box set for GoR contains the following:

Gangs of Rome A4 Full Rulebook
Blood on the Aventine Scenario
6 x Single piece fighters
6 x Named fighter cards
16 x Equipment/Skill Coins and cards featuring four unique coins for this scenario
1 Gaul watchman, Incola card and base
1 x Personal Influence Marker card
6 x Activation pebbles (3 x 2 different colours)
7 Roman numeral dice
2 x MDF Movement rulers
6 x Jigsaw Base
6 x Sets of flesh tokens
2 x sets of ID markers ( 1 - 3, two colours)
MDF Temple under construction scenery by Sarissa Precision
1 x Objective token

Packed with all these Gangs of Rome essentials and exclusive content, Blood on the Aventine is the perfect way to begin or expand your collection. So take your fate in your hands, Dominus, and recruit, dominate and ascend.
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: 90 Min
description:
90 min is a realistic football (soccer) simulation board game, designed not only for football fans.

Taking turns, the players move their pawns across the field in order to score a goal. Every turn represents 1 (advanced) or 2 (standard) min in the match. The players use a minutes track to monitor the progress of the match and after 90 min the game is over.

Different types of players and the fan support will influence the odds. Tackling, free kick, corner kick, throw-in and offside: 90 min implements almost every aspect of a real match with simple rules.

Tackling is resolved by duel cards: Each player has the same set of cards ranging from 1-10. To resolve a tackling they simultaneously chose a card and the higher card wins, but if the difference is too high, a foul happens, making each tackling an exciting duel.

A set of advanced rules and tactic cards can be used to add even more details of a real football match.

-description from publisher
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Die Nacht der Wehrmacht 1935
description:
Die Nacht der Wehrmacht 1935 is a game of the factional strife in the Wehrmacht, the unified armed forces of Nazi Germany from 1935 to 1946.
Each player produces troops, performs office hunting by getting "general" cards, commands armed forces in the battle driven by "event" cards and sometimes carries out a coup. If the coup succeeds or WWII ends, the game ends and a player who has been awarded most decorations for victory in the battles wins.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Open Drafting
publishers: Kuro Neko Design Workshop, Period Games

name: AdventureQuest Worlds: The ANYTHING-GOES BattleOn Battle Card Game – Chaos Mod Pack
description:
The Adventure Quest Worlds Chaos Mod Pack includes the Chaos eye pet and half of the Paladinslayer class. Combine with the items in the Doomwood mod pack to create the full Paladinslayer class online.

Includes 14 Chaos Cards which are mixed in with the cards in the base set.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Humor, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Hand Management

name: Earth's Last Stand
description:
CONTEXT

A massive combat ship that emerged from an open portal to another dimension is trying to invade planet earth. The earth’s defensive shield was activated, but it is only strong enough to withstand the enemy’s main laser for a short period of time.

Our only hope rest on a small fleet of terrestrial spaceships that were orbiting the earth, ill prepared for such a moment of crisis. These ships’ crew now holds the most important mission of their lives: attempt to destroy the enemy ship while simultaneously keeping the earth’s shield functioning, in an effort to avoid the end of all humankind.

MECHANICS

During the match, the players must prepare the crew (roll dice) and take them to perform various tasks on the ships (modules). After all player ships have participated, the enemy turn will begin, during which the enemies will attempt different actions against the player ships or planet earth depending on the Strategy Card that has been revealed.

After each round, the state of the game must be checked to determine whether the match has ended, be it in favor or against the players. If the match has not yet ended, another round is prepared, advancing the marker on the portal to another dimension to the next counter, among other things. The game will inevitably end when the marker on the portal to another dimension reaches the last counter and cannot be moved any forward at the end of the round.

The players must use the limited amount of turns at their disposal to try and prepare their ships and improve them as much as possible, with better modules and more crew, in order to be victorious. Achieving good synergy between the modules of a ship and maintaining good communication with companions might result in a seemingly impossible task being successfully completed.

The earth is counting on you! Good luck!
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Worker Placement

name: Vienna, Parkany 1683
description:
The Battle of Párkány (Turkish: Cigerdelen Savasi) (October 7–9, 1683) was a battle fought in the town of Párkány (today: Štúrovo), in the Ottoman Empire, and the area surrounding it as part of the Polish-Ottoman War and the Great Turkish War.

The battle was fought in two stages. In the first stage Polish troops under John III Sobieski were defeated by the Ottoman army under Kara Mehmed Pasha on October 7, 1683.

In the second stage Sobieski, supported by Austrian forces under Charles V, Duke of Lorraine, defeated the Ottoman forces, which were supported by the troops of Imre Thököly, and gained control of Párkány on October 9, 1683.

After the defeat Austrians would besiege Esztergom and captured it at the end of 1683.

Game uses Husaria system, designed for XVII century battles.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Simulation

name: Great War at Sea: Jutland 1919
description:
Imperial Germany laid down her last dreadnought in January 1915, and never completed her. But planning continued for new classes of battleships, battle cruisers, armored cruisers and scout cruisers. All understood that they could not possibly be built during the course of the ongoing First World War, but would be laid down afterwards.

Reflecting the lessons first of the battles of the Falklands, Coronel and Helgoland Bight, and eventually those of Jutland, the new German designs continued to emphasize protection. At the urging of sea officers, the new ships also now carried armament equal to that of the British, and would make much higher speeds as well.

Across the North Sea, the British Admiralty had no clear idea of what the Germans might be planning to build, but could state with certainty that they and other potential enemies would continue to improve their warships. New British dreadnoughts would carry ever-more-powerful armaments, including a new, secret 18-inch gun.

Jutland 1919 is a supplement for our Great War at Sea: Jutland game, studying these drawing-board battleships that would never actually be launched. It includes background essays, forty new scenarios, and 80 new silky-smooth die-cut playing pieces (60 double-sized "long" ship pieces and 20 square ones). It is not playable by itself; you’ll need our Jutland game and High Seas Fleet book to play the scenarios. You can, of course, just read the essays and fondle the pieces without owning either. We won’t tell.

New pieces include three classes of German battleships designed but never built: a fast battleship with eight 15-inch guns, a battleship with ten 15-inch guns in five turrets, with three of them in a unique triple-stacked arrangement. And an even larger ship with 16.5-inch guns. There are two new classes of battle cruiser, one with 15-inch guns, one with 16.5-inch guns. And two variations on the fast armored cruiser proposed after the Battle of Jutland, one with ten 8.2-inch guns, and one with twenty (20) 5.9-inch guns. Plus there are additional scout cruisers and destroyers.

The British for their part receive their improved but slower Queen Elizabeth class, with ten 15-inch guns, and the massive ships proposed to carry eight 18-inch guns apiece, based on the Hood design but slower with battleship-scale protection. Plus their own fast armored cruiser.

These are powerful new ships, and now you can lead them into battle.

-description from publisher's website
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Nautical, Wargame, World War I
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Secret Unit Deployment, Simulation

name: Tradejack
description:
A fast-paced card game about the consequences of the choices we make. Your goal is to run a successful and sustainable business, sourcing palm oil products for supermarkets. Palm oil can be found in 50% of packaged goods on your supermarket’s shelves, often with devastating consequences for the environment. Build the reputation of your brand by bringing more responsible products to market, reinvesting your profits wisely, and winning awards to edge out the competition and emerge victorious.

On your turn, you'll have to outbid your competitors to control the sources of palm oil most valuable to your market. Match Source Cards to Product Cards in order to sell - hopefully for a profit. Each round plays differently, with various regulations and consumer trends to account for, and different awards up for grabs. At the end of the game, the player with the best Reputation from awards and profit will be declared the winner.

What if we really cared how our products are sourced? Would supermarkets, with all the power they have, start to behave differently? From farmer to consumer, Tradejack provides an overview of the supply chains that bring products into our homes.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Hand Management, Memory, Set Collection

name: Mr. Rhee: Surviving the Nightmare World
description:
Mr. Rhee: Surviving the Nightmare World is a 3-6 player asymmetrical card game, where the one plays the hero and the many are the villains. As a Villain, spend Greed to recruit and send your evil minions to take control of locations throughout Nightmare World from the innocents -- or use your character specific win conditions to seize the day. As the Hero, use Hope to gather Fight, Charisma, and Magic to hold out for six rounds -- the day and night of the Three days of Darkness that are consuming Nightmare World -- using your team and abilities to mitigate damage... and set the Villains at each other’s' throats. Fast-paced and wickedly fun, this game plays in about 30 minutes. Will you take over the Nightmare World, or just survive it?

Gameplay
Gameplay starts with the hero determining which villain should play first. That Villain spends Greed to recruit Minions, and place them in Locations. Placement happens either secretly (face-down where they will do team damage), or with fangs bared (face-up where they may single out a specific victim among the Innocents, Heros, or opposing Villain’s Minions). However, Greed is flipped to Hope, so the more actions a Villain takes, the more the Hero will be able to counter. The Hero then uses Hope to move to locations, and gather Fight, Charisma, and Magic. Each Hero abilities card costs more Hope than the previous, so the Hero determine what skills are worth the cost.
Once the alternating sides of Villain and Hero have each taken their turn, any Locations with conflict are resolved. This time, the starting Villain may choose which Location resolves first. The Innocents fight the Minions with the help of the Heroes, who now use their skills of Fight (brute force against the opposing side) Charisma (persuading a Minion to turn on his allies) Magic (targeting a single Minion to attack) while the Villains strategically use their Minions abilities and brute strength.
When the conflict is concluded, so is the round, and the fight begins anew. Either the heroes use their skills and special powers to hold off the terror for all 6 rounds (Day and Night of “The Three Days of Darkness”), or one of the Villains meet their asymmetrical win conditions to take the city by force, rule the world, and win the game!

Theme
In the graphic novel series NIGHTMARE WORLD we learn that once upon a time an Archangel named Lucifer, incensed with what he saw as a tyrannical reign over all Creation by God, organized a revolt coup that he hoped would give him control of Earth and all humanity. It failed. As a result, Lucifer and the angels who followed him were banished to the bowels of the Earth as punishment, forever banned from Heaven and Earth. Realizing that the numbers were on his side, Lucifer has since spent years organizing a plan for revenge – this time relying not just on the Fallen Angels, but also recruiting Lilith and her countless demon spawn, Cthulhu and the Great Old Ones, rallying them together as part of one concentrated effort to occupy Earth and take control of Creation in a campaign of monstrous terror dubbed “The Three Days of Darkness.”
In the spin-off graphic novel series TALES OF MR. RHEE we learn that humanity is not without its defenses against the forces of darkness, both with the street-fighting magician Mr. Rhee as well as the covert cabal of magicians known as The P.R.O.M.I.S.E. Group. When “The Three Days of Darkness” erupt across the world, The P.R.O.M.I.S.E. Group, dedicated to the “Permanent Reduction Of Monsters in Society Everywhere”, emerge from the shadows to join forces with Mr. Rhee and a collection of other heroes who know they may not be able to win, but are nonetheless willing to sacrifice everything to make sure the forces of darkness won’t either.
Written by horror comic master Dirk Manning – who also serves as a consultant on this game – NIGHTMARE WORLD Volumes 1-4, the NIGHTMARE WORLD OMNIBUS, and TALES OF MR. RHEE Volumes 1-4 (so far) are all published by Devil’s Due Publishing and available anywhere comics are sold.

—description from publisher
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Exploration
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: Junk'd
description:
JUNK'D is a "fast, simple, destructive D6 dice pool play is easy teach, with loads of variation." A "PVP car combat game for up to 8 players." (Quotations are from the publisher description.) The ruleboook is available to purchase from DriveThruRPG, and it includes Print-and-Play materials as well as tips for those who wish to craft their own cars, obstacles, and tracks.

It is a player-elimination game where the last car on the road is the winner. However, eliminated players return to the game as "ghost riders"---kamikaze skeleton bikers who ride in the opposite direction as the other players. This twist keeps all the players active, even if they are eliminated early.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Player Elimination

name: Guild Ball: The Engineer's Guild – Precision Made
description: Guild Ball: The Engineer's Guild – Precision Made includes a ball, 6 player cards, bases, and 6 players: Pin Vice, Mother (and three nest markers), Veteran Velocity, Hoist, Compound, Locus.
mechanics: Dice Rolling

name: Guild Ball: The Faithful – New Beginnings
description: Guild Ball: The Faithful – New Beginnings includes 6 player cards, bases, and 6 metal players: Veteran Calculus, Veteran Cinder, Veteran Chisel, Veteran Fangtooth, Seasoned Spigot, and Veteran Sakana.
mechanics: Dice Rolling

name: Guild Ball: The Brewer's Guild – Sing When You're Winning
description: Guild Ball: The Brewer's Guild – Sing When You're Winning includes: a ball, 6 player cards, bases, and 6 players: Esters, Quaff, Mash, Veteran Spigot, Stoker, PintPot.
mechanics: Dice Rolling

name: Pocket Ops: The Hypnotist
description: This elusive 9th Specialist turns the game on its head for a round as it makes the only available space the one predicted by your opponent.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Deduction, Expansion for Base-game, Spies/Secret Agents
mechanics: Pattern Building

name: Cry Wolf
description:
Cry Wolf is a fast simultaneous play bluffing micro game for two players. Each player either takes the role of the shepard boy or the wolf. The boy wins by crying wolf as the wolf attacks five times. The wolf is trying to sneak past the boy and eat five sheep.
This game also involves a hand management. Running out of cards as the boy means you've lost credibility and can not defend you flock for a turn. As the wolf running out of cards represents starving off.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Hand Management, Rock-Paper-Scissors, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Fallout: Wasteland Warfare – Robots Core Box
description:
In Fallout: Wasteland Warfare, players will build their own crew from a wide range of factions, allies and iconic characters from the Fallout series, and play in apocalyptic games of 3 - 30 high quality 32mm scale resin miniatures through a huge variety of iconic scenery and settlement buildings, from the Red Rocket to Sanctuary Hills, Nuka- Cola vending machines and wrecked cars.

This Fallout: Wasteland Warfare set contains 32mm scale high-quality multi-part resin miniatures with scenic bases. Requires some assembly. Supplied unpainted. Each set provides an expansion to your game with new cards for player vs player and AI game modes.

Includes:

Miniatures

2x Protectron, 1x Sentry Bot, 3x Assaultron, 1x Eyebot, 1x Mr Handy, 8x Scenic bases

Cards

10x Large cards: unit & AI and 10+ Small cards from a range of: Items (Weapon, Equipment, Mod, Chem), Boost, Heroic, Quest, Perk, Leader, Explore, Event, Wasteland (Danger, Creature, Stranger)
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Horror, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Video Game Theme, Wargame
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Player Elimination, Simulation

name: Blood Red Skies: Soviet Liszunov Li-2 Transport Aircraft
description:
The American C-47 Skytrain (Dakota to RAF) was a militarised redesign of the civilian DC-3 airliner, highly valued for its rugged endurance.

Under lend-lease agreements with the Soviet Union, the redesign DC-3 became the Li-2 Transport with the notable turret defence now included.

Contains:

3 x Soviet Liszunov Li-2 Transport Aircraft
3 x Decal sheet
3 x Advantage Flying Base and extension
3 x Double-sided Pilot Skill discs
1 x Aircraft Card
1 x Assembly instruction leaflet
categories: Aviation / Flight, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Daggers High
description:
In Daggers High, you play an overworked high school student who will do anything to get into the best university in the nation. Unfortunately, only one student will be accepted. Manage your grades, social life, and influence with teachers to gain resume points. The player with the most resume points at the end of the game wins!

Players begin the game with 4 Freshman event cards, and draft them. In a two-player game, the players will draw 6 Freshman event cards and discard 2 of them. Then, the players take turns playing cards from their hand. The card's event occurs. Then, the player gains a number of action points. Each action point can be spent on one of the five actions. Players can socialize to gain friends that can be used to purchase club leadership, granting an immediate and yearly bonus as well as Resume Points. Players can also study to gain one of four stats that can go towards test correcting a class, another action. Correcting a class to an A provides a teacher influence bonus as well as resume points. A player can also chat with one of eight teachers to gain teacher influence with them. This influence can be spent on a special ability or on gaining a recommendation letter that is worth a significant amount of Resume Points. Finally, players can relax to reduce their stress. This is important because a high amount of stress will cause breakdown, resulting in lower happiness that increases stress at the end of every year, and a detention that causes a loss of Resume Points.

Players also manage secret goals in the form of Essays. Each player is dealt two Essays at the beginning of the game, and can complete them at any time to draw an additional essay. All essays are worth points at the end of the game. At the start of Junior Year, players may also elect to take the FUN, a standardized test that costs Stats to take. The FUN result is determined by a die roll, and can result in a large resume point bonus, or nothing at all.

-description from designer
mechanics: Action Points, Hand Management, Open Drafting

name: The Walking Dead: All Out War – Rick, Prison Advisor Booster
