description:
This booster pack contains 3 unique, collectible miniatures allowing you to add Rick Grimes and Harold Abernathy to your games, along with an extra Walker to bulk out your herd.

Contents:
- Plastic Rick Grimes and Harold Abernathy Miniatures
- Plastic Walker Miniature
- Rick Grimes, Prison Advisor and Harold Abernathy Character Cards
- .357 IMI Desert Eagle, Crowbar, Makeshift Body Armour, and Riot Gear Equipment Cards
- 1 Mantic Point
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Zombies
mechanics: Dice Rolling

name: The Walking Dead: All Out War – Abraham Booster
description:
This booster pack contains 2 unique, collectible miniatures allowing you to add Abraham and Jud to your games.

—description from the publisher
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Zombies
mechanics: Dice Rolling

name: Thinkamabob
description:
Thinkamabob the game that tickles every inch of your brain

What You're Playin' For: Use the Thinkamabobs + your big brain to complete challenges and earn points as you use the five areas of brain function: critical thinking, coordination, memory, word skill, and visual perception. Use points to move pawns around the track and into your Winner's Row!

However, if you can't complete a challenge, be prepared to be judged, because as a group, all your competitors will decide your score! Just remember, what goes around comes around... (We really could have called this game "Think-karma-bob.")

—description from the publisher
categories: Action / Dexterity, Memory, Party Game, Word Game
mechanics: Memory, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Soberano
description:
Soberano ("Sovereign") is a card game that simulates a Renaissance court power struggle. The cards represent the characters, alliances, and powers. It's a fast-paced deck-building game with some twists.

•••

Soberano é um jogo de cartas que simula a disputa pelo poder em uma corte renascentista. As cartas representam os personagens, suas alianças e seus poderes.

Descrição “O Rei está morto.”

Sem herdeiros aparentes e com todas as famílias nobres do reino alegando pretensão ao trono, o futuro parece incerto. Mas, de fato, apenas os Áquila e os Leone tem poder e influência para validar sua reivindicação e eles concordam em apenas uma coisa: preferem uma guerra a aceitar seus rivais no trono.

Você sabia disso. Você se preparou para isso. Infiltrou aliados leais a você nas duas famílias e agora chegou a hora de agir. Afinal, a coroa ficará melhor na sua cabeça.

“Vida longa ao Soberano.”

O Jogo
Em SOBERANO, você precisa usar sua astúcia e correr riscos para demonstrar força, enquanto a guerra civil entre as duas famílias mais poderosas assola o reino. Para isso, você vai manipular a corte e recrutar aliados nas duas famílias, trazendo esses personagens para trabalhar para você. Mas, não se iluda, a lealdade deles é temporária. Basta você pedir um favor ou fazer uma intriga e eles irão considerar qualquer influência que você tinha sobre eles paga. Controlar a burguesia, o clero e a nobreza é o seu maior objetivo e você realiza isso através de intrigas. Se você conseguir fazer isso antes que as outras famílias percebam quem é a ameaça, o seu plano pode funcionar e a coroa terminar sob a sua cabeça.

SOBERANO é um jogo de cartas para 2 a 4 jogadores disputando o direito ao trono. É um construtor de baralho, desconstruído, já que as cartas que você recruta para o seu baralho são temporárias. É também uma corrida por cinco pontos de vitória, representados pelas castas da sociedade (Burgueses, Clero e Nobres) associados as duas famílias principais. Aquele que conseguir os cinco pontos, provou para o reino que tem o que é preciso para ser chamado o SOBERANO. Não Avaliado
Componentes Componentes

32 Cartas de Aliados (4 conjuntos de 8 cartas - 1 a 4 - vermelhos e azuis)
24 Cartas da Corte (5 a 10 - vermelhos e azuis, duas cartas de cada cor)
10 Cartas de Locais (Burgueses, Clero e Nobres - vermelhos e azuis, uma carta de cada cor | Vila Inicial - quatro cartas, uma para cada jogador)
12 Cartas Melhorias (Laços e Cargos)
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building

name: Alien vs Predator: Alien Predators Expansion
description:
Predators, also known as yautja, are an alien race that is best known for their hunting of the most dangerous prey in the galaxy, including humans and xenomorphs. These Hunts, as they are known, are done for honor, sport, and as a rite of passage for young Predators looking to become adults in their own right.

They are a sentient race that is humanoid in appearance, but larger than most actual humans in size, standing well over seven feet tall and weighing 300 lbs or more in many cases. They breathe an atmosphere that is similar to Earth’s, though with a higher degree of nitrogen. Their faces have been seen to have quill-like hair on their brows, cheeks, and chins. Their mouths have four mandibles they use to help communicate or to show emotion, several sharp teeth used to tear flesh, and a small, thin, snake-like tongue. Their elongated heads have a crown of thick bone and end in a mass of long appendages that have been nicknamed dreadlocks.

As with humans, their skin color can vary from light to dark hues, as well as striped and mottled patterns.
While primitive and tribal in appearance, their technology is extremely advanced. Their armor and weapons
are made from an alloy that is resistant to even the corrosive effects of a xenomorphs acid blood. Most of them
mount a plasma caster on their shoulder; a powerful energy cannon able to kill most of their enemies in a single
shot that utilizes a high-tech, triple targeting laser to track their foes. Other weapons include combi-sticks, which are collapsible spears, and smart-disks that can eliminate multiple enemies in a single throw.

On their left arm, each yautja wears a wrist-gauntlet which allows them to access many different systems. It controls their cloaking ability, access and remote piloting control of their ships, local terrain layouts, and even contains a miniature nuclear explosive to ensure that their technology doesn’t fall into their enemy’s hands.
Some more evolved Predators even incorporate a second set of wrist-blades or even more weaponry packed into them.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Krimi Total Fall 15: Nachts im Salon Rouge
description:
General info on Krimi Total: Murder mystery game in which players act out their role and try to solve the mystery.

Info on this particular case: "Nachts im Salon Rouge" is the 15th case in the Krimi Total series. It takes place in the night club "Salon Rouge" 1924 in Berlin. The owner "Carl Holzmann" was found dead and it can be assumed, that the murderer is still within the Salon.

In "Nachts im Salon Rouge" there are 8 obligatory roles (can't be played with less then 8): 4 males, 4 females. One optional role, the inspector, can be either male or female. The roles include: the Salon's bookkeeper, the victims wife and brother, an excentric lady, twi burlesque dancers from the Salon, the barkeeper and an unknown guest.
mechanics: Role Playing, Storytelling

name: This Is Only a Test
description:
Description from the publisher:

It’s a lovely sunny morning with Dad smoking his pipe and reading the Sunday paper, Mom cooking bacon in the kitchen, Billy shooting everything in sight with his Yellow Flyer BB gun™ and Sally combing her porcelain dolly’s hair. But then the silence is broken by the blare of the local air-raid siren. Who knows what this could mean?

Will the Reds invade?
Will the Atomic Bomb Drop?
Or, perhaps, THIS IS ONLY A TEST?

Find out as you and your friends jockey for supplies and nudge the doomsday clock ever closer to the brink!

GAMEPLAY

"This Is Only A Test" is a pre-Apocalyptic game of civil defense. Panic is building and you must negotiate for supplies in anticipation of three unique endings. bomb. Players can use there actions to investigate the timeline, or (better yet) manipulate it to press for there preferred ending by visiting City Hall. Each location in City Hall allows players to manipulate the timeline in different ways. Want the bomb to drop? Visit the Mayor's office and start adding Bomb cards to the timeline! Here's the catch those same actions are used to gather supplies to win. So, while you're out ensuring the bomb will drop, the other players may be gathering consumables to put in there fallout shelter!

When the game ends, the player who has prepared the best, for the correct ending will win! So, if the Atomic bomb drops, you had better have the most supplies in your Fallout shelter, but if the Reds invade, self-defense items will rule the day. What happens if the Bomb doesn't drop, or the Reds don't invade? Well, This is Only a Test, of course! And, the golden rule applies - the person with the most glorious riches wins!

WHY IT'S UNIQUE

"This Is Only A Test" uses a unique timeline mechanic that keeps the players in suspense as the game races towards an unknown conclusion at an unknown time. The timeline may contain the Red Invasion card or the Atomic Bomb card. Then again, it may not.

WHO IT'S FOR

If you love suspense and hidden information with a dash of bluffing, this is the fallout shelter for you. Great for 1-4 friends who love to outwit one another in 45-60 mins.

THE AIR RAID SIREN IS SOUNDING!

Will you stockpile heaps of supplies, defend yourself to the teeth, or simply profit from other’s paranoia? The Red Army looms! The A-bomb is armed! Is it time to duck and cover? Or perhaps..."This Is Only A Test".
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Naja: 3-4 players expansion
description:
It expands Naja for for 3–4 players.

Contains:

15 gray najas
15 purple najas
30 gray baskets
30 purple baskets
categories: Abstract Strategy, Ancient, Animals, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Enclosure, Tile Placement

name: Votoms Tactics
description:
Tactical level wargame based on Japanese animation series "Armored Trooper VOTOMS".
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Armored_Trooper_Votoms

Players control one or more Armored Troopers, aka VOTOMS (Vertical One-man Tank for Offense & ManeuverS).

In the plot phase you set 3 mission disk cards. Each mission disk card designate movement speed, movement direction and combat availability. In the action phases, players alternate flipping a plotted card one by one, resolving movement and combat.

10 scenarios reproduce the various battles in the story. Victory conditions are defined for each scenario. For example, destruction of enemy troops or specific target, escape from the battlefield etc.
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Simulation, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Kansho
description:
Kansho is a traditional board game which requires deduction and tactical thinking.

The aim of Kansho is simple: To occupy as much space on the board as possible before the game ends when all markers are expended.

Players place markers on the board in such a way as to maximize their ownership of the board whilst at the same time removing as many of their opponents markers as possible. Markers are removed from the board if they are surrounded by their opponents markers, or have one or fewer neighbors.

This means that games of Kansho are often won or lost on a single critical move that can occur at any time during the game. Players must therefore play with precision and cunning in order to be victorious.

The rules of Kansho are few and simple to grasp but a great deal of practice and skill is required in order to master the game.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Enclosure, Worker Placement

name: Moonshot: The Next Giant Leap
description:
Build your rocket, get the funding and shoot for the Moon! But beware of the other space agency’s efforts and the risks during launch since only one team can win the race for the Moonlanding.

Moonshot: The Next Giant Leap is a team-based boardgame that encapsulates the thrill of the space race between the U.S. and the USSR with asymmetrical roles between team members.
The game pays tribute to the historical events, but it does not follow them strictly. Instead every game mechanism is inspired by the complex processes in the managerial and technical side of a space program.

Innovative gameplay solutions and a highly interactive setting let players experience their own unique story leading to the next giant leap of mankind.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Pattern Building, Push Your Luck, Team-Based Game, Tile Placement

name: Sword & Sorcery: Hero Pack – Sigrid Thane/Skald
description:
Additional hero for Ancient Chronicles that can also be played with Immortal Souls.

—user summary
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures
mechanics: Action Points, Area Movement, Cooperative Game, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Incantris: Wizard Design Kit
description:
This was a Kickstarter Exclusive expansion. Only 550 were made.
—user summary

The Wizard Design Kit gives you full control over your Incantris team for a more advanced experience.


12 additional wizard miniatures, which gives you each wizard type in all 4 colors (blue, red, purple, grey)



Try different combinations of wizards to find your most lethal team.



Customize your wizards by choosing which spells to equip them with.


—description from the publisher
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board

name: Eternal Kings: Survival
description: This is the first Eternal Kings expansion pack. You will have access to advanced pawns, rooks, knights, bishops, and ability cards for each of the 4 realms. Use these cards to customize your army and ability deck in the most unique of ways!
mechanics: Grid Movement, Hand Management

name: Eternal Kings: Mercenaries
description:
This is an expansion for the Eternal Kings base game. You will have access to new pawns, rooks, knights, and bishops that can use any of the four disciplines! Use these cards to customize your army in the most unique of ways!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Grid Movement, Hand Management

name: All For The Regiment: The American Civil War in Miniature
description:
All For The Regiment is a regimental scale miniatures simulation of the American Civil War. The conflict saw two armies that were very similar in terms of training, doctrine, and to a lesser degree society. This led to many stalemated battles. It also meant the differences in leadership, numbers, weapons, and overall unit quality was crucial in deciding the outcomes of many battles.

—description from the designer
categories: American Civil War, Civil War, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Simulation

name: Pop Team Epic Kuso Card Game Vol. 2: Saikyou Kuso Shinka!
description:
This is a game for 2 to 5 people that is a harsh parody of trading card games. The cards are intentionally overpowered and poorly balanced. It's based off of the comic Pop Team Epic.

—user summary

AmiAmi's sweepingly successful "Pop Team Epic Kuso Card Game" is back with version 2!
This authentic trading card game-ish card game is upgraded to be even more Crapperific!
The highly rated Crap elements from the first version are strengthened in addition two new ones added like "hieroglyphic text" and "effects on other separate games" to reach a new level of Crappy.
This can be mixed with the 1st version and played to be even more special.
That's not all! It has lots of content from the "Pop Team Epic" anime starting with "Aoi Shouta" from the last episode to the "Takeshobo Building" which fans loved.
Some card game's illustrator drew 4 new fake illustrations that are collected here. Enjoy the beautiful illustrations of Popuko and Pipimi that are Magical Girl-ified and Monster-ified!

[We Refuse]

This is a trading card game-ish variety card game. 90% of the content is crap, thank you for your kind understanding.
No matter how crappy this card game is it can at the very least be used for regular card games.
No matter what may happen during a battle the designer and seller take no responsibility. Please understand it is your own or another player's fault.


—description from the publisher
mechanics: Player Elimination, Take That

name: Folklore: The Affliction – Warrior Promo Card
description:
This is a promo card for Folklore: The Affliction.

This promo adds a new Militia (Melee) card to the game. The Warrior has the following ability: "+1 Damage. When rolling to hit, you may reroll a 1."

This promos card id is CO#PP01.

This promo was included in Kickstarter Campaign for "Promo Paradise" which launched Jan 8, 2019 and is scheduled to deliver in Dec 2019.

—user summary
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board

name: Kerfuffle
description:
Abstract card game for two or more players (up two per deck).

Each player has a deck of 25 cards, each containing five copies of five different cards. Each card has a special action that it performs, which either helps the player using it or hinders another player.

On a player's turn, they play one of the cards from their hand in front of them, and then perform the special action associated with that type of card.

The first player to assemble either one card of all five types or five cards of the same type wins.

While the rules are in English, the cards used in the game itself consist purely of an icon, meaning that the game is effectively language independent. Given the large nature of these icons and the colour choices, it's also no problem for colorblind players.

'-description from designer
mechanics: Set Collection

name: Vs. System 2PCG: Cosmic Avengers
description:
Earth’s Mightiest Heroes take to space in this new expansion to Vs. System 2PCG.

This expansion is the first issue of the Infinity War story Arc and brings a lot of strength to the Avengers team. Black Panther, Captain Marvel and Hawkeye showing up as Main Characters in this set with Captain Marvel being able to power up to Level 3.

This set also features two new firsts; Locations and Plot Twists that your Main Character can utilize as powers.
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting
mechanics: Hand Management

name: Vs. System 2PCG: Galactic Guardians
description:
Joining forces with the Guardians of the Galaxy is a host of powerful heroes used to waging battle in the cosmos! Add heroes like Adam Warlock, Cosmo and Star Lord to your deck and stop the enemy in its tracks.

This is not a standalone game.
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting
mechanics: Hand Management

name: Tijou
description:
Tijou is game coming form Quebec (Canada).

It is played with

1 game board with 36 course boxes and 4 finish squares
4 families of 3 rooms
1 set of 54 cards (including joker)


The goal of the game is to send his 3 pieces in ARRIVAL.
to do this, the 3 pieces must enter the course and exit (CASE ARRIVAL).

The Tijou is played by team
Each player faces his teammate and places his pieces in front of him (Off-board)

Player: A dealt cards at the rate of 5 cards per Player counterclockwise (3 + 2).

The teammates exchange 1 card, each will choose the card he gives before looking at the card he receives (It will be the same after each distribution).

The Player located to the right of the one who distributed starts = Player: B.

He then places 1 card in the center of the board and is obliged to execute the value of the card placed in one of his pieces.
Each cards has a value (go forwards/backwards of X boxes, enter in game, go to the arrival, exchanes of pieces,...)

If he can not execute the value of the card placed on one of his coins, he plays a card without playing a coin.
This is the opponent on his right to play = Player: C.
Then it's the turn of: D (then A, B, C ... so on.)
When a player has only 2 cards in his hand, he has the option to keep them, he then abstains from playing by specifying that he passes his turn.

The other players have the same choice and can continue to play until their cards are exhausted or pass their turn when they want.
(A Player can therefore keep 1 to 2 cards at the end of each turn)

Tijou ends when a player has sent his 3 pieces in ARRIVAL.
The team of this player is declared winner.
At the end of each game, it is awarded 1 POINT to each team-mate of the winning team.
Then: Change of team for a second part.
Then: Change of team for a third part.
The Player (s) with the most points at the end of 3 games is (are) declared winner (s).
mechanics: Open Drafting, Team-Based Game

name: Volturno
description:
"Volturno" is part of "Radetzky's March" series.
The heart of the system is the command: simply check how many points you have in the turn, choose the formations you will activate, put them inside a mug; your opponent does the same, then mix and draw.

Historical Note:
Following the invasion of southern Italy by revolutionary forces led by Giuseppe Garibaldi in 1860, Francis II of the Two Sicilies fled from Naples and took up a defensive position on the south bank of the Volturno, near S. Maria di Capua Vetere. The Piedmontese troops and those of Garibaldi inflicted on the Neapolitan forces at the battle of the Volturno, on 1 and 2 October, a defeat which led to the fall of Capua.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Simulation

name: Cenayang: A Game of Assumptions
description:
In a circle table, watched by million people and live streamed to many television stations, people with the greatest intuition sit and battle to fight over the “Cenayang of the Year” title.

Cenayang: A Game of Assumptions, is a social-party board game that is designed to let the players know each other better in an exciting and fun way.

Each round, players will be given a topic card and target card with a secret number. Taking turns, players will play as the Active Player. The Active Player must compose a cenayang sentence, which can be responded with yes or no by other players and must be related to the obtained topic. The role of the Active Player is to get a total of YES answers that matches the target card, while the role of the others is to guess the total of YES answers that will show up. The game will run until there is at least 1 player who reach 10 points.

In each game of Cenayang, whether they win or lose, players will have new stories about the other players which they haven’t heard before.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Storytelling, Voting

name: Kepler Run
description:
It is the dawn of interstellar travel for man. New technologies have been developed which allow interstellar star pilots to overcome challenges like stellar debris, warped space, and black holes. Mass production has finally brought the costs of these technological marvels down enough to be accessible to the private sector, and like any good space civilization you capitalize on the opportunity.

In Kepler Run, you play an independent space runner attempting to win the most riches for yourself by being the first to fulfill lucrative contracts the fastest. You'll need to put all of your runner know-how to good use, and with a little bit of planning and luck, you can be the first to complete your Kepler Run.

In more detail, Kepler Run is a card-drafting and route-planning game. Each round, new cards are revealed. In turn, players draft a card and decide whether to add it to their ship as an engine, add it to the board (the run) for points, or discard it for fuel modules. After each player has drafted two tiles, in turn players attempt to make it as far as they can, crossing from one side of the board to the other. Players collect points depending on how far they get and on which objective they complete along the way. After three rounds of drafting and running, the player with the most points wins.

—description from designer
mechanics: Open Drafting, Tile Placement

name: Anno Urbis: The Fight for Rome
description:
Ancient Rome, IV century A.D.: it is a stormy period in Roman Empire, the quiet of past centuries is only a memory and the struggle for the title of Emperor is increasingly harsh.
In the Capital of the Empire, the most important "Gens" do not miss a chance to try to increase their power, to be able to influence the new Augustus as much as possible. Despite political instability, each faction wants to enlarge its possessions and is not afraid to face also armed clashes, with bloody battles later forgotten in the windings of the official historiography... Meanwhile, the Arena and the gladiators are important faces in the fight for the power: the people worship their idols!

Anno Urbis - The Fight for Rome is a strategy and combat board game, set in a period where the power of emperors is often challenged by ambitious province governors or by smart military commanders. In Rome, the Senate is torn apart by the struggle among the various factions, while the people can be influenced by the charisma of the heroes fighting in the Arena. You will have to balance the development of each settlement, the conquest of new territories (even through military battles) and the growth of the skills of your Hero, so to control the most of the Eternal City’s seven hills: only in this way it will be possible to dominate Rome and, perhaps in the future, even the entire Empire...

In Anno Urbis - The Fight for Rome, each player will command a powerful Roman dynasty and will have to struggle to gain the domination over the Capital of the Empire: build barracks and farms and expand your influence on the “domus” on the seven hills of Rome, but do not forget to use your resources to erect a temple in honor of one of the deities! In return, you will have incredible relics for your hero, as well as unique powers for gaining an advantage and defeat your rivals. But do not underestimate the Arena, if you manage to accumulate more glory, the whole city could be yours, but if you were defeated... well, in Rome the losers have a short life!

Anno Urbis - The Fight for Rome offers exceptional components, many miniatures and the 3D models of the seven hills of Rome, true focus of the game and whose conquest will determine the winner. Next to them there is also the Gladiator Arena, in which the players’ fighters will compete to the death to increase glory and influence of their faction. The union among resources management, cards and combat make this game unique, but also the historical accuracy is important: indeed, we tried to rely on really existed events, characters and places, to allow players to immerse themselves in a sometimes neglected, but also fascinating and glorious, historical period.

—description from the publisher
categories: Ancient, Card Game, Civil War, Dice, Economic, Fighting, Mythology
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Worker Placement

name: TANKS: The Modern Age – French AMX-30 Tank Expansion
description:
AMX-30 Tanks
The AMX-30 is an incredibly flexible tank, coming in only at 13 points you get a well-rounded fighting machine. Along with having a base Attack of 4, the AMX-30 also has a 20mm automatic cannon AA gun built into its turret giving a higher than average Anti-Air attack. Being able to pose a threat to both Tanks and Helicopters is something quite powerful and makes this French tank very flexible. Want to run a swarm of these awesome tanks? At 13 points each you can easily fit seven AMX-30 in your Platoon for only 91 points.

AMX AUF1 Tank
AMX AUF1 is the only Artillery tank in the game so far, giving it a special place in the French army. This tank can ignore other tanks when firing its main gun and gains a lot of other Artillery related options that will give it great tactical flexibility in the game.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Captain Marvel: Secret Skrulls – Kree Fighter
description: Kree Fighter is a promotional Weapon Card for Captain Marvel: Secret Skrulls. When you have Kree Fighter in play, “You see others at Range of 1. This card is modified only by cards in play.”
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Deduction, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Negotiation
mechanics: Hand Management, Player Elimination, Take That, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Captain Marvel: Secret Skrulls – Skrull Stun Gun
description: Skrull Stun Gun is a promotional Range 1 Weapon Card for Captain Marvel: Secret Skrulls. When you have Skrull Stun Gun in play, “You may play 2 ATTACK Cards together as one. Players must use 2 EVADE Cards to evade this ATTACK.”
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Deduction, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Negotiation
mechanics: Hand Management, Player Elimination, Take That, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Planetary Destruction
description:
The game Planetary Destruction was inspired by the dark forest version of the Fermi Paradox.

In its simplest form, it asks the question: 'If odds are good that many advanced alien races exist, how come none have been discovered?'

The answer, according to the dark forest theory, is that all civilizations that are found to exhibit intelligent life are immediately and utterly destroyed. Why bother facing a potential enemy tomorrow, when they can be turned into ash today.
This game captures some of that sense of desperation, but remains simple in its implementation.

As such, there are three actions to choose from each turn: bomb one planet, search a general area for enemy colonies nearby, and search two planets for enemy colonies to confirm their specific location.

The galaxy is a dark forest, filled with ravenous enemies.
There can only be one victor.
mechanics: Action Points, Modular Board, Player Elimination

name: CINICUS
description:
CINICUS "Afila tu lengua y no te cortes"
¿Eres capaz de expresar ternura hablando del matamoscas?
¿Puedes inventar la historia del hada y el taxista?
¿Cuántos argumentos se te ocurren a favor de los picores?
¿Y en contra de la tarta de manzana?

CINICUS es un juego de expresión oral para mayores de 14 años y adultos.

EMOCIÓN: ¿Conseguirás que tu equipo adivine la emoción secreta hablándoles durante un minuto sin nombrarla?

IMAGINACIÓN: ¿Sabrás inventar el final de una historia que CINICUS te da empezada?
¿Puedes inventarla entera sólo con dos personajes?
¿Y si es la biografía de un personaje imaginario?

OPINIÓN: ¿Encontrarás más argumentos que el otro equipo a favor o en contra de un tema?

El juego se organiza en dos equipos. Durante el turno se tira el dado y según en que casilla se recae se deberá adivinar una emoción descrita por un miembro del equipo sin nombrarla explícitamente, continuar una historia propuesta por una carta o bien dar el mayor número de razones a favor o en contra de un concepto cotidiano.

Se supone que el equipo ganador es el primero que alcance la última casilla del tablero pero las instrucciones omiten cualquier referencia sobre ello.

¡Fabuloso juego familiar!

ENGLISH VERSION

The game is organized in two teams. Depending on the die we will guess a secret feeling from a team mate performance without saying its explicit name, follow an invented story proposed by a card or simply give the most reasons to support or to refuse a daily concept.

It's supposed that reaching the last board position, your team wins but the instructions doesn't mention it in a explicit sense.

Amazing Party-Game !

CINICUS "Sharpen your tongue and don't cut yourself"
Are you able to express tenderness by talking about the fly swatter?
Can you invent the story of the fairy and the taxi driver?
How many arguments come to mind in favor of itching?
And against the apple pie?

CINICUS is an oral expression game for people over 14 and adults.

EMOTION: Will you get your team to guess the secret emotion by talking to them for a minute without naming it?

IMAGINATION: Will you know how to invent the end of a story that CINICUS gives you started?
Can you invent it whole with only two characters?
What if it is the biography of an imaginary character?

OPINION: Will you find more arguments than the other team for or against a topic?

The game is organized in two teams. During the turn, the dice are rolled and according to which box falls, an emotion described by a team member must be guessed without explicitly naming it, continuing a story proposed by a letter or giving the greatest number of reasons for or against A daily concept.

The winning team is supposed to be the first to reach the last square of the board but the instructions omit any reference to it.

Fabulous family game!
mechanics: Storytelling, Team-Based Game

name: A Song of Ice & Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game – Conscripts
description:
When one makes their way into the Night's Watch, they aren't simply made a Sworn Brother immediately. While the organization has traditionally lax rules for recruitment, there is still a period where those that sign up are simply conscripts, being used where necessary to keep those south of The Wall safe. Eventually, if they survive, and with proper training, they will have the opportunity to join the Night's Watch proper.

The Conscripts unit box for A Song of Ice & Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game for the Night's Watch army is not as strong or as tough as many of the other units available to Night's Watch Commanders. However, what they lack in abilities they make up for in ease of fielding. Night's Watch units can get costly points-wise to bring to battle, so the Conscripts can help balance numbers closer to equal. And the Watch Recruiter Unit Attachment can help any unit in the Night's Watch army work just a bit more efficiently.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Novel-based, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling
publishers: CMON Global Limited, Dark Sword Miniatures, Inc., Edge Entertainment

name: Thief!: Dragon's Treasure
description:
You greedy Dwarves! You have all stumbled upon a sleeping dragon with a stash of coins beneath it. Your greed far outweighs your terror as you realise it’s every Dwarf for themselves. You all want a cut of the Dragon’s treasure, but you know that the more coins you steal, the closer you get from waking the terrible fire breathing Dwarf eating red MONSTER!

Do you stay and risk waking the Dragon, or run with your stolen loot in hopes of emerging the den with the most loot.

Thief! Dragon's Treasure is a light blind bag pull and pass game by designer, Albert Caynes. The game was originally designed at the request of an Australian publisher, however, the co-owner of the publisher had not confirmed with the other publisher, leading to a complete re-theme of the game.

The game is all about Dwarves stealing coins from a sleeping dragon, keep pushing your luck and stealing coins until you run, or you're eaten!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Push Your Luck

name: Pocket Generals
description: Fight to relive or re-write world history! Players command world famous military and political leaders on the field of battle! Pocket Generals combines simultaneous card play, with lightning-quick strategy elements, action selection, resource management, and area control to deliver a game that puts you on the front line of epic world defining battles.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Card Game, Educational, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Hand Management, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Death Ride Kursk: Korps Raus
description:
Korps Raus is an expansion for Death Ride Kursk - III Panzer Korps. It includes the 3 German Infantry Divisions that helped to secure the III PzK right flank during the Kursk battles. This is a mostly infantry battle with a few units of StG that were supporting the korps.

Your goal is to disrupt the Red Army forces in the area such that they cannot prevent or slow the III PzK from accomplishing its' mission.

Scenarios for this game start on 4 July and through 13 July.

Korps Raus - comes with (in Full Color):

(6) Map Sections of the Donets River Area of Operations (maps Y3 & Y4, Z1 to Z4)
Order of Battle Cards
Task Organization Charts
2800+ Unit Counters and Markers


(adapted from publisher's website description)
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Hexagon Grid

name: TANKS: The Modern Age – Leopard 1 Tank Expansion
description:
The Leopard 1 tank sacrifices protection for speed and firepower in a package that continues the tradition of Germany designing and building some of the best tanks in the world. Like its namesake, the Leopard 1 tank springs from ambush to strike at its prey before using its speed to escape revenge.

This pack contains:
1x Unassembled Leopard 1 tank
1x Leopard 1 Tank card
2x Hero cards
1x Crew card
2x Upgrade cards
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Modern Warfare, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Countdown
description:
This is the word-game portion of the popular British game show. (It does not include the numbers game or the conundrum game.) It includes 22 vowel cards, 33 consonant cards, a tray, and sand timer.

During a player's turn they turn up 9 cards from the vowel and consonant decks, with the balance of vowels and consonants up to them. They then turn the timer and everyone writes down words they can form from the revealed cards, trying to come up with the longest word. When time is up, the player with the longest word scores the length of their word; tied players all score. The winner is the player with the highest score after an agreed number of rounds.

There are also rules for a Word Count Game. The mechanics are the same, but players score for every word they write down:
1 pt - 3 letters
2 pts - 4 letters
3 pts - 5 letters
5 pts - 6-8 letters
10 pts - 9 letters
The highest score after the agreed number of rounds wins.

—user summary
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Negotiators
description:
Cooperative game for four players, who take the role of negotiators sent to a summit meeting each with a hidden agenda. Each player is given one or more hidden goals at the start of the game. At the end of the game all players must have fulfilled all of their goals to achieve a shared victory, or they all lose. Players are not allowed to discuss their own goals, but are encouraged to discuss the other players goals openly.

Each turn consists of the current player making a suggestion for a trade between themselves and whoever agrees to the trade. Trades consists of changes in a resource value in one of four resources for each of the two players participating in the deal. The proposal cards held by the current player limits what trade deals are possible and the acceptance cards held by the opponents limits who can actually accept the deal.

Game ends when the deck of suggestion card run out for the second time or when the players have turned down ten suggested deals.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deduction, Trading

name: A Song of Ice & Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game – Hand of the King Expansion
description:
Kickstarter Exclusive Hand of the King Promo set

For "A Song of Ice and Fire Miniatures Tabletop Game"
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Novel-based, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Worker Placement

name: TANKS: The Modern Age – M901 ITV Tank Expansion
description:
Based on the M113 Armoured Personnel Carrier, the M163 VADS mounts a rapid firing multi-barrel cannon, allowing it to engage low flying aircraft and light vehicles with a lethal barrage of 20mm shells. The M113 has also been adapted into a fearsome tank killer in the form of the M901 ITV. The ITV uses its ‘Hammerhead’ TOW missile launcher to engage targets from hidden positions.

This pack contains:
1x Unassembled M901 ITV or M163 VADS tank
1x M163 VADS Tank card
1x M901 Tank card
1x Hero card
1x Crew card
2x Upgrade cards
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Modern Warfare, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling

name: Devil's Run: Route 666 – Miles' Massacre
description:
The Miles' Massacre is a stand alone expansion set which is fully compatible with all other versions of Devil's Run. It is all you need to play or can be mashed together with any of the other sets

A battle between the BritAttack and the Los Nigromates...who will win...who will even survive?

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Bushido: Risen Sun – Two Player Starter Set
description:
Bushido is a game of savage battles, of cunning stratagems and last-ditch defences, and where debts of honour are paid in blood.

In Bushido, the fate of the world hangs not on armies but on individual heroes, people of extraordinary capacity, attuned to the all-permeating life force known as Ki. This force is the fabric of the Bushido universe, and those with the appropriate training or natural talent can tap into this energy source and gain seemingly superhuman powers. In the world of Bushido, the delicate tapestry of Ki – and thus the universe itself – is threatened by the forces of imbalance, and it is up to you to protect it – or help rip it apart.

In a game of Bushido, nothing less than the fate of the universe is at stake. Are you ready for the challenge of the Way of the Warrior?

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: DIRT
description:
DIRT is a card game all about getting your hands dirty and racing to unearth dino bones. Players take turns digging through Dirt Piles to find dino bones. Using Tools and Attacks, players compete to assemble the most dino skeletons. The game ends once all the Dirt Cards are collected or all the dino skeletons are assembled.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Set Collection

name: Merkez
description:
Inspired by local elections in Turkey and empty promises, this game casts you as an Urban Planner. Your goal is to impress the current Mayor and score the most points with your blueprint. The blueprint should include plans to build schools with bike roads, animal hospitals, fund funding allocations, provide free Wi-Fi, and assign Civil Servants to hospitals and schools. Every building needs civilians; unemployed civilians (those not assigned to a building) will cost you points. Even if you can't construct a building on your turn, you must build a road or pavement, following the curve dictated by the dice.

The ultimate aim is to position yourself as the next Mayor.

The game unfolds over several rounds, with the following phases in each round:

1- Throw dice.
2- The first player claims a Promise Card (optional).
3- Players claim regions based on the dice roll and draw symbols.
4- End of the round.

You score points by drawing icons in the colored regions. The game ends when there are no free spots left on any player's sheet. The player with the highest score wins!

—description from the designer
categories: City Building, Civilization, Dice, Print & Play
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Line Drawing, Network and Route Building, Open Drafting, Paper-and-Pencil

name: Nottingham 2084
description:
Nottingham, year 2084. Nott. Corps. controls the resources of the land, under the oppressing hand of K1NG-J0HN. In this time of despair, only a small group of humans, The Merry People, and their fierce leader Robin, stand their ground to face the robotic oppressors.

Nottingham 2084 is an asymmetrical game where two teams face each other to pick and deliver resources. On one side there is Robin and the Merry People (M.P.), collecting resources for humanity, and on the other, the Nottingham Corps.’s (N.C.) robots who want to control the resources to enslave humanity.

Each faction has unique powers and skills that you can use during the game, as well as different ways of collecting and saving the resources they gather. The Merry People will take the fuel from the robot’s towers and their HQ’s, while the robots will sack the villages and cities, stealing from the people. Then, the M.P will deliver those resources to the people in the cities, while the N.C will store them at to their own Headquarters. At the end of the game, the team with more resources collected will be the winners of the game.

Will you help Robin and the Merry People save Humanity? Or will you guide K1NG-J0HN’s robots on their path to human slavery?

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Points, Pick-up and Deliver

name: Bare Knuckle!
description:
Bare-Knuckle! takes place in the rough and tumble era of English bare-knuckle boxing of the 1700’s. A time of the London prize ring rules when men of grit and brawn would throw their hat in the ring and fight round after round until one of them could not continue.

Bare-Knuckle! recreates a single round exhibition match. Two pugilists will enter the ring and take turns playing punches, grapples and other moves using cards and dice - all in an attempt to knock your opponent to the ground. The first boxer to knock their opponent down wins the match!

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Fighting, Print & Play, Sports
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Simulation, Simultaneous Action Selection, Take That

name: NonSense VDM
description:
The game NonSense VDM ("Vie de Merde" aka FML "F… my Life") it's:

FML stories in situation: FML stories to tell while slipping in a mysterious word which often doesn't blend naturally in the narrative. For example: "A burst of laughter hits you during a meeting" but the narrator must use the word "sausage" without people noticing it doesn't belong in the story. If the other players find out, the narrator has lost.
A game for all ages: everybody can play and improvise with real anecdotes or fictional stories.
And as a bonus: a booklet with the most insane FMLs! Pick one, improvise around it, slip in a secret word and don't get caught!
mechanics: Pattern Recognition, Storytelling

name: Ignite Cards
description:
Ignite is a fast-paced game where you race to destroy opposing forges by commanding your minions to ignite, attack, and combo your way to victory!

As the Forgemaster, your task is to construct a powerful lineup to destroy the enemy's Forge. When your Forge takes damage, remove that many cards from the top of your Forge, placing them into your Scrapheap. Once an empty Forge takes damage, it's destroyed and that player loses the game.

Your Forge consists of 30 Minion cards, which behave like most monsters in games in the TCG/CCG genre: they have cost, attack, and health values, and can attack each other or a "life total" (an opposing forge). The playboard features a place for the players deck (Forge), destroyed minions (Scrapheap), Energy used to summon minions, and summoned minions (Lineup). The core mechanic of the game is Ignite: all Bot cards Ignite. When a Bot Ignites, players roll the two Ignite Dice (d6) to determine which target is hit and for how much. The Bot has Ignite Values, displayed on the bottom in three flames, which display how much damage is caused by the explosion.

There are two parts of the turn: Attacking and Building. During Attacking, players can attack with any number of their Minions against any opposing Minion or Forge. If there is a Forge Guardian (minion on slot 1), that Minion must be attacked and destroyed first. The second part of the turn is Building, where players can spend Energy to summon Minions, or draw cards. Players start their turns with 4 Energy, with the first turn of the game starting with only 2 (2 player only), and players start the game with 5 cards in their hands. Minions typically have one of two abilities: Summon or Scrap abilities, which occur when the minion is Summoned or Destroyed respectively. The deck is full of Bots which Ignite, and Forgelings, which can be combined with them to Ignite more often or power up Ignite abilities. For 3+ player games, player sit in a circle, play proceeds clockwise, you can only attack adjacent players, and Ignites hit both adjacent players! To start, simply place your shuffled Forge on your game board, along with 4 energy, then draw 5 cards.

For more you can find the website at https://ignite.cards/ and the rules at rules.ignite.cards.

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Dice, Fighting, Party Game
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Team-Based Game

name: Modern Aircraft Handbook: Aircraft Details and Weapons for Challenger II
description: Aircraft details and weapons for Challenger II.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Modern Warfare, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil

name: Heart of Leviathan
description:
Heart of Leviathan is a tactical ship to ship engagement simulation set in World War One. Each player takes control of individual semi-historical miniature WWI warships in an effort to reign supreme on the High Seas - er - game table... Choose your colors: The British Grand Fleet or the German High Seas Fleet. Can you command the Battle Squadrons as Jellico, Beatty, Scheer or Hipper did? Could you do better?

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Simulation

name: 7TV: Pulp
description:
7TV: Pulp is a tabletop skirmish game inspired by the American cinema serials and pulp magazines of the 1930s and 1940s. Designed to work with the 7TV 2nd edition rules, 7TV: Pulp rules contained within this box are stand alone, but are intended to allow players to run games within the many fantastic, hardboiled or thrilling worlds of the pulp genre.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling

name: A Game of Swords and Shields: PNP Edition
description:
Stanley Schuster's "A Game of Swords and Shields" is a turn based competitive deck building card battle game for 2 players from age 12. It lasts about 30 to 60 minutes and has a high replayability.
It is less about luck and chance as about strategy and decisions. Its game mechanic and the fact, that you can apply card effects on almost any faced up card, will give you a very unique experience.
Attack your opponent and defend yourself while you are building up an army of swords and shields until one of you loses all their hope or health points.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building

name: Star Fleet Battles: Captain's Module A – Battlecards
description:
Three player aids for Star Fleet Battles

Battlecards - A card based damage allocation system which exactly reproduces the results of the standard Damage Allocation Chart in (D4.31)

Command Cards - Two sets which allow two players to select their combat and maneuver options secretly and simultaneously without the need to write down records.

Impulse Cards - 36 cards, one for each impulse plus four special cards for the start and end of the turn.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Hexagon Grid

name: Warhammer 40,000: Apocalypse – Datasheet Cards: Astra Militarum
description:
A set of Datasheets specifically designed for using your Astra Militarum Citadel miniatures in games of Warhammer 40,000: Apocalypse. Each datacard provides the full rules and profiles for a single unit from the Astra Militarum faction. Also included is a Faction card that details the faction rules that apply to Astra Militarum Detachments. The reverse side of each card features the faction’s icon.

The set includes datacards for the following units:

- Lord Castellan Creed
- Colour Sergeant Kell
- Colonel ‘Iron Hand’ Straken
- Sergeant Harker
- Sly Marbo
- Company Commander
- Platoon Commander
- Knight Commander Pask
- Tank Commander
- Tempestor Prime
- Commissar Yarrick
- Lord Commissar
- Primaris Psyker
- Astropath
- Wyrdvane Psykers
- Militarum Tempestus Command Squad
- Militarum Tempestus Scions
- Colonel Schaeffer’s Last Chancers
- Ogryns
- Bullgryns
- Nork Deddog
- Ratlings
- Special Weapons Squad
- Command Squad
- Master of Ordnance
- Commissar
- Officer of the Fleet
- Infantry Squad
- Conscripts Veterans
- Scout Sentinels
- Armoured Sentinels
- Hellhound
- Bane Wolf
- Devil Dog
- Hydra
- Wyvern
- Basilisk
- Manticore
- Deathstrike
- Leman Russ Battle Tank
- Heavy Weapons Squad
- Banehammer
- Banesword
- Baneblade
- Doomhammer
- Hellhammer
- Shadowsword
- Stormlord
- Stormsword
- Chimera
- Taurox
- Valkyrie
- Taurox Prime

This datacard set requires a copy of Warhammer 40,000: Apocalypse to use.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Sing That Word
description:
Sing That Word is the card game for people who love music.
Even though Sing That Word involves singing, you don't have to be a good singer to be good at the game. You simply have to know songs and song lyrics!

Gameplay in a nutshell: Draw a WORD card from the deck, and then take turns singing song lyrics that contain that WORD. If you successfully sing a lyric, you get a MIC card. The person with the most MIC cards at the end of the round wins the WORD card and the points associated with it (1, 2, or 3 points). The first to 7 points wins the game.

It doesn't matter what genre(s) of music you like because the WORD cards in the deck were compiled based on their frequency of use across all popular genres. We will eventually release genre-specific expansion decks that contain WORD cards that are more common to that genre. (Rap, Country, Metal, Religious, etc). Extremely basic words like "the" and "I" aren't included in the deck.

There are also variations of the game including Rapid Fire Mode, Kanye Mode, and Rap Battle that are described on the included RULES cards.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Singing

name: SAIBOU
description:
SAIBOU is the Japanese word for “cell”. Your goal is simple - create a culture of 9 cell cards in a 3x3 group before your opponents can! Use versatile Stem Cells and Macrophages to fill in gaps and protect yourself, but watch out! Other players can use nasty Bacteria and Virus cards to infect your cells and eat them!

Whether you play carefully or care-free, the luck of the draw and the other players will shake things up for sure!

Part card game, part puzzle, all fun! Quickest games played with two players, but can be played by up to four.
The cards in SAIBOU are deliberately designed with no text, so that anyone can be taught to play by example.

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Medical, Puzzle
mechanics: Pattern Building

name: Human Punishment: Social Deduction 2.0 – Brettspielblog promo card
description:
Promo for Human Punishment

Card text:

"PERMANENT: As an Action, you may steal a weapon or a random program from another player."
categories: Deduction, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction
mechanics: Take That, Team-Based Game, Traitor Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Berge des Wahnsinns: Die Wahnsinns-Erweiterung! (Promo)
description:
Additional madness cards:
3x Level 1 (Breiter Dialekt, Stachenblochen, Ausdruckstanz)
3x Level 2 (Jodeldiplom, Gute Erziehung, Alles nur ein Spiel)
4x Level 3 (Fussballkommentator, Schwäbische Sparsamkeit, Der Gesellige, Keime! Überall Keime!)
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Horror, Novel-based, Real-time
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Role Playing

name: Nova Aetas: Sine Tempore Promo Cards
description:
3 promotional cards shrink wrapped in Sine Tempore: Black Hole Box.

3 cards that expand Nova Aetas
Enemy: Boogeyman
Enemy: Doll
Enemy: Revenant
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures, Mythology, Renaissance
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Role Playing, Storytelling, Team-Based Game, Turn Order: Time Track, Variable Player Powers

name: Vs. System 2PCG: The Utopia Battles
description:
The Utopia Battles is the 1st expansion of the Children of the Atom story arc, which features characters from both the X-men and H.A.M.M.E.R.! Build your deck with iconic heroes and villains like: Cyclops, Emma Frost, Norman Osborn, Weapon Omega and more as the battle over Utopia begins!

Pick up this Battle Box today as a the perfect jump on for new players or bolster your decks with characters and plot twists from the Children of Atom story arc!

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Fighting
mechanics: Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: Wings of Glory: Tripods & Triplanes – MK. I “Locust” Tripod Pack
description:
In Wings of Glory — Tripods & Triplanes, the knights of the air of WW1 battle against colossal fighting machines sent by the Martians to invade Earth.
The MK. I “Locust”, the first tripod involved in combat with Earth forces, remains nonetheless one of the most feared Martian machines.
Armed with lethal black smoke launchers, an effective heat–ray, and with an excellent combination of speed and armor, it has brought death and destruction to Mankind in a way which was never imagined before.
Each Tripod Pack is a ready–to–play model, painted and assembled, 100% compatible with any other WW1 Wings of Glory game product.

—description from the publisher
categories: Aviation / Flight, Expansion for Base-game, Novel-based, Science Fiction, Wargame, World War I
mechanics: Action Queue, Simulation, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Monkey Klash
description:
You are the leader of an army of monkeys and you have only one ambition: to be crowned Alpha player of the game!

Every turn, fruits and/or wasps fall from the trees and you must send one of your monkeys to pick them up. Hide one of your monkeys face down in the bushes and at the signal reveal it along with the other players.

The Primate hierarchy will organize the sharing. Be smart (like a monkey) to get a coveted fruit as soon as possible and klask quickly if another player monkey you with the same card.

If necessary, organize a baboon attack with an accomplice or betray him so that he chooses last. On the other hand, don't let your reflexes betray you: klash for no reason is very frowned upon in monkeys, and violent monkeys use the last ones and receive the pawns of shame.
mechanics: Set Collection

name: Moonstone: Brothers in Arms Troupe Box
description:
This troupe box includes 3 new heroes of Commonwealth fraction.
This miniatures are made in fine quality resin. Every miniature requires assembly.

Young Jack is a noble gnome from gnomish militia. He is very lucky in combat and very skillful with his sword and shield.
Gradock also from gnomish militia and it is not easy to deceive him because of his great experience. Besides he is a skillful trapper.
Morris - gnome and miner. He could push enemies away and mine moonstones more easily, than other personages.

—description from the publisher
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Humor, Miniatures
mechanics: Action Points, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Rock-Paper-Scissors

name: Raid on Mt. Murhata
description:
Raid on Mt. Murhata is a card game in which you play mischievous monsters trying to appease the relentlessly demanding Geezer. Raid the villages, collect the goods, and make your tribute. If you make the best, you win. If not, who knows your final fate — but it won't be good!

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Exploration, Fighting, Horror, Negotiation, Party Game
mechanics: Area Movement, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Savage Fighters
description:
GAME SYSTEM



This entry is to allow for discussion/rating of the game system as a whole. It is not for a specific product or release. Versions will appear on the individual item pages.





This is a select your own adventure combat book game. Players each with their own book will battle against other players with a book of their own. At least two players with their own book is needed to play this game. However, you can play with as many players as you have character books.Players in turn order will select another player, both will select an action from the page in their book to go to that will effect the players at the table. Some pages are for attacking, dodging or blocking what the other player may be deciding, or charging up for a stronger action later. Each page you end on will have a new list of action to choice from. Last man standing wins.
mechanics: Player Elimination

name: Chaka!
description:
Chaka! is an interactive party game. The goal is easy: players try to get rid of their chips. But with every chip placed, a different ability is triggered. Abilities impair, confuse and fool the players while stacking: sometimes, you need to close your eyes, stack in slow motion or you aren't allowed to use your thumbs! Can you manage to master all of the hilarious effects?

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Take That

name: Gobblers Family Mix
description:
The Gobblers family has organized their traditional hide-and-seek party! The mums hide the teenagers, and the teenagers hide the babies! You will need to rely on memory and observation to help you find them in Gobblers Family Mix. Flip a card and be the first to deduce the missing Gobblers and to find it! Beware of the Great-Aunt and Great-Uncle who are the king and queen of troubles...

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Unspecified
publishers: Blue Orange (EU), Lelekan, Swan Panasia Co., Ltd.

name: Kingdom Death: Monster – White Speaker Sword Hunter
description: This is a set of three promo cards included with The White Speaker Sword Hunter, a miniature that is not part of the game. There is one Hunt Event with an associated Settlement Event and Gear card.
categories: Adventure, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Horror, Mature / Adult, Miniatures, Mythology
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Role Playing, Storytelling

name: Cinephile: Splat Pack
description: Splat Pack is a limited-edition expansion pack with 20 brand-new cards featuring a mix of classic and cult horror films from the ‘60s through today.
mechanics: Memory

name: Sell Outs: Traveling Salesman Edition
description:
Think you could sell candy that was flagged by the TSA? Some very hairy skates? A lightning rod that doubles as a lunchbox? Find out in this portable and creative pitching game that will have you and your friends in fits of laughter as you try to sell inventive solutions for ridiculous problems!

—description from the back of the box
categories: Card Game, Humor, Negotiation, Party Game
mechanics: Player Judge, Simultaneous Action Selection, Voting

name: A Song of Ice & Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game – Builder Crossbowmen
description:
The brotherhood of the Night’s Watch has pledged to keep Westeros safe from all the horrors that live north of The Wall. Forsaking any life they might’ve had before joining, they are entirely committed to their vows. Within their number are the Builders. They maintain the fortifications in and around The Wall, as well as all the arms and armor used by the Night’s Watch. Their forges create some of the best and hardiest gear, including the valuable crossbow. While there are the massive ballistae that act as siege weapons, as well as the Scorpions that are light enough to be taken to battle afield, they also create hand-held crossbows. They heavily train with them, becoming a fighting force of their own. Next month, Night’s Watch players will be able to add the Builder Crossbowmen to their forces. Let’s take a look at how they operate.
Being the ones that built the crossbows, the Builders are also experts in their use, having trained intensely with them. This results in the to-hit number for their crossbow attack being a 3+ and rolling seven dice when at full ranks, and even when one rank has been destroyed. The power in these “little instruments of death” is so great that they can attack at Long Range and apply Sundering. The crossbows aren’t the only armaments the Builders have. They also can go into battle wielding longswords. While they are competent in their use, the Builder Crossbowmen would still prefer to reach out and touch the enemy at range. And, if an enemy wants to do them engage via a charge, the unit’s Ready! Aim! Fire! order lets them get an extra attack in before the enemy closes in.
On the defensive side of things, the unit shows their weakness. With a Defense Save of 6+ and a Morale value of 7+, this is a unit that really does not want the enemy to attack them. Their moderate speed of 5 also means that they can’t outrun most enemy units wanting to chase them down. However, the Builder Crossbowmen would really hope that their last-ditch attack thins the enemy ranks as much as possible.
The Builder Crossbowmen are a perfect unit for Night’s Watch players who want to add some ranged attack damage to their force. They should be kept well away from the enemy, but within range of their trusty crossbows. Supported by units able to take a melee hit if necessary, they can do a lot to bring victory to the Black.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Novel-based, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling
publishers: CMON Global Limited, Dark Sword Miniatures, Inc., Edge Entertainment

name: Bedroom Battle: Naughty Winter Nights
description:
Bedroom Battle is a game for couples where you play against each other to win rewards in the form of sexy favors.

The concept is very simple. Each game round you use battle cards to compete for a reward card containing three different sexy challenges. The winner of the round then gets to select one of the sexy challenges for you both to act out. Once you have completed the challenge you move on to the next round and start playing for a new reward card. To make things interesting the rewards will become more and more naughty until the game ends with the final reward - which of course is the naughtiest of them all.

Naughty Winter Nights contains 21 Christmas-themed battle cards and 54 challenges that are either romantic or extra kinky.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Hand Management

name: Ezrok Wargame System: Ezrok the Fighter
description:
Ezrok the Fighter is a free print & play module set that uses the Ezrok Wargame System (EWS). The EWS framework is a minimalistic hex & counter wargame system designed for quick play. This set consists of five modules; each having its own map, counters and other materials. The modules in this set take place in the era where Ezrok is a mere soldier in the Army of the Protector. It is during this time that Ezrok establishes his reputation as a renowned warrior.

The modules include:


Elves of the Underworld
Terror of the Crag Gargoyles
Wrath of the Squid Demon
Strike of the Hill Giants
Rescue from the Mushroom Ogres


—description from the designer
mechanics: Hexagon Grid

name: Polemos: Ruse de Guerre
description:
A set of tabletop miniatures wargame rules covering the wars in the United States and Canada in the latter half of C18 and the early C19: the French & Indian Wars, the American Revolution/American War of Independence and the War of 1812.
Sharing some features with the other rules using the Polemos system, the rules aim to focus on the decisions made by army commanders whilst using quite simple processes to deal with the details of movement, combat and morale, hopefully producing plausible outcomes without the need to do slow or complicated calculations. The heart of the system is about bidding for and using Tempo Points: commanders must trade off speed of action against the ability to have greater control over all units.
The game includes a number of scenarios from the three covered conflicts to give players a good idea of how big the various armies are and how they are organized. It uses a variable scale, so smaller and bigger armies, battles and tables can all be accomodated.
categories: American Indian Wars, American Revolutionary War, Miniatures, Napoleonic, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Simulation, Turn Order: Auction

name: Hybrords
description:
Hybrords is a simple, card-based party-style game of portmanteau, in which players creatively combine words to create new words, called hybrords (hybrid words). Players then invent funny or clever definitions for their hybrord, and "sell" it to the judge as creatively as possible. The judge selects not only the round winner, but also the rules to be used for that round. Add to other players' hybrords/definitions, and potentially earn assists!

The fun even continues after the game is over, since players will be using these hybrords in conversation for the rest of the night, and even beyond! With an official Hybrords dictionary, fans can even share their creativity with the rest of the Hybrords community!

With so much riding on players' own creativity, it's the game that's only as fun as you are! But with all of the laughs to be had, there really are no losers in Hybrords!

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Humor, Party Game, Word Game
mechanics: Player Judge, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Revenants
description:
It's the mid 1980ies and a mutated rabies virus wiped out almost every single life on earth. Those, who have been infected with the Zion virus transformed into soulless, bloodthirsty creatures hunting for every living.

Revenants is a tabletop RPG in an post-apocalyptic 80ies scenario with a completely randomized playing field, randomized encounters and randomized loot to grant maximum playing variety over uncountable gaming sessions.
The players slip into the role of those ones, who are resistant against the virus and therefore being able to scavenge contaminated areas for valuable resources and items to support other survivor guilds.

Revenants comes with over 150 desk tiles, with different landscapes like forests, fields, meadows, urban areas, many different buildings, scenes and places - each individually designed, over 60 figurines of Revenant-creatures and eerie mutations, over 300 item cards bearing melee- and ranged weapons, armor, traps, survival-, medical- and household items and many more to make each experience completely unique.

Up to 5 players can choose out of several characters, each one with uniquely abilities and skill trees and keep, train, level up and equip them with everything, they find on their expeditions. As the survivors improve with every game, so do their encounters. Less loot and harder enemies make 'Revenants' a constant challenge for everyone. Whether open range or close combat house-to-house melee fighting: Team play and tactics is important to survive the horde.
categories: Adventure, Civil War, Exploration, Fighting, Horror, Miniatures, Wargame, Zombies
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Line of Sight, Map Addition, Multiple Maps, Open Drafting, Ratio / Combat Results Table, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Square Grid, Team-Based Game, Tile Placement, Turn Order: Claim Action, Variable Player Powers

name: Money On FIRE
description:
People today spend much of their time on their undervalued, uninteresting daily work. Whether it is to achieve a better standard of living, improving their homes, their health, or supporting their children’s career, for many this might mean delaying the full enjoyment of their own life and long-held dreams. Financial independence is more important than ever. Proper, well-made investments can increase the value of your assets and earn you profit. Smart investment of that profit can eventually help you achieve financial independence.

In Money On FIRE, the goal is financial independence. Each player has three targets represented by three cards. Once any player fulfills all three targets set out in their cards, and so becomes financially independent, they win the game. Two to four players can choose different ways to invest, such as the property investment, building up their own business to win the best possible contracts, investing time to level up their professional knowledge in a tech tree, making investments in bonds and so on, all to build the most efficient investment portfolio.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action Points, Income, Investment, Market

name: Secret Cthulhu
description:
The year is unknown. The place is somewhere on Earth. In Secret Cthulhu players are attempting to stop Cthulhu devouring the planet by enacting enough Rites of Salvation to protect the planet and all that currently live on it. Watch out though, there are secret Cultists among you, and one player is possessed by Cthulhu himself. These Cultists will be doing everything in their power to pave the way for Cthulhu, and the destruction and chaos he brings with him.

At the beginning of the game each player is assigned one of three roles: Cultist, Investigator, or Cthulhu. The Investigators have a majority, but they don’t know for sure who anyone is; Cultists must resort to what they know best to accomplish their goals: secrecy and sabotage. Cthulhu plays for the Cultists, and the Cultists know Cthulhu’s identity, but Cthulhu isn’t always aware of who his fellow Cultists are and must work to figure them out.

If that's not enough, you need to be ready for whatever the Chaos Deck throws your way.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Deduction, Team-Based Game, Traitor Game, Variable Player Powers, Voting

name: ArcWorlde: Troubles in the North
description:
ArcWorlde is freezing in a sorcerous winter. Warbands, monsters and heroes clash in ArcWorlde: Troubles in the North - the first expansion of the 32mm tabletop fantasy skirmish wargame from Warploque Miniatures.

Introducing three new Factions, new models to add to your existing ArcWorlde warbands, fearsome monsters from the frozen North and new characters and heroes to join your forces, ArcWorlde: Troubles in the North has something for both existing players, and those new to the game.

With almost 150 pages of art and lore to immerse yourself in, as well as characterful hand-sculpted miniatures to awaken your imagination, bring the frozen lands of Njorsvald to life on your table top.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Puzzell
description:
The 9th core game for the ELL game system.

Make small fragments of the alphabet on one of 4 rows.

Each turn, draw a card, pick up a card from the end of a row, then place 2 cards. Placed cards and the card before them must form a 3-letter 'fragment' (3 consecutive letters, in order).

As each card can be used for 2 different letters, there is a skill in deciding what fragments to build.

At the end, you will have hopefully managed your cards so as to have some 'runs' of letters that you can place down to win the game!

—description from the publisher
categories: Abstract Strategy, Card Game, Print & Play
mechanics: Hand Management, Set Collection, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Set-up

name: Shifting Realms: Darkness Revealed
description:
Shifting Realms: Darkness Revealed is an expansion to Shifting Realms. A copy of Shifting Realms is necessary to play Darkness Revealed. The base game includes 5 realms which are played 3 at a time offering 10 realm combinations and 60 unique board layouts. Shifting Realms:Darkness Revealed comes with 2 additional realms bringing the number of realm combinations to 35 with 210 board layouts.

The two new realms in Darkness Revealed are Knossos and Gehenna. Each realm comes with a board, structures, story cards, and task cards. The new realms introduce new synergies, mechanisms, and components to the base game.

Knossos, the undiscovered land of the minotaurs, introduces Search tiles and Labyrinth walls. Players need to search areas of the board to recover treasure before structures can be built in the realm. Players can place Labyrinth walls to block movement and building adjacency. Players also start the game drafting story cards which ramps up the first few turns of the game.

Gehenna, the dark land of the demons, offers players ways to directly interfere with the other players. Building Demon Towers enables players to capture opposing players units for victory points. Many of the story cards in this realm enable players to move opponents’ units within the realms.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Variable Set-up, Worker Placement

name: Wander: The Cult of Barnacle Bay – Mary Fixit, Rayna, and Thalia Hero Pack
description:
Rayna, Mary Fixit, and Thalia represent some of the top talent the Wanderer's Guild has to offer!

Rayna, the most physical of the three, is a dragoon extraordinaire, who gracefully leaps through the air and wields her spear like the masters of old.

Mary Fixit is a talented Golemancer who's intelligence and ingenuity are unparalleled within the Guild.

Thalia comes from a long line of toxiphiles who specialize is potions and brews as well as how to deliver them with a bow.

Add these three heroes to your adventures in Barnacle Bay to change the tide and defeat Elder Bane and his Cult of the Deep!

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Modular Board

name: Demon Worker: Imp Promo Cards
description:
Imp is a two cards set of a new demon worker that was originally released as a in vol. 3 of the quarterly released Japanese analog games magazine "Game Mastery (GM) Magazine" in March 2018.

Japanime Games gave out the English version of the cards at Gen Con 2019.
mechanics: Worker Placement

name: Eagles Over Britain: Battle of Britain, 1940
description: A wargame with a background of the Battle of Britain (1940), which can be played by 1-2 players.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Simulation, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Dark Hunting: Caccia Notturna
description:
In Dark Hunting the players are hunters / researchers.
Their goal is to capture alive some creatures of the night (a Vampire, a Werewolf and a Demon), so the game begins as a collaborative.
However, during the game some (or all) players could lose their mind, turning into a possessed bloodthirsty adepts of the lords of darkness (also seeing changed their goal for the final victory). Will you be able to stay sane until the end of the game?
At the beginning of the round, the player who has the "group leader" role in that moment carries out an "Hunting" action against one of the three monsters. Each player plays a face down card. The "group leader" mixes and turns them to reveal the intensions of the other players. "Weapon" cards wound the monster, "help" cards help the monster instead. After each "hunt" every player draws a hidden "role" card that could change his role. At the end of the round each player takes points depending on their role. At the end of the third round, the player with the most points wins the game.
Specifically:

Researcher role: 2 points for each captured monster
Inquisitor role: 2 points for each monster killed
