Followe role: 3 points if your Lord is alive, 1 point for another dead Lord, 1 point for another captured Lord


—description from the designer

In Caccia Notturna i giocatori interpretano il ruolo di cacciatori/ricercatori. Il loro obiettivo è quello di catturare vive alcune creature della notte (un Vampiro, un Lupo mannaro e un Demone). Il gioco inizia come un collaborativo. Tuttavia, nel corso della partita alcuni (o tutti i) giocatori potrebbero perdere la testa ed impazzire del tutto, diventando degli invasati assetati di sangue oppure degli adepti dei Signori delle tenebre (vedendo così cambiato in corsa il loro obiettivo per la vittoria finale). Riuscirete a rimanere sani di mente fino alla fine della partita?
All'inizio del round, il giocatore che ha il ruolo di "capogruppo" in quel momento compie un'azione di "caccia" contro uno dei tre mostri. Ogni giocatore gioca una carta coperta. Il "capogruppo" le mescola e le gira. Le carte "Arma" feriscono il mostro, le carte "aiuto" aiutano invece il mostro. Dopo ogni "caccia" ogni giocatore pesca una carta "ruolo" nascosta che potrebbe cambiare il suo ruolo. Alla fine del round ogni giocatore prende punti a seconda del proprio ruolo. Alla fine del terzo round, il giocatore con più punti vince la partita.
Nello specifico:

ruolo di ricercatore: 2 punti per ogni mostro catturato
ruolo di inquisitore: 2 punti per ogni mostro morto
ruolo si adepto: 3 punti se il proprio Signore è vivo, 1 punto per un altro Signore morto, 1 punto per un altro Signore catturato


—description from the designer
mechanics: Alliances, Hidden Roles, Semi-Cooperative Game

name: Robot Fight Club
description:
When a group of curious kids snuck into the abandoned Lyeville Cybernautics Academy, they never imagined they'd find so much of the old machinery still in place. Sifting through the detritus, they fixed up the old Robot Club labs where their parents used to spend hours tinkering after school, and founded something new: Robot Fight Club!

This is a two-player game of fast-paced robot combat. Each game starts with a Scrap Sale, where the players purchase a pair of robots and a selection of upgrades, then a series of Bouts in which they'll duke it out in the hopes of being crowned champion.

Each of your two robots has its own unique set of Control Cards, and they're shuffled together to create your deck for the game. Each card lets one of your robots do some combination of moving around the arena and attacking the enemy robots. The first player to win two Bouts is declared the champion!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Command Cards, Grid Movement, Market, Modular Board, Movement Points, Simultaneous Action Selection, Square Grid

name: Banner of the Maid: Italian Campaign
description:
Banner of the Maid is a turn-based strategy game based on the same-titled video game. Embarking on the fictional, altered history of the French Revolution, you will take on the roles of the general of extraordinary female officers, fight brilliantly in the battlefield and unfold your own epic story.
2 factions -the newborn Republic of France and The Coalition- competing in the battlefield in Italy
3 military units -Infantry, Cavalry and Artillery- bracing for the great battles in the French Revolution
6 scenarios -unfolding the whole story- of which every victory paves the way to the following battles
12 commanders -with a variety of abilities and strategies- from which you will have to choose wisely to ensure your victory

Set up the game according to the scenario you choose to play.
Start player chooses one character to move and attack, then turn order passes to the next player. During your turn, you may play a tactics card to utilize characters' various talents and abilities to take one step ahead of your opponent in the battlefield.
Winning conditions differ for each game based on the scenario you choose to play. Gain rewards according to the scenario and be prepared for the next battle!

—description from the designer
categories: Fantasy, Napoleonic, Video Game Theme, Wargame
mechanics: Command Cards, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Square Grid

name: Filthy Kings
description:
Filthy Kings is a strategic bluff game, where you must ensure that all annoying inhabitants in your Kingdom are sent to another Kingdom. This is not without a struggle because you must have a good poker face!

Players take turns playing cards clockwise. Annoying inhabitants are always laid facing down on the table. The other players do not know what is being put on the table. The player who starts putting cards on the table may decide what kind of annoying inhabitant he puts on the table. You can lie about which annoying inhabitant you put down. But be careful! Other players can accuse you of lying and of course you don't want that! The first Kingdom without annoying inhabitants wins the game!

There are two types of Stand-alone versions that can be played separately but can also be combined with each other, allowing you to play up to 10 people!

The two Stand-alone versions are:
Filthy Kings Day Time
Filthy Kings Night Time

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Traitor Game

name: Ravage: Swamps of Delgor
description:
Ravage - Swamps of Delgor is a 1-5 player dungeon crawl. You don’t play the heroes in this game you play Orcs, Goblins, Gnolls, And Kobolds of the Blackroot clan. Your chieftain has your orders you will seek glory and smash the faces of your enemies for teef.

Explore the treacherous swamp and the ancient temple with your friends by drawing map cards, level up skills and buy goods with teef. Watch out for elites and heroes that wander the land as well as completing your objective.

Featuring:
Co-op
Play with up to 4 friends with an automated overlord.
Solo play
Play as 2 characters through quests.
One vs many
Play with up to 5 friends 1 taking on the role of the overlord. This can be a much more grilling experience depending on your Overlord.

Ravage - Swamps of Delgor is the sequel to Ravage - Dungeons of Plunder, it is a stand alone game and does not require the original, however they are completely compatible and can be combined to give you more items, monsters and characters.

—description from the designer
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures
mechanics: Action Points, Area Movement, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Tile Placement

name: Flap Flap Duck
description:
Flap Flap Duck is a 2-5 players co-op games, where all players has only one objective which is to bring Ducky home, however the route home is not a simple path as there are many obstacle along the way. This is where you and your team will have to work together to maneuver the obstacle to prevent Ducky from hitting it. Using only clues that you have given and the limited actions in your hand, do you have what it takes to bring Ducky home?

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Acting, Action Queue, Cooperative Game, Grid Movement, Multiple Maps, Team-Based Game

name: Ring Collector
description:
The game is a two player abstract and strategy game. the goal is to collect the most ring points by games end. Players use their 5 ring-collecting agent pieces to obtain the precious rings from the board. Each ring has it's own value and corresponding score, silver is one point, gold is three points and luxury gold is five points. Players must collect more total ring points than their opponent to be the winner at the game's end.

Board: 5x5 or 5x7 grid board.
Pieces: Each player has own color 5 ring collecting agent pieces.
Rings: 1 luxury gold, 4 gold and 10 silver rings(5x5 grid board) or 20 silver rings(5x7 grid board)
Player: 2
Playing time: 10 to 20 minutes

- Playing
Decide the first player and take turns alternately. Players must move any one of their own pieces on the board or replace one of their re-use pieces previously captured by their opponent. Re-placing piece must be placed on the space where a ring exists and becomes a ring holder agent as described below. Players can't pass their turns when they have a legal move.

- Basic moves
Any agent pieces can move one space to any eight directions, vertically horizontally and diagonally like chess king except for a space where own piece exists.

- Game end
There are two game ending conditions. The first is after all rings on the board are picked up, both players get one last turn. The second is when both players pass consecutively.

- Winner
The player who obtains more ring points at the end of game, wins the game.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Tile Placement

name: Trash Lords: Gutter Scum
description:
The brand-new expansion, Gutter Scum

6 new Crusties
2 new Venues
A whole lot of "A.I." enemies to take-down
A completely new gameplay experience that gives you the option to turn TRASH LORDS into a cooperative game in which players fight side-by-side to stop the evil Scum from taking over their town.


—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Humor, Mature / Adult, Political
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Push Your Luck, Take That

name: Heckadeck
description:
A hand-illustrated deck of 160 playing cards by Travis Nichols. The Heckadeck is like the ultimate deck of cards for remixing classic games or inventing your own.

Each suit includes zeroes, elevens, and Beasts. And there are four more suits: knives, acorns, clouds, and planets. AND there are two-suited Hunters and Travelers, non-suited arrows and talismans, a Crone, an Omnihedron, Darkness, and the all-suited Watcher.

Perfect for family game night or your super-serious game design club.
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Open Drafting

name: Vs. System 2PCG: Power & Reality
description:
Kicking off an all-new, MCU-based story arc called Assemble, this 1st issue, expands on the movie content for Vs. System 2PCG (See MCU Battles, Heroes, Villains). In this exciting expansion, Earth hangs in the balance, as the peacekeeping program-turned-technological terror known as Ultron, squares off with an assembled collection of fan-favorite heroes like the unparalleled marksman—Hawkeye and the physically enhanced assassin —Winter Soldier; all brought together to serve your deck by the irrepressible Power and Reality Infinity Stones.

Game Unit:

55 Playable Cards
1 Rulesheet


—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: Dragon Arcade
description:
Dragon Arcade is a casual 2 player head-2-head card game with variable setup.

As a floor manager in Dragon Arcade your job is to hype the crowd and generate high scores. Play cards as gamers or use their abilities to direct the energy of the crowd.

Win by collecting tokens and retiring high score machines to please the boss!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Closed Drafting, Hand Management, Set Collection, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up

name: Felicior Augusto, Melior Traiano ! II
description:
Felicior Augusto, Melior Traiano ! II is an extension for the skimish rules Felicior Augusto, Melior Traiano ! adding the Huns and the Goths to the Vth century party.

for 25/30mm miniatures.

Sequence of play:

Initiative
Actions (movement, corps-a-corps, throw)
End of turn

Scale:
1 mini = 1 man
1 cm = 1 m

—user summary
categories: Ancient, Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Simulation

name: The Walking Dead: All Out War – Negan
description:
Web-exclusive alternate miniature

Negan is a savage man who adores mayhem, violence, and profane language and has a knack for manipulating others. He uses this to rule over his people, ‘The Saviors’ with an iron fist, and becomes Rick’s most terrifying enemy to date.

—description from the publisher
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Zombies
mechanics: Dice Rolling

name: Black Seas: Smugglers Run
description:
Smuggler’s Run puts two players at the heart of this black market, running contraband in and out of the British Isles. Create your own smuggling company and outwit the authorities in the name of trade and profit!

Smuggler’s Run is a two-player campaign where two rival smuggling companies compete to ferry the most contraband into the United Kingdom. Both players should have already created a smuggling company. On the (miniature) high seas, players will alternate commanding their villainous flotilla and the various customs boats patrolling the coastline.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Napoleonic, Nautical
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Simulation

name: Missile Threat: Solo Rules & Mercenary Air Campaign
description:
Missile Threat Solo Rules & Mercenary Air Campaign: this book gives you everything you need to play Missile Threat solo and to play the Mercenary Air Campaign.

The Solo Rules:

These include all the rules needed for solo games, as well as random aircraft tables for every conflict and faction covered in Missile Threat. Random Ground Asset and Naval Vessel tables are also included. The solo game relies on regular playing cards to generate unknown hostile aircraft and ground assets, so prepare to be surprised!

The Mercenary Air Campaign:

Manage a group of fictitious Mercenaries as you purchase aircraft and ordnance, select missions, get paid and attempt to survive! This campaign runs on the basic Missile Threat rules, and is aimed at solo play but can easily be a co-operative game. Players start with a selection of pilots and a pool of funds and must purchase aircraft and ordnance from a weapons market. They then use what they have to fly available missions and if they succeed: get paid.

The Mercenary air campaign is all about the "rule of cool" - you won't be limited to light attack aircraft, but rather any aircraft around in your chosen theater, period and faction. The campaign uses the Complete Aircraft & Ordnance List provided with the Missile Threat rules, and allows you to buy and fly many of the more unusual or lesser used aircraft from the last 60 years, as well as the regulars.

The Mercenary air campaign has 3 difficulty options, ranging from easy mode with 4 pilots and a sh*tload of cash, to the hard mode of a lone wolf pilot with the last of his savings.

There are 5 different periods to choose from: 1960s, 1970s, 1980s, 1990s and 2000s+

Each period has 5 different theaters to play in: Balkans/Eastern Europe, Central/South Africa, Middle East, South America, and South-East Asia

Each theater has 2 factions you can work for: Either the government or the rebels.

In this way there are 50 different options for playing the campaign. You could be working for the rebels in South America in the 1990s, or working for the government in the Middle East in the 1960s. Each option has a customized random aircraft and ordnance table to reflect the period, theater and alignment. That's 100 D66 tables!

—description from the publisher
categories: Aviation / Flight, Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Modern Warfare, Nautical, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Secret Unit Deployment, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Parabola: Wish You Were Here Part III
description:
Another envelope arrives at your doorstep to throw your life into chaos, only this time it isn't your friend on the other end. Instead, a new adversary has challenged you with a host of new tricks up their sleeves. Are you up to the challenge in this thrilling conclusion to the Wish You Were Here trilogy? Grab something to write with, something to research with, and find out!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Dahlgren and Columbiad
description:
Dahlgren and Columbiad - Fast play rules for ironclad warfare

A set of fast play rules for small ship actions set in the American Civil War and the “ironclad wars” of South America from the 1860s to 1880s. Included with the rule are ship statistics for the Union and Confederate fleets.

—description from the publisher
categories: American Civil War, Book, Miniatures, Nautical, Post-Napoleonic, Wargame
mechanics: Simulation

name: All Things Zombie: Evolution
description:
Evolve or Die!

All Things Zombie won the Origins Award for Best Miniatures Game in 2005. From then until now, gamers have changed and All Things Zombie has changed with them.
















Want a game where all you do is run around the table and kill Zombies? If you do, then All Things Zombie – Evolution is not for you.

Think of all the great and not so great Zombie movies and television series. Remember how many Zombies the heroes killed? I’m betting you don’t, but I bet you remember how they interacted with other survivors and how they finally overcame the obstacles in their way. In short, you remember the Story.

And that’s what All Things Zombie – Evolution is all about, the Story; your Story.

All Things Zombie - Evolution sweeps you up and sticks you right in the middle of a catastrophic zombie outbreak. Who you are when the outbreak occurs is just as important as where you are. Because unlike other zombie games, where the zombies have been around for a while, you won’t be able to tell the humans from the zombies until maybe it’s too late. Because it’s all happening to you just like it would on Day One.

Confusion, chaos, and lack of information are just some of the challenges you’ll face when the world starts to crumble. Will you have what it takes to survive the first 30 days?

THEN WHAT?

All Things Zombie - Evolution starts on the first day of the Outbreak, but then let’s you continue your life, building your very own future. It’s a game where every detail has been covered, as you first escape the soulless creatures that threaten you, then hunt them down and take back what’s yours. On the way you’ll find that your most dangerous enemies aren’t the zombies, but are your neighbors and sometimes your old friends.

Play All Things Zombie - Evolution solo, cooperatively against the game, or head to head against one another.

Play it as a one off game or part of an ongoing campaign.

Play it on the Tabletop or on the Battle Boards we've included.

It doesn’t matter which way you play it, as the goal of All Things Zombie - Evolution is to rebuild the world, as you knew it; except maybe this time with you in charge.

Inside you’ll find:

Color card stock counters and two full color 8” x 10” Battle Boards.

Three classes – Survivor, Ganger, or Militia, each with different goals and opportunities.

Attributes, Skills, and more, that are used to define your Characters and make them unique.

A light-book keeping Campaign System to reward you when you do well and punish you when you don’t.

A variety of Zombies, from the old school Shamblers to Smarties and Ragers.

Pre- generated scenarios that can be played alone or played together to build your Story.

A fully populated Post-Apocalyptic town for you to adventure in.

All this and much more.

And we didn’t even mention the Werewolves, Aliens or Vampires.

All Things Zombie… Still THE Zombie game.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Line of Sight, Measurement Movement, Storytelling

name: Beatles Diplomacy: Strategic Analysis & Simulation of a Pop Group's Rise to the Top
description: Originally published in 1976 as Yellow Submarine (Commonwealth Games), Beatles Diplomacy is a revised 2nd ed. multi-player game, which now includes solitaire rules. Volume 5 of the Battlegame series, this 52-page book simulates the career of the Beatles in the 1960s, using a Diplomacy-style game system. "This is truly a unique game, both in subject and system, with fascinating cross purposes among players... pulling in separate directions while "Brian" works for the common good.... And yet they must all work together. I heartily recommend it to devotees of Diplomacy, Kingmaker, and, of course, to Beatle-maniacs."
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Roll / Spin and Move, Simulation, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Battle of Legends: Print & Play Edition
description:
A board game of ancient-medieval battles between two armies consisting of famous historical units such as: Roman legionary, English longbowman, European knight, etc., each having different moving, attacking, defending abilities and special skills.

You must position them strategically across the battlefield to best coordinate your attacks and to apply some combat tactics such as oblique formation, outflanking, hit & run, shield wall, etc...

—description from the designer
categories: Abstract Strategy, Ancient, Medieval, Print & Play, Wargame
mechanics: Command Cards, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Rally Point Volume 17: Special Study II of the Korean War
description: Contains ten ASL scenarios and a Communist People’s Volunteer Army (CPVA) player aid card. The scenarios are all for use with the ASL module 15: Forgotten War: Korea 1950-53
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Korean War, Wargame
mechanics: Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation

name: Medieval Mayhem: The Card Game
description:
Welcome to the days of old, when knights were bold!

Medieval Mayhem is a family-friendly and simple but addictive card game – a crazy mash of humor, kings, strategy, caricatures, wizards, bluffing, puns, randomness and other nonsense...

Split your hand of ten debatably brave characters into five powerful armies and let them loose on your friends!! Before the battle starts, you will also have a betting round: the perfect opportunity to bluff and deceive the other players.

Here is the recipe for creating Medieval Mayhem: mix Exploding Kittens and Poker, add Hugo's crazy cartoons and Andreea's charming watercolors, sprinkle a Medieval theme (and puns!) onto it, balance the flavors so that it can be enjoyed by kids and grown-ups and by casual and serious players alike, et voila - you now have Medieval Mayhem!!

— description from the publisher
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Deduction, Humor, Medieval, Party Game
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Hand Management, Hidden Movement, Open Drafting

name: Star Wars: Imperial Assault – Nelvaanian War Zone Skirmish Map
description:
Your skirmishes may take you into the snowy wastes of the Nelvaanian War Zone Skirmish Map. Here, much of the battlefield is covered in snow and trenches, and you’ll need to fight hard if you’re going to recover broken Droids or stay near a constantly moving string of patrol Droids. As you venture into the cold, you can draw inspiration from the iconic artwork that borders this Skirmish Map, featuring Darth Vader and Diala Passil.

The playmat comes with scenario cards which can be played on the mat
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Godtear: Lorsann, The Autumnal Wind & Mistwood Rangers
description:
"Once guardian of the Eternal Glade, the Autumnal Wind has led her Mistwood Rangers from that hallowed place in pursuit of the destiny which now calls to her. Few have ever seen Lorsann’s face, for death usually comes long before such an event—or, for those fortunate few, quickly thereafter."

This set includes Lorsann, 3 Mistwood Rangers, Lorsann's banner and profile cards.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Grid Movement, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Variable Player Powers

name: Godtear: Halftusk, Warden of the Stonekin Isle & Froglodytes
description:
"The last of his people to avoid enslavement, the mantle of Warden of the Stonekin Isle has long sat upon Halftusk’s broad shoulders. No simple brute but an anguished soul, his demeanour is kindly towards the strange and primordial Froglodyte that are his burden, and terrible to invaders that seek them harm."

This set includes Halftusk, 3 Froglodytes, Halftusk's banner and profile cards.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Grid Movement, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Variable Player Powers

name: Forgotten World Rulebook
description:
Forgotten World is the new fantasy game from Fireforge Games. With this rulebook you will be able to create your own army to launch you into the conquest of a new and exciting world.

The book contains all the rules to play in two different ways: Adventurers, to assemble and fight with your small skirmishing forces and Conquerors to create big battles with your regimented armies.

Several battle scenarios are included allowing you to face a new challenge every time you play.

In this book you will also find army lists that allow you to quickly and easily assemble a force for battle.

—description from the publisher
categories: Dice, Fantasy, Fighting, Medieval, Miniatures, Mythology, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Line of Sight, Simulation

name: Eternal City's End: The Battle for Rome, September 1943
description: "Eternal City's End: The Battle for Rome, September 1943" is a solitaire or two player World War II wargame, designed by Roberto Chiavini, that portrays a series of “what ifs” based upon the historical situation following the Italian Armistice that was signed September 8th, 1943. Starting from the historical positions of the Italian and German formations, one player, as the Italian, must try to save Rome from falling into German hands before the arrival of American paratrooper reinforcements to support them in rescuing the Eternal City from Nazi occupation. This wargame can also be played with a German opponent, or from the German perspective as an alternative solitaire play wargame trying to secure the Eternal City before the arrival of the American paratroopers. Historically, the Germans declared Rome to be an “open city” after the surrender of their former Italian ally.
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Simulation, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Mackinac Island Treasure Hunt: Card and Board Games
description:
Explore the second U.S. National Park and Michigan's first State Park in search of historical and natural treasures with this set of 5 games.

Match Me if You Can is an Author's Cards-style card game. Choose natural treasures, historical treasures and/or locations around the Island, then collect the most cards in similar groups by asking for cards from other players or by picking up discarded cards.

The Nature Hike has you searching for the route that will allow you to spot the most natural treasures each turn. Pick a card, roll the die to determine how many habitats you can visit, or if you have encountered an obstacle and must discard cards. A variation adds more player interaction by inviting you to collect observations from other players.

The Scavenger Hunt is a cooperative game where players work together to find a pre-determined set of treasures before Winter arrives. Each turn, roll the die to move toward a revealed Scavenger Hunt destination while observing natural treasures along the way. When you get to the destination, if you can match the hiding place card of the historical treasure there, you collect the treasure. If you can't match it, another player can pick up the treasure later, or give you the card you need to collect it. You exchange natural treasure observations for more hiding place cards. You may also encounter events along the way, either obstacles, opportunities, or a change of season.

The Hide and Seek game tests your memory as each turn reveals the hiding place of historical treasures on the Island that you can collect...if you remember where they are. Each turn, you can add a card to your hand, play a new movement option (that lets you move around the Island faster or slower, depending on the season), play event cards on other players (to slow them down), move to new locations while observing natural treasures (which add points to your score), and hunt for historical treasures (by flipping over a hidden location card around the board - if you are at the location on the card, you keep the treasure and score). Whoever finds the most treasures usually wins.

The Treasure Hunt has you playing the sleuth, asking questions of the other players in order to discover the treasures they have hidden around the Island. Using the same movement and event rules as The Hide and Seek game, this game gives players many opportunities to score points: Visit locations on cards in your hand to score and gain special abilities useful in the hunt. Play historical treasures from your hand to score and help everyone know which treasures are not hidden. Ask yes or no questions of the other players to determine the location and the treasure they have hidden on the Island. Guess the treasure and location correctly to score big, or lose a little if you're wrong.

Choose the experience you want based on the available players (2 to 8 people can play), the amount of time you have, or how much you want to think. While some of the games share common rules and themes (for example, each game features some sort of nature observation), each is a separate game. Cards have information about the Island you can read as you play, though knowledge about the Island is not required to play.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Hand Management, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Take That

name: Monopoly: Limerick Edition
description:
Celebrate Ireland's inaugural National City of Culture with this special edition of the MONOPOLY game! From architectural awards to cosmopolitan cafe culture, this beautiful city inspires so much more than its eponymous poetry! Start your tour of Limerick with a trip to The Hunt Museum, which boasts a fascinating collection of over 2,000 artefacts, before allowing the delicious smells drifting from the Milk Market to draw you in. After perusing the aisles for artisan delights, head over to the quayside; the waterfront is alive with stylish pubs and cosy restaurants overlooking the River Shannon. All this sightseeing wearing you out? Pop into O'Mahony's Booksellers to pick up a paperback, before resting your legs at The Stormy Teacup for some tea and cake, or pay a visit to The Buttery if it's wine and tapas you're after. In pride of place stands King John's Castle, the historic core of the city and one of the best-preserved Norman castles in Europe, home to a wealth of interactive exhibitions or simply a location from which to take in a fantastic view of the city below. All your favourite locations and more have made it onto the game board, so get ready to roll the dice and let the craic flow as you play MONOPOLY: The Limerick Edition. Order your limited edition copy of the World's best board game today!

Key Features

The world's best family board game brings you another exciting edition of MONOPOLY - Limerick
Choose your favourite token, tour your favourite sites and accumulate fortunes, but watch out for taxes, jail and bankruptcy
Advance to Limerick Writer's Centre, St Mary's Cathedral or King John's Castle - will you owe rent or reap the rewards?
Invest in houses and hotels and trade your way to success
The Fast-Dealing Property Trading Game is fun for the whole family


—description from the publisher
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Monopoly: La France Viticole
description:
Take risks, invest, develop your inheritance, and become the most entrepreneurial winegrower!
Burgundy, Beaujolais, Bordeaux, Languedoc, the Loire Valley, the Rhône, Provence… choose either the most prestigious vineyards, or simply those that are dear to you.
Then, invest in wine warehouses and cellars to transform your grapes, glean the most perfect aromas from them, produce and sell the most amazing wines.
You’ll need quick reflexes and be ready to take risks to become the winning winemaker!

Properties are:

Brown:

Côtes de Gascogne
Muscadet


Light Blue:

Cahors
Beaujolais
Anjou


Purple:

Minervois
Muscat de Rivesaltes
Corse


Orange:

Côtes du Rhône
Bordeaux
Jura


Red:

Savoie
Côtes de Provence
Cognac Grande Champagne


Yellow:

Jurançon
Alsace
Sancerre


Green:

Chablis
Châteauneuf du Pape
Margaux


Dark Blue:

Champagne
Corton Charlemagne


Train stations:

Salon des vins de Paris
Salon des vins de Londres
Salon des vins de New York
Salon des vins de Hong Kong


Utilities:

Compagnie des appellations et vins classés
Compagnie des courtiers et jurys dégustateurs de vins


Taxes:

Impôts sur la Fortune
Impôt sur le revenu


—description from the publisher
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Trading

name: Pitchstorm: Animation
description: A timeless expansion for Pitchstorm. From classic fairytales to Saturday morning cartoons, the Animation Expansion for Pitchstorm adds 100 cards inspired by the best and weirdest animation we’ve seen. Whether you’re a kid at heart or you hate children, this deck will add animated flair to all of your terrible movie pitches.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Party Game
mechanics: Storytelling, Team-Based Game

name: The Red Dragon Inn: 2020 SlugCrew Minor Reward
description:
We have three new promo cards again this year; two drinks with a follow-up effect (Collegium All-Nighter, Howl at the Moon) and one Prize card (Holy Council's Minutes) that’s stuffed with potential. Hopefully the Holy Council won’t need their notes anytime soon!

You can earn these drinks by getting 30 SlugCrew points (or about 6 hours worth of demoing). SlugCrew who earn 150 points or more will get our Major Reward, a brand new pre-release character deck: Melvyn, the Collegium Archivist!

- Description by the publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Humor
mechanics: Hand Management

name: Paupers' Ladder: The Moonlighters
description:
The Moonlighters is a print-and-play expansion for Paupers’ Ladder. It adds the following elements to the game, any or all of which can be used.

36 Talent cards:
Talent cards give your Pauper and/or Bird special skills, bonuses and tasks. Each player chooses 1 Talent at the start of the game, and gains another each time they learn a Virtue.

10 Special Quest cards:
Special Quests are Quests that can only be completed by the player they belong to. They involve your Pauper carrying out a series of tasks, and are placed in your Journal once they are completed. They count towards learning the Virtue of fellowship as normal.

3 Game Variant cards: Any or all of these can be added to make small variations to the game.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Print & Play
mechanics: Area Movement, Events, Pick-up and Deliver

name: Ram Knuckle
description:
You are the manager of a futuristic vehicle racing team and must win the hearts of the public assisted by your mechanic robots and your pilot. It is a workers placement with race management and vehicle improvement while managing the chaos of combat between players.

In a turn, you have 2 actions. You must move your vehicle and your second action may be to place a worker, make another movement or use your weapon.

The workers have various possibilities like going to get parts to improve your vehicle, entertaining the crowd to increase your glory, repairing your vehicle, stealing parts from other players and many others.

There is a system for hitting between vehicles and hitting robotic workers on the track.

The game ends when the first player finishes his third turn on the track. After, each player plays his last round.

The final scoring is done by counting the points of glory accumulated in each round, end of game objectives, each point not accumulated counts for half and finally, each 2 pieces count for 1 point.

There are several mechanics in this game. There is a part making charter. Glory points are accumulated by interacting with other players and you must also manage the race and the workers placement.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Grid Movement, Race, Take That, Worker Placement with Dice Workers

name: A Todo Vapor!
description:
A Todo Vapor! (Full Steam!) is a party game which is played while engaging in other activities. Each player draws a character card that is either a suspect or an investigator. The suspects have a list of activities that they have to fulfill, while each investigator has two special abilities that they can each use once during the game.

Whenever an investigator believes that a suspect is doing an activity from their list, they can call out the suspect. If correct, the suspect may no longer use that activity to score. If wrong, the investigator loses one of their special abilities.

The suspects win if any of them manages to execute three of their activities. The investigators win if none of the suspects has enough undetected activities left.
mechanics: Acting, Betting and Bluffing

name: Red White & Blue Racin': Stock Car Racing Pioneers Card Set
description: Adds 55 drivers represented in full-color standard and TV cards, depicting vintage vehicles, based on the early days of stock car racing. Also includes set of 32 black-and-white Track Cards based on actual 1950s racing venues and revised era-specific Race Week TV and interview charts.
mechanics: Dice Rolling

name: Command Decision: Test of Battle – Road to Tokyo: October 1942 - July 1945
description:
Road to Tokyo October 1942-July 1945 covers the war in the Pacific Theatre of Operations (PTO) from October 1942 to July 1945; the period when the Allies took the strategic initiative away from the Japanese.

Thirteen scenarios are included from the turn of the tide at Guadalcanal through to Okinawa, and not forgetting the battles in Burma and Borneo.

Rules for representing the environment and weapon systems that defined the PTO are included, along with information on the Japanese Army and 20 new Pacific fog of war cards.

This book allows you to join the fight and battle along the Road to Tokyo.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation

name: Rapid Response System (fan expansion for Pandemic: The Cure)
description:
This fan expansion contains 8 cards: the action cards Zone Pass, Incubator, Subsidy and Quarantine and four overview cards

In addition the following materials from Pandemic: Rapid Response are required:
- 4 blue and 6 green dice
- 4 red and 4 white supply crates
- 9 time tokens

Pandemic: The Cure – Rapid Response System can be combined with Pandemic: The Cure – Experimental Meds, but this is not required.

On the game setup, one green die is rolled is placed in each of the six regions. Each player receives one blue die and one Rapid Response reference card in addition to their player materials.

The four action cards are placed next to the game area. The red crates are placed on the Subsidy card and the white ones on the Quarantine card. The time tokens are separated into three piles of three and put on the Zone Pass card.

The green dice have different effects on the regions. For example, the actions fly, sail or collect sample can be blocked, a biohazard is ignored or a treat action is done in that region.

At the begin of each turn, the current player rolls their blue die. That die allows to do a special move to a region where the green die has the same symbol in that turn once.

The four action cards have special effects which cost a number of dice from the CDC.

Zone Pass lets a player bypass the blocks from the green dice, Incubator allows to put removed infection dice back into the bag, Subsidy enables additional treat actions and Quarantine makes it possible to ignore biohazard symbols.

After each epidemic, the green dice are rerolled.
categories: Dice, Environmental, Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Medical
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Point to Point Movement, Push Your Luck, Set Collection, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Command Decision: Test of Battle – In the Clutches of Eagles
description:
In the Clutches of Eagles

In 1940 Germany stunned the world with its far reaching strikes behind enemy lines.
The tools of this new style of warfare: the men of the 7th Flieger Division.
The Fallschirmjäger would participate on every major front of the war, from hot African deserts to the snowy wastes of Russia. The Fallschirmjäger, like their Allied counterparts, would be known for their excellent training, courage, and morale.

This book follows the Fallschirmjäger as they grow from a small, battalion size force in the pre-war years, expanding in size to a single division, and then eventually expanding into their full strength in 1944.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation

name: Blue Water Navy: World War III – The Pacific
description:
June 1983 – world war III has begun. F-14 Tomcats and F-4 Phantoms roar off the carrier decks looking for Soviet Backfire and Badger bombers while underwater Victor and Sturgeon submarines duel. In the merchant lanes, loaded tankers make their way from the US to Japan, stalked by submarines and the Soviet fleet. Somewhere in Hawaii, a Soviet spy transmits the location of a carrier group to the Soviets, and a RORSAT satellite whizzes overhead looking for its target.

Welcome to the Pacific – the US problem is the great distance involved fighting thousands of miles from home, whilst the Soviets fight on their doorstep, though with the chance of their airfields and ports being destroyed – even then, the main Soviet Pacific ocean ‘warm water’ port of Petropavlovsk, being remote, has no rail or road access and must be supplied by sea – the Soviet fleet will have to take up this challenge. Vietnam also – a 5 day cruise from Vladivostok – must be supplied by sea.

The US will hope that Japan will make their forces available – but what if the Soviets have arranged for neutrality? If neutrality cannot be arranged will the Soviets take the initiative and destroy the Japanese air on the ground?

China states its neutrality, but could join either side – perhaps choosing this moment to make their move for Taiwan, or to stay neutral – if they do will the Soviets invade and solve the Chinese communist problem once and for all?

And what of North Korea – eager to profit from a fight but answering to both China and the Soviets; a South Korean victory could be disastrous here – if war is declared, US marines and convoys must not get through!

Blue Water Navy: The Pacific covers the action from the West coast of the USA over to Vietnam and is the sister game of Blue Water Navy, which covers Europe. This game can be played standalone; ownership of Blue Water Navy is not necessary to play.

Game System Features:

Card driven, each card provides points to move units or trigger events – all the chrome is on the cards
Reaction events spoil enemy plans, keep both players on their toes and deliver a story
Interactive IGO-UGO system is fast and keeps both players playing, not watching
Task forces must be detected to be attacked – if you can’t see it you can’t shoot it
Submarines are powerful but need to be queued to a detected target
Air detection assets find task forces but are vulnerable to fighters
Soviets must maintain their nuclear missile submarines, and their first strike capability whilst the US must sink those nuclear missile boats
Presents the real order of battle as known in the time periods of the game – no made up units, no ahistorical superweapons
Fun and fast, but realistic and plausible outcomes – modern naval without the maths


Pacific Theatre Features:

Neutral nations and diplomacy – China; Japan; North Korea
Europe and US to Japan merchant shipping – sink those tankers!
Chinese minelaying, huge invasion fleets and hopelessly outclassed weapon systems
Wild weasels, multirole fighters, B-52s; and F-18’s on carriers
Both sides get to attack – the Soviets need to do damage but protect their bases.
Anti-task force ICBM strike (!)
Like BWN, 3 timeframes to choose from showcasing changing technology – 1983, 1985, 1989 – go for 1989 for super high-tech with cruise missiles, Akula class submarines, VLS Ticonderoga..
A smaller game than blue water navy and more of a sandbox – there are many possible outcomes
20 optional potential or ahistorical variants – Monsoon; Korean unification; Philippine uprising


Complexity: 6 out of 10 (medium)
Solitaire suitability: 6 out of 10 (medium)
Time Scale: Each turn = 2 days (each card play is one day)
Map Scale: Each area represents 500 nautical miles square
Unit Scale: Each counter represents 10 ships, 3 submarines, one squadron or regiment of air
Number of Players: 2
Playing Time: 1-3 hours for scenarios and 8-12 hours per campaign game

Components:

two maps
two countersheets: counters are a mix of 1 inch, 5/8″ and ½” markers
two decks of 55 playing cards (110 cards total)
eight double-sided player aids
rules booklet
scenario booklet
ten 10-sided dice


(from Compass Games website)
categories: Aviation / Flight, Modern Warfare, Nautical, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Area Movement, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Events, Hidden Movement, Movement Points, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation, Variable Set-up

name: Dungeons of Infinity: Kingdom Cost
description:
An expansion to Dungeons of Infinity. This expansion adds two new Heroes, new Minions, new Sentinels, a New Dungeon Lord, a new 18 dungeon mini-campaign, miniatures, and three new areas to explore. The new areas are a Tower, a Prison, and a Cathedral. Conquer these areas to receive new rewards that will help you beat the dungeon you are exploring.

An exciting expansion for Dungeons of infinity that will add new gameplay and a continuation of the Epic campaign from the base game. The campaign in the base ended with a cliff hanger. Find out what happens next in the Epic continuation of the King Armiger storyline.

Includes solo, cooperative, story, and competitive play just as the original.

—description from the designer
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Maze, Medieval
mechanics: Action Points, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Cooperative Game, Modular Board, Role Playing

name: WordNerd
description:
The GOAL of WordNerd is to make sentences using specified words to earn those cards for points. Collecting cards that also spell either W-O-R-D or N-E-R-D earns extra points. Having the most points wins the game -- and, players have a blast sharing their sentences!

TO PLAY, sentences are created by taking the First letter in their word to start their sentence, taking the Second letter in their word to start the second word in their sentence, and so on.
mechanics: Pattern Building

name: 1883 Express d'Orient
description: 1883 Express d'Orient is an 18xx game set between Budapest and Bucharest, players control companies that are headed by different “company presidents”. Two company president cards are randomly assigned at the beginning of the game to each company. These cards give the company a specific ability from phase 2 through phase 4 and another ability from phase 5 until the end of the game. Additional “McGuffins” include giving the players the ability to skip the last train of a type in order to buy the first train of the next type, private companies that pay more revenue once connected to the rail network, and a non-player investor that buys and sells shares based upon the current status of each company. You’ll need familiarity with, or a copy of, the rules to 1830 to play the game.
categories: Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Trains, Transportation
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Network and Route Building, Stock Holding, Tile Placement

name: Wanted
description:
The Black Rock Butcher was a serial killer who terrorized the saloon girls of Black Rock in the days when it was a burgeoning gold rush town. Because criminal investigation techniques hadn’t yet been developed, the killer was never apprehended. New evidence has recently come to light indicating that The Butcher was actually the great-great-grandfather of the founder of The Will Street Detective Agency. In other words, your boss might be related to a notorious murderer. Unlike most cases, this one is now personal, and you have been tasked to clear the family name. Although the leads in this cold case all date back to the 1800’s, you must follow each one and use all your skills as a detective to determine the true identity of The Black Rock Butcher.

Difficulty Level: 7/10
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: From Empire to Revolution: An Eastern Front Supplement for Through The Mud & The Blood
description:
From Empire to Revolution is a supplement by Chris Stoesen introducing us to the Russian and Austro-Hungarian Armies on the Eastern Front. Chris has charted a path through the minefield of the Eastern Front to provide details of force organisation and tactics for the war, as well as sixteen varied scenarios covering the period from 1914 to the revolutions of 1917 which removed Russia from the conflict.

The scenarios are as follows:

In Search of a Drink, September 1914
Bridge Over the Wislonka, October 1914
Spilling Royal Blood, October 1914
Clear the Trench, October 1914
A Hunting Expedition, Spring 1915
Noblesse Oblige, March 1915
Yashka, Easter 1915
A Terrible Harvest, August 1915
A Scouting Party, Fall 1915
Bagging a General, November 1915
Kept in the Dark, November 1915
Frontkämpfer, April 1916
Dead Mens Hill, August 1916
Against All Orders, October 1916
The Brides of Death, Spring 1917
Ending with a Bang, July 1917


This PDF supplement is designed to be used with Through the Mud & the Blood rules.
The scenarios range from between 10 to 100 or so figures a side.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War I
mechanics: Line of Sight, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation

name: Tipoucet
description:
A cooperative game from the age of 6 where everyone plays against the ogre.
Take Tipoucet and his brothers through the forest to get back to the cottage and avoid the ogre that is prowling around. Free the captured children, take shortcuts to hide and return with the Treasures.
A game is played by 1 to 7 players and lasts about 20 minutes.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Network and Route Building

name: A Song of Ice & Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game – Builder Stone Thrower
description:
The Builder Stone Thrower is an artillery piece that Night’s Watch commanders can bring with them to battle. Extremely cumbersome to move, and poorly armored, the Stone Thrower more than makes up for it in offensive power. The Thrower has no upper limit to its range, lobbing boulders over troops and terrain to land where needed.

The Builders are one of the traditional institutions of the Night’s Watch. Due to the nature of their institution, these Brothers are adept at repairing buildings as well as constructing siege engines. The Builder Stone Thrower is one of these contraptions, used to guard the Wall from Wildlings and other threats. This expensive piece of equipment is a force to be reckoned with on the battlefield and opponents will be foolish if they don’t react to their presence on the table.

Tactical Points
This is a very rules-intensive Unit, take some time to read through it carefully. Some exceptional rules they have are:
They never roll Panic Tests. -They never gain Condition Tokens.
They may only attack once per round, so taking the Combat Zone on the Tactics Board is rarely useful.
Use the Stone Thrower’s range to your advantage and force your enemy to take an offensive position.

Be careful! If an enemy unit is within Long Range of your Stone Thrower Unit, they are not eligible to being hit by your boulders.

Contents:
2 Builder Stone Thrower Miniatures on Large Solo Tray
2 Unit Cards

-description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Novel-based
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Worker Placement
publishers: CMON Global Limited, Dark Sword Miniatures, Inc., Edge Entertainment

name: Right or Left
description:
In Right or Left (ライトオアレフト), you need to bluff and destroy bluffs in roughly equal measure in order to end up with more points than all of the other players.

The game consists of two metal cups and forty wooden cubes, ten each in red, yellow, blue, and black. (In a two-player game, you use only five of each color.) When you're the active player, you take 4-7 cubes from the supply (based on the number of players) and show which cubes you've taken to the guesser, who then hides their eyes. You distribute the cubes as you wish between the two cups, with some cubes (including possibly none!) being hidden underneath each cup and at least one cube on top of a cup. The guesser then opens their eyes, sees (some of) what's being offered, then chooses one of the cups, either right or left, keeping everything on and underneath that cup, while you keep the cubes from the other cup.

After two complete rounds in which each player has been the active player twice, you tally your score based on what you've collected. Some colors increase in value for each one you've collected, but then zero out if you've collected too many; other colors score little to nothing until you've collected a bunch of them. Who will end up with the highest scoring collection?
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Deduction, Open Drafting, Set Collection

name: Song of Tales
description:
Song of Tales is a game of collaborative and competitive story telling for 1-8 players. Players select a character from world folk tales to play as and then lay out a series of story fragments. They have to tell a story to tie the fragments together into a single coherent whole, using the style of their chosen character to do so. Other players can bid to join in with the story-teller's tale, extending the story and earning points for both teller and listener.

Each story is scored, and at the end of the game, the player with the highest score wins.

—description from the designer
categories: Book, Children's Game, Educational, Fantasy, Humor, Memory, Mythology, Print & Play, Word Game
mechanics: Communication Limits, Finale Ending, Memory, Push Your Luck, Semi-Cooperative Game, Set Collection, Solo / Solitaire Game, Storytelling

name: Battle at Forests Edge
description:
INTRODUCTION:
In the early dawn, two factions find themselves in dispute near a pristine green forest. Can you eliminate your opponent’s commanders on your path to victory?

DESCRIPTION:
Battle at Forests Edge is a head-to-head card and dice game where players have to balance luck with tactical play.

GAME OBJECTIVE:
Defeat all of the opposing player's command trucks.

GAME PLAY:
Players will place out their unit cards in descending rows of units to create a battlefield layout. During each turn, players have a certain number of action points (AP) to spend to move, or attack with units. Attacks are made with d8 dice to determine their effect.

GAME ELEMENTS:

Dice-rolling of multiple d8 dice to determine outcomes
Unit placement and unit ranges
Attack and defense effects between different unit types

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action Points, Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Rock-Paper-Scissors

name: Third Lebanon War
description:
"Third Lebanon War" is an operational level wargame on a hypothetical invasion of southern Lebanon by the Israeli Defence Forces some time in the near future.
The context is that Israel has decided to mount an invasion of southern Lebanon to eliminate the threat posed by the continued presence and actions of the Hezbollah organization, but on a much larger and more destructive scale than the 2006 incursion.

One player (the IDF) takes the role of the commander of the Israeli Defence Forces (IDF);
the other (the Insurgent) the role of the commander of the Hezbollah irregular forces.
The Insurgent player may also receive units from other countries (Syria or Iran) if certain events occur to cause them to enter the game (players may also agree to have these additional forces in the mix from the beginning of the game, or not to include them at all).

—description from introduction
mechanics: Area Movement, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Dice Rolling, Movement Points, Simulation

name: Magic Maze: Technische Anlagen
description:
This mini/promo expansion for Magic Maze consists of tiles G, H, and I of Magic Maze: 9 new tiles

The base game and the expansion "Maximum security" are necessary to use the new tiles.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Maze, Real-time
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Warhammer Age of Sigmar: Warcry – Ogroid Myrmidon
description:
Myrmidons are masters of the Varanspire’s fighting pits, and have spent decades mastering the gladiatorial arts. In battle, they lead those who seek to join the Everchosen’s legions, for to impress a Myrmidon is to be marked for glory.

Whether you're commanding your Slaves to Darkness or seeking favour in the Bloodwind Spoil, if you have a Chaos collection, you want an Ogroid Myrmidon. This hulking champion is more than just a deadly close combatant, but a great leader for your units. This expansion lets you bring the Ogroid Myrmidon to your games of Warcry. Add him to your Iron Golems, Corvus Cabal, Cypher Lords, Splintered Fang, Untamed Beasts, The Unmade, Spire Tyrants and Scions of the Flame warbands as an Ally, and harness deadly abilities with included fighter and ability cards.

This set contains a multipart plastic Ogroid Myrmidon with a 50mm round base. It also includes an Ogroid Myrmidon Warcry Fighter Card and ability cards in English, French, Italian, German, Spanish, Chinese, Japanese, and Russian.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Warhammer Age of Sigmar: Warcry – Ogor Mawtribes
description:
Ogors can always be described as either eating or hungry. Worshipping Gorkamorka in his aspect as the Gulping God, they are on a mission to consume everything they can. From the ravening Gutbusters to the winter-touched Beastclaw Raiders, all ogors are united by their desire to gorge themselves. The only thing an ogor enjoys almost as much as eating is a good fight, and the Eightpoints provide opportunity for both of these things in abundance. More and more warbands of ogors have been making their way to this interstitial realm, to the misfortune of everyone who crosses their path.

Chow down on the competition and devour the denizens the Bloodwind Spoil with this Ogor Mawtribes Card Pack! This set allows you to master the gluttonous Gutbusters (and their diminutive Gnoblar chums) in your games of Warcry. Offering one of the game’s most elite warbands, they're great if you're looking for a force made up of only a few fighters, this is a great choice.

This set contains:
- A faction ability card, allowing you to harness tactics, tricks and abilities unique to this warband, including the runemarks you need to use them. The reverse allows you to identify the fighters in your warband. The set contains a faction abilities card in each of the following languages: English, French, German, Italian, Spanish, Chinese, Japanese, and Russian.
- Fighter cards for 8 types of fighter, including Gluttons, Ironguts, Leadbelchers and Gnoblars, with a variety of options.
- 2x divider cards, used to keep track of any tokens that apply to fighters in games

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Anno Domini 1666: Horrors of Vienna Expansion Set
description:
There is a saying that people are the world’s real monsters. Anybody believing that obviously hasn’t been to Anno Domini 1666’s Vienna. This poor city has been invaded by two creatures so vile that even Klaus, the evil alchemist, wouldn’t have them as pets.

The Basilisk dwells in the city sewers. Once it climbs up to the surface, it flies across the night sky terrorizing citizens with its deadly gaze.

The Lindwurm is a snake-like scavenger feasting on fresh graves. Its scales make the beast nearly invincible, while the poisonous bite keeps would-be monster hunters at bay.

This set contains two highly detailed, ready to play miniatures, along with all the character and item cards necessary to use them in the game, plus two game scenarios.

Contents:
• 2 Highly detailed plastic miniatures
• 6 Character cards
• 5 Item cards
• 1 Rulesheet (two new scenarios included)
categories: Adventure, Age of Reason, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures
mechanics: Grid Movement, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: Anno Domini 1666: Bohun's Rebels Faction Set
description:
Bohun’s Rebels hail from the vast steppes of Ukraine. These headstrong troublemakers come to Vienna with their own agenda, and fueled by a combination of both savage ferocity and military discipline, they are sure to get what they want. And in case this is not enough, they brought along their own witch.

Warning: this is not a standalone product. You will need a copy of Anno Domini 1666 Base Game to use the contents of this box.

Contents:
• 7 highly detailed plastic miniatures
• 7 Character cards
• 16 Item cards
• 1 Faction card
categories: Adventure, Age of Reason, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures
mechanics: Grid Movement, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: Anno Domini 1666: Order of the Broken Cross Faction Set
description:
The Order of the Broken Cross are an evil sect, scheming in Vienna’s dark alleyways. Unburdened by the confines of morality and conscience, they will stop at nothing to advance their plots. The silent and deadly Knechts carry out their assignments quietly and without hesitation, while their Heroes pull the strings from the shadows. Will you dare to join them?

Warning: this is not a standalone product. You will need a copy of Anno Domini 1666 Base Game to use the contents of this box.

Contents:
• 7 highly detailed plastic miniatures
• 7 Character cards
• 23 Item cards
• 1 Faction card
categories: Adventure, Age of Reason, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures
mechanics: Grid Movement, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: StrikeZone: Baseball Tabletop Game
description:
Compete with friends and family in this action-packed tabletop baseball experience that's fun for all ages - indoors or out!

Steps to setup the game:

Roll out your 5x5 baseball diamond.
Flip a coin to see who bats or pitches first.
Load the StrikeZone baseball into the Pitcher's hand. Pull back on the spring-loaded lever and release to fire the plunger into the back of the ball - sending it towards home plate.
With your left-hand, pull on the Batter's Line to raise and lower his arms and the bat. With your right-hand, pull back on the home plate lever to rotate your Batter's hips and swing through the ball.


How to score:

If you hit the ball to a Catcher, Fielder, or Pitcher before it hits the ground - you're out!
If you ground hit the ball to a Catcher, Fielder, or Pitcher - you hit a single. (StrikeZone uses ghost runners to run the bases).
If you ground hit a ball past everyone - you hit a double or a triple based on where it rolled off the edge of the field (as marked by a 2 or a 3 on the field).
If you hit a fair ball in the air past everyone and above The Blue Monster - you hit a homer!
For an extra fun rule twist, we recommend giving human players (whoever's pitching or on defense) the ability to catch a ball in mid-air. Catch the ball before it hits the ground or the basement wall and save a run!
Strikes, balls, foul balls, outs and hitting the Batter with a pitch all follow traditional baseball scoring rules.


How does a player win:
Just like in Baseball, a player to score most in thier innings is a winner.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Sayulita Swell
description:
This gnarly solo game is perfectly suited for the min-max brain to get the highest score and limit the chance of losing energy on the wrong waves. The varibilty of WAVE SWELLS (shuffling of WAVE sheets) brings new challenges each game. We are stoked for you to come shread the WAVES of Sayulita, Mexico!

Sayulita Swell is a solo play Surfing game that will keep you coming back to the swell to score higher and higher points. Using dice rolling, push-your-luck and point management, the surfer tries to catch ever changing waves of the Sayulita Surf Break.

SET UP - Each game you take on 12 different SWELLS, choosing the best 6 WAVES to ride. Paddle out and move your pawn to find the ideal spot on the WAVE to score points and use your ENERGY wisely. Every oncoming WAVE is different from the last. You never know what is coming bro.

AVOID WIPEOUTS - Dive under or bail on WAVES that have a bad break. But dude be careful to use your ENERGY wisely so you can maximize your points and set up well on the WAVE .

THE PERFECT ROLL - Catch the perfect wave and score a gnarly ride by rolling two 6 sided dice to match the number your pawn is on. Or, use ENERGY points to catch the WAVE without needing to risk a dice roll.

SCORE BIG - Choose your RIGHT or LEFT side of the wave, then score big and even CARVE out to net even bigger payouts. Get amped and try for bigger and better scores each game bro.

UNIQUE PLAYERBOARDS - Test your skills with different surf styles on each of the 4 PLAYERBOARDS, all with unique point placements, abilities, and strengths/ weaknesses.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Listen Up
description:
Created by The Kindness Collective, Listen Up is a conversational board game that tests your listening skills and inspires deeper connections between friends and family! Packaged into a compact and easy-to-play game with over 250 questions and activities, ranging from deep and meaningful to light-hearted and fun, Listen Up is guaranteed to reveal untold stories, heartfelt moments, and plenty of laughs with those closest to you!

The game is simple. Each player moves around the board answering personal questions according to the category they land on. Other players can delve deeper into their answers by using GET REAL cards, and make sure to remember their responses to gain extra points at the end!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Bushido: Focused Chi Promo Card
description:
A new promo for Bushido! This card can be used to boost any other card.

Available as part of the 2020 Dice Tower Kickstarter Discoverers Pack.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Open Drafting

name: Brittany 1944: The Race for Brest
description:
Solo game, based on Race to the Rhine mechanics, simulating the liberation of Brittany during August and September '44.
The 8th US Corps of Troy Middleton has the mission to liberate the region and secure the Breton ports for use them as supply bases.
The player commands the 4 divisions of the 8th US Corps and his task is, in a limited time to score a maximum of Medals, by destroying German units, occupying strategic cities, besieging and capturing the ports and preventing their destruction by the Wehrmacht.
categories: Racing, Transportation, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Network and Route Building, Race, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Lone Panzer
description:
It is July of 1943; Germany's 4th Panzer army just suffered mayor defeat at Prokhorovka. One panzer IV tank got caught behind enemy lines, inside are 5 crew members suffering from battle stress, scared and alone, far from friendly units. They will have to traverse 40 km through enemy territory and try to reach their HQ.

Lone Panzer is a solitary game played around 30-60 minutes. Player will take control of all 5 crew members and try to move his tank from one side of the map to another, encountering enemy units and testing skills of his crew against other difficulties.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Dice Rolling, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Arty Mouse: Spin & Find game
description:
Arty Mouse: Spin & Find game was developed to help children strengthen their memory and practice memory techniques. There are two ways of playing it - an easier and a more advanced mode.

The game has a spinner and tiles with characters. The characters are represented on the tiles multiple times in different environments and poses. The goal of the game is to find and get as many tiles as possible.

In the basic game mode, children first mark the back of the tiles. They can draw their unique markings, shapes and doodles that will help them remember what is on the other side. The tiles are then placed face-down. In the second part of the game they spin the spinner and find the character that the arrow points to among the face-down tiles. The player with the most tiles at the end of the game wins.

In the advanced game mode, extra tiles are added, with only some tiles marked, and additional rules apply that make the game even more challenging.

The rules include additional variants for a single player and cooperative gameplay.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Memory

name: Oymyakon
description:
Oymyakon, winter of 1926.

Oyamyakon is a semi-cooperative game where we will assume the role of a family from Oymyakon, the coldest inhabited city in the world. The purpose of the game is to survive the low temperatures and to be the family that has lived a winter in the best possible conditions, accumulating more and better resources, for this they must manage to put groups of 3 cards of the same type inside their house and get thus the highest number of victory points.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Hand Management, Set Collection, Turn Order: Time Track, Worker Placement

name: Pineapple
description:
At its core, Pineapple is an intense truth or lie game in which you present your fellow players with extremely deep prompts. Some will be lying, and it is your job to find the liars. Don't be afraid to get serious or awkward or weird with your prompts as the goal is to learn more about people you've known for a long time — or those you've just met.

One person is the Prompter each round, while the rest are Responders. Pass out one card to each Responder face down. If you're a Responder, you look at this card secretly, and if it's a "Truth" card, you must tell the truth, and if it's a "Lie" card, you must tell a lie. All lies must be complete lies, and all truths complete truths. However, there is one exception: The Hybrid. If you receive this card, you must tell a true story that occurred in a fictional universe and try to pass it off as your own.

Once all the Responders have checked out their card, the Prompter provides a prompt, whether using the included Prompt cards as inspiration or reading a question directly off one. Each Responder now responds. As a Responder, if you do not feel comfortable answering a question, you may tap the X card in the middle of the table. This signifies to the table you are out this round. Keep your card face down.

After each Responder responds, the Promoter can ask two Responders one follow-up question, after which the Prompter must now locate the liars and the hybrid.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing

name: Wizards of Aeydor
description:
Wizards of Aeydor is a magical game of strategy and chance where the players are Wizards who compete to become the next OverSeer of the hidden land of Aeydor.
​
Land on the Safe Zone, or duel with the SpellKeeper?
Eye the easy Crystals, or go for the harder Spells?
Risk what you have, or play the safe game?
​
Every decision matters, so choose wisely!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action Points, Set Collection

name: Blood Red Skies: Bristol Beaufighter MKI Squadron
description:
The Bristol Type 156 Beaufighter was a multi-role aircraft, originally conceived as a heavy fighter variant from the Bristol Beaufort bomber.

This particular variant proved to be suited for night-fighting duties.

—description from the publisher
categories: Aviation / Flight, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Emulsion
description:
IntroductionEmulsion is a finite territory game for two players: Black and White. It is played on the spaces (squares) of a square board of any size. At the start of the game, all squares of the board are covered with black and white pieces in a checkered pattern. On odd-sized boards, the center square is occupied by White.



DefinitionsA piece's value is the number of pieces of its color orthogonally adjacent to it plus half the number of board edges adjacent to it.

A group is a piece along with all other like-colored pieces one could reach from it through a series of steps between orthogonally adjacent pieces of its color.

The size of a group is the number of pieces in it.



PlayBlack plays first, then turns alternate. On your turn, swap the positions of two orthogonally or diagonally adjacent pieces of different colors so that the value of your piece in the pair is increased.

The game ends when there are no more moves available. Then, the players jointly remove pairs of opposite-colored groups of the same size from the board until there are no more such pairs to remove. The player with the biggest group left over wins. On even-sized boards, if the board is empty, whoever made the last move before the game's end loses.



Pie ruleThe pie rule is used in order to make the game fair. This means White will have the option, on their first turn only, to swap sides with their opponent instead of making a regular move.



VariantsFree Emulsion: The board is initially empty. A piece's value is the same as in the standard game plus half the number of empty squares orthogonally adjacent to that piece. On your turn, instead of making a swap, you may place one piece of each color on orthogonally adjacent empty squares.



NotesA swap always increases the value of both pieces in the pair by the same amount. Therefore, a legal swap for one player is always a legal swap for the other player as well.

Emulsion was inspired by Michał Zapała's Slyde.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Chaining, Connections, Pattern Movement, Pattern Recognition, Point to Point Movement, Square Grid

name: Plumbs and Play
description:
Plumbs is a tube card game ... or rather the tube game!

Create the conduct by joining the various pipes and try to accumulate more points than your opponents, forming lines of the same color. But beware of competition from other players, basically you have the same purpose!

Join the tube cards together by matching the tightening screws, also using tubes of different colors, so as to compose the main line or game line. When assembling continuous sections of 3 or more tube cards of the same color (complete set), remove them and keep them aside !!

At the end of the game, count the points shown on the tubes you have accumulated and ... whoever scores the most points wins! Simple isn't it ?!

Preparation
1. Shuffle the Main Deck of Cards
2. Place the main deck of cards mixed in to the side of the table down (henceforth Deck of Peach), so as to leave free space in the play area in front of you

Deal 3 cards to each player
The older player starts the turn and proceeds clockwise;

Play
1. The turn player starts by drawing 2 cards from the Draw Deck;
2. During his turn the player:
• He can play Pipe cards (if he has them), remembering that:
The pipe cards played must be attached to the other pipe cards already present in the Game Area through the clamping screws;
If there are no tube cards in the Game Area, the player can start a new line or conduct by placing a new tube card in the Game Area. (which will cause the first player to start the game);
If you have tube cards in your hand that cannot be attacked anywhere (the tightening screws do not attach to any of the cards in the Game Area) you can decide to play it and start a new line or conduct;
• Can play Special or Cassette cards (if he has them);
• Cannot discard cards during his turn (except in special cases explained later);
• He can only pass hands if he has 3 or fewer cards in his hand.

Finally, remember one last rule:
All the special type cards or tools used or the tube cards removed will be discarded and placed face up next to the Fishing Deck, thus composing the discard pile.

End of the game
The game ends when there are no more cards to draw in the Draw Deck. After the last player of the turn has drawn the last card from the deck, the final game turn will proceed: after this, the game will end.

The tube cards left in the hand of each player will be counted as a penalty and the points shown above them will be subtracted from the player's final score ... so remember to use them (be careful though, continuing existing lines or starting new ones can provide advantages to the players after you!)

Count points and win
Each player at the end of the game counts the points shown above the accumulated tube cards.

Victory is achieved depending on the game mode chosen:
1. "Kill them all" (about 30 minutes): the player who scores the most points in a single round wins;
2. "Long road to ruin" (about 60 minutes): The first player who reaches 5000 points in one or more game rounds wins. If the player scores the necessary points during a round of play, he will still have to complete the game, hoping not to be exceeded in the point count and therefore not to stick to the ... tube!

-description from publisher
mechanics: Push Your Luck, Set Collection

name: A Song of Ice & Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game – Targaryen Heroes I
description: Both the Dothraki Horse Lords and the famous Unsullied owe their allegiance to the Mother of Dragons, Daenerys Targaryen. Their officers and veterans lead her troops to victory over time and again across the world with a combination of skill, charisma, and iron discipline. While leaders of these disparate groups posses vastly different styles of command, the results are much the same. Their troops fight harder, move faster, and survive long enough to see the next battle. Above all, their dedication to the Dragon Queen is absolute, and their faith in her cause is unshakable.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Novel-based, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Measurement Movement, Worker Placement

name: Hard City: Heroes of Hard City
description:
This expansion will allow you to play as five new heroes: William Casey, Aaron Kaufmann, Regan O’Hara, Garett Oliver and the H.A.R.DMan!

Set includes:
5x officers miniatures,
30x skill cards,
5x officer sheets.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Horror, Humor, Miniatures
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Russia's Aircraft: Soviet & Russian Military Aircraft, 1955-2020
description:
