Russia's Aircraft is a comprehensive listing of platforms, weapons and sensors for Soviet & Russian military aircraft from 1955-2020. All the data is based on real-world information, and is the most accurate unclassified source in existence.

It is being released with in conjunction with another five books (Harpoon V rules, Player's Handbook, America's Navy, America's Aircraft, and Russia's Navy).
categories: Aviation / Flight, Expansion for Base-game, Modern Warfare, Nautical, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Paper-and-Pencil, Simulation

name: Cyberwolves
description:
"Too advanced for nature, too primitive for society."

Cyberwolves is a 2-9 player micro-game with rpg elements. Players build a cyberwolf with strengths and weakness in order to complete missions such as mysteries, heists, and revolutions. You don't need to survive to win, you just need to complete the mission.

The game consists of three rounds. Each rounds, players must overcome challenges through cooperative dice rolls and use if variable player powers. The game ends when the final round is complete, or whenever all players are dead, whichever comes first.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Push Your Luck, Role Playing

name: Battle Peak
description: In Battle Peak, 2-4 players take the role of wizards fighting for their lifes on top of the highest mountain in the land. Players cast spells by combining the 4 elements to set their opponents on fire, throw them off the mountain and send them to their eternal doom. The last wizard standing wins the game.
mechanics: Action Points, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Hexagon Grid

name: Blood Red Skies: Junkers Ju 88C Squadron
description:
The Junkers Ju 88C was one of the most successful heavy fighters used by the Luftwaffe.

It was a conversion of the Ju 88 bomber with its usual glasshouse nose replaced by a solid fairing mounting a formidable battery of machine guns and cannon.

The Ju 88C worked in multiple roles throughout the war including ground attack as a fighter-bomber, bomber-destroyer, intruder, maritime long range escort and strike aircraft.

—description from the publisher
categories: Aviation / Flight, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Simulation, Variable Player Powers

name: Berlin Manalaysay's Combatron: The Card Game Rise of Megadeath
description:
The Battle is not yet finish. Be prepared for the bigger threat!

The stand-alone expansion to Berlin Manalaysay's Combatron: The Card Game based on the popular 90's Filipino comic strip. More Space Warriors arrives including Axel, Armorgeddon, Mechababe and Combatron in his second armor. The game still uses the same mechanics from the first Combatron Card Game and can be combined with it.
Power vs Power - Player with the highest total power wins and deals damage to opponent
Power vs Assist - No Damage will be dealt but card effects will still trigger
Assist vs Assist - Both cards will cancel out each others effect

The goal is still the same, have all your opponents take 4 damage and be the last one standing.

In addition, there is a new game mode called "Megadeath vs. Space Warriors" where 1 player takes the role of Megadeath with his arsenal and all other players with their Space Warriors vying to defeat him.

—user summary
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting
mechanics: Rock-Paper-Scissors, Semi-Cooperative Game, Simultaneous Action Selection
publishers: Ludus Distributors, TEGR (The Epic Gaming Regiment)

name: ElevatorUp
description:
ElevatorUp is the brand NEW kid-created, kid-designed, kid-marketed, and kid-shipped (yes, they're all me) card game! Elevator Up will keep you smiling through Ups, Downs, and even getting Stuck!

ElevatorUp is fast-paced, easy-to-learn, and never gets old. Uno, GoFish, and other classic card games begin to become monotonous. Luckily, ElevatorUp provides a much needed innovation.

It is perfect for Travel, Camp, Sleepovers, Parties, Game-Nights, and any other occasion for a card game.

THEME:
An elevator going Up, Down, and sometimes Stuck in a building!

HOW TO PLAY:
Object - Be the first one out of cards.

Setup - Give each player 3 cards face down on the table (no one is allowed to look at these), 2 cards face up on the table (everyone can see these), and 3 cards for their hand (only that player can look at those).

Gameplay - There are three sections of the game: Beginning: Hand Cards, Middle: Face Up Cards, End: Face Down Cards.
When it is your turn, you must discard a card that is either an equal/higher floor than the previously played card or a special card. If there is no previously played card, then you can play any card. Continue taking turns and discarding cards until someone does not have a special card or an equal/higher floor, meaning they must pick up the entire discard pile and add it to their hand. Players must keep at least 3 cards in their hand at all times, replenishing from the remainder of the deck. The special cards, including New Building, Stuck, Penthouse, Door Closed, and Down to the Lobby, throw exciting twists and turns.
Once the deck has been completely used up and players finish playing the cards in their hand, they move onto the face up cards, leaving them for all to see. The rules are the same for this section, but their hand can be seen by other players. Once they've gotten rid of their face up cards, it is time to play their face down cards. When it is their turn, the player will flip a card onto the discard pile. If it is an equal/higher floor or a special card, then shout "YAY" or any other celebratory exclamation. If it does not, then put on your game face and pick up the entire discard pile, adding it to your hand. The first player out of cards WINS!

description from publisher
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Flames of War: Waffen SS Starter Force – Waffen SS Panther Kampfgruppe
description:
The Waffen-SS were the elite combat arm of Adolf Hitler’s personal bodyguard.
Fighting wherever the fire was hottest, they had proved their mettle many times in the cauldron of battle on the Eastern Front.

With the American and British forces poised to invade Normandy, they were brought west to France to rebuild, tripling their strength to become far stronger than the handful of regular Army Panzer divisions facing the Allies.
When the Allies landed on D-Day, the SS were sent in to throw them back into the sea.

In the battles that followed, their unswerving determination and stubborn refusal to retreat made them the most feared opponents the Allies faced.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Simulation

name: Traps
description:
In Traps, players take control of a team of two unique adventurers. Each team is desperate to escape the jungle the first.

-You’ll use a variety of cards and special abilities to make it happen.
-Draw from hundreds of unique cards to help you make your escape
-Use your characters’ special abilities to incite game changing moments
-Plan your perfect strategy (and a few backup strategies) to stay one step ahead

Card Types:

TRAPS: Place these cards directly on the board to stop your enemies dead in their tracks, wipe out their funds, or just generally cause chaos.

ACTIONS: Play these super-powered cards right from your hand. They’ll help you tilt the game in your favor—from blocking Traps to giving you special perks that last all game.

MONEY PITS: These Traps are all about the money. When an opponent lands on one, they pay you. When you land on one, the bank pays you. It’s a win-win.

FOUND TREASURE: These cards help you accrue sweet, sweet cash to fund your wildest dreams and schemes. You’ve just got to be lucky enough to draw one.

Each turn consists of rolling and moving, drawing cards (see above), and playing those cards with devastating effect.

These cards reshape the jungle with each playthrough so that no two games are ever the same.

Beyond cards, one of the primary game mechanics is character abilities. These let you perform unique actions such as stealing a ton of extra cash from your foes to dodging a Trap at the last minute.

There are 8 characters (4 humans and 4 animals). Each team is made up of a randomly paired human and animal duo. Since every character has their own ability, you never know what combo (and strategy) you’ll end up with.

Along the way you’ll encounter spaces that protect you, beef up your wallet, or poison you, severely setting your progress back.

Nothing is truly as it seems in this jungle. So be warned: Trust no one. Trap everyone.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action/Event, Catch the Leader, Chaining, Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Roll / Spin and Move, Take That, Turn Order: Role Order

name: Warhammer 40,000 (Seventh Edition): Codex – Tau Empire
description: The Warhammer 40,000 Codex books contain the complete rules for playing various armies in Warhammer 40,000. They also contain in-depth painting guides, army lists, and much more.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame

description: Promo pack released by Meeple BR Jogos which included promos for Terraforming Mars, Mombasa, Orleans, and Dead Men Tell No Tales.

description:
The Warhammer 40,000 Codex books contain the complete rules for playing various armies in Warhammer 40,000. They also contain in-depth painting guides, army lists, and much more.


This version is a 64 page soft bound book.

name: River System (fan expansion for Carcassonne)
description:
Expansion to the river expansions. Additionally there is a tile to include the lake landscape.

This expansion contains 11 tiles.

No additional rules.
categories: City Building, Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Medieval, Territory Building
mechanics: Tile Placement

name: Vs. System 2PCG: The Herald
description:
The Heralds, chosen minions of one of the most powerful beings in the universe, were empowered with superhuman strength and abilities. With this expansion for Vs. System 2PCG you can add characters imbued with the Power Cosmic to your existing decks or create an a whole new deck based around Silver Surfer, Nova or Firelord.

• 55 Playable Cards
• 1 Rulesheet

This is not a stand-alone game. A copy of any Vs. System 2PCG stand-alone game is required to play.
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: The Horus Heresy: Book Seven – Inferno
description:
The Horus Heresy Book Seven – Inferno is a supplement for Warhammer 40,000 which depicts the cataclysmic battle of the Burning of Prospero, home planet of the Thousand Sons Legion, the near-destruction of that Legion, the fall of its Primarch, Magnus, and the tangled web of fate and treachery which led up to it.

Within the leather-bound, 312-page book, you’ll find detailed background information on the Fall of Prospero, told across six chapters from The Trial of The Sorcerer to The Seeds of Heresy, exploring the bitter struggle to defend Prospero from the merciless punishment meted out by the Imperium’s forces. Included are full army lists for Space Wolves, Thousand Sons and Talons of the Emperor, allowing you to play the full Prospero campaign – 4 Missions, 3 Conclusion Missions and 3 Legendary Missions are included, alongside a host of special and optional rules.

The Space Wolves and Thousand Sons benefit from Legion-specific Rites of War and specific units and wargear, with full rules for their respective Primarchs included.

Full background for the forces involved is included: on the side of the Imperium you’ll find Space Wolves, Legio Custodes, Sisters of Silence, Servants of the Warmaster and the Ordo Sinister covered in great detail, with the same care and attention placed upon the background of the forces of Prospero: the Thousand Sons, Legio Xestobiax and the Forge World of Zhao Arkhad.

Also included is a Mechanicum appendix – this features rules for the Acastus Knight Porphyrion, Vultarax Stratos-automata and Karacnos Assault Tank, amongst others.

The Horus Heresy Book Seven: Inferno is a complete expansion for the Warhammer 40,000 game – it requires the Warhammer 40,000 rulebook, the Legiones Astartes Crusade Army List and the Mechanicum Taghmata Army List books to use all of its contents.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Master of the World: 1812 in Russia – The Invasion
description:
Master of the World, 1812 in Russia, Phase One: The Invasion
The 1812 campaign is arguably Napoleon’s most well known campaign and one of the great tragedies of military history. It is also the story of Russia’s First Great Patriotic War, repelling a great invader. In excess of 600,000 soldiers and support personnel crossed the Niemen River from the Grand Duchy of Warsaw into Imperial Russia under the French Imperial flag beginning on 24 June, 1812.

Master of the World includes everything you need to begin recreating the first phase of Napoleon's disastrous 1812 Russian campaign: organization, maps, historical briefings, and uniforms.

One campaign
Nine scenarios
Twenty-seven maps
Over 800 uniform images!
created especially for inclusion in this series and offering Nearly 200 pages



Let's start a land war in Asia…
9 scenarios covering the French main army's advance to Moscow:

Mir
Saltanovka – Two versions: The Spoiler Attack and Clear the Way to Mogilev
Ostrovno
Vitebsk
1st Krasne
Smolensk – Two versions: Preserve the Army and Save the Holy City
Lubino
Schwardino
Borodino


The Master of the World Campaign Guide is compatible with Et sans résultat! Original and Second Edition as well as most any other tabletop Napoleonic wargame.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Napoleonic, Wargame
mechanics: Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation

name: Pooman Cards
description:
A twist on the family classic monster chases around the house, evolving it into a new format of flip and chase.

One player is the monsterous game-master Pooman, flipping the cards selected by the other players to reveal an array of characters.

Cards flipped reveal either collectable character cards, special cards or Pooman cards.

Character cards have puntastic names like 'Uriah Niles', and can have brown stars for players to bank points.

Special Cards can have powers to help defend against the Pooman, like freezing power of the 'Poocicle'.

If a Pooman is revealed then players must RUN the game-master will count to 10 and chase the player with the most stars;
if any player is grabbed by the Pooman then all their cards are lost! First player to collect 5 brown stars wins!
Each pack includes 10 blank cards for players to create their own characters.

A new twist on an old classic - varying it so the chase is in short bursts and players can apply tactics and compete against other players to win victory over the Pooman.
mechanics: Set Collection

name: Roll up that Map, 1805 in Germany: The Ulm and Austerlitz Campaigns
description:
Roll up that Map, 1805 in Germany, The Ulm & Austerlitz Campaigns

A series of small but pivotal engagements around the Ulm region allowed Napoleon to cut off nearly all routes of escape from Ulm and strategically surround the city. The Austerlitz Campaign is arguably Napoleon’s most effective campaign, culminating in one of the greatest successful gambles of military history. It is the campaign which introduced La Grande Armée to the world, a highly trained, highly motivated, flexibly organized military system which was the culmination and extension of military evolution to-date.

Roll up that Map includes everything you need to begin recreating both phases of Napoleon's brilliant 1805 German campaign: organization, maps, historical briefings, and uniforms.

Two campaigns,
Nine scenarios,
Twenty-seven maps,
Over 600 uniform images created especially for inclusion in this series and offering!


Sit under the sun of Austerlitz…
9 scenarios covering both the fight for Ulm, leading to the Battle of Austerlitz:

Wertingen
Haslach-Jungingen
Günzburg
Elchingen
Amstetten
Dürenstein
Schöngrabern
Wischau
Austerlitz


The Roll up that Map Campaign Guide is compatible with Et sans résultat! Original and Second Edition as well as most any other tabletop Napoleonic wargame.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Napoleonic, Wargame
mechanics: Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation

name: To Assure My Dynasty: 1808 in Iberia – The Uprising through the Emperor's Arrival
description:
To Assure My Dynasty, 1808 in Iberia
The entrance of the French Empire into a war on the Iberian Peninsula parallels numerous quagmires throughout history, initial success, which developed into a never ending burden. Having determined that the Spanish government did not hold the confidence of its people, and realizing, due to lack of both will and ability, it would never fulfill its responsibilities of allegiance to France, Napoleon determined plans must be made. Upon discovering agents of the Spanish throne discussed Spain’s potential role against France with her enemies, the Emperor decided such plans must be acted upon.
The seemingly never ending pursuit actions across the Iberian landscape of Spain and Portugal provided a stream of empty victories to the French, until finally, the British Expeditionary Force is expelled from the continent at La Coruña.
To Assure My Dynasty, 1808 in Iberia presents Phase One: The Spanish Uprising in four scenarios, pitting Napoleon’s Imperial Army against the Royal Army of Spain, and the British Expeditionary Force and its Portuguese supporters. Followed by Phase Two: The Emperor's Arrival with another eight scenarios, ending with La Coruña.
To Assure My Dynasty includes everything you need to begin recreating the opening phases of the Peninsular War: organization, maps, historical briefings, and uniforms.

Two campaigns
Twelve scenarios
Thirty-six maps
Hundreds of uniform images!
created especially for inclusion in this series



The Emperor is coming to Spain…

12 scenarios covering two campaigns…



The Spanish Uprising:

Medina de Rióseco
Bailén
Roliça
Vimeiro



The Emperor's Arrival:

Zornoza
Burgos o de Gamonal
Espinosa de los Monteros
Tudela
Somosierra
Cardedeu
Molins de Rei
La Coruña



The To Assure My Dynasty Campaign Guide is compatible with Et sans résultat! Original and Second Edition as well as most any other tabletop Napoleonic wargame.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Napoleonic, Wargame
mechanics: Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation

name: Monopoly: Nürburgring
description:
People, myth and engines - that is the story of the racetrack that opened in 1927. The Nordschleife - reverently christened “Green Hell” by Jackie Stewart - is one of the most beautiful and notorious racetracks in the world. Today the Nürburgring is much more: a versatile event and experience location for fans, families and companies - a place for unforgettable experiences.

Now it's your turn: Go on a journey through the “Green Hell” and 90 years of Ring history. "Experience" the unique sections of the route that make the heart of every motorsport fan beat faster. Meet racing heroes as well as legendary events from back then and take a look behind the scenes of today's racetrack.

But beware! Due to the spectacular route through the Eifel forests, the Nordschleife is considered the most demanding racetrack in the world. Only those who pay attention and know the limits can become a true “ring master”.

Free the ring for your journey of discovery: with the MONOPOLY edition of the Nürburgring.


Menschen, Mythos und Motoren – das ist die Geschichte der 1927 eröffneten Rennstrecke. Die Nordschleife – von Jackie Stewart ehrfurchtsvoll „Grüne Hölle“ getauft – ist eine der schönsten und berüchtigtsten Rennstrecken weltweit. Heute ist der Nürburgring noch viel mehr: Eine vielseitige Event- und Erlebnislocation für Fans, Familien und Firmen – ein Ort für unvergessliche Erlebnisse.

Jetzt bist du dran: Gehe auf die Reise durch die „Grüne Hölle“ und 90 Jahre Ring-Historie. „Erfahre“ die einzigartigen Streckenabschnitte, die das Herz jedes Motorsport-Fans höher schlagen lassen. Begegne Rennfahrer-Helden sowie legendären Ereignissen von damals und blicke hinter die Kulissen der Rennstrecke von heute.

Aber Vorsicht! Aufgrund der spektakulären Streckenführung durch die Eifelwälder gilt die Nordschleife als die anspruchsvollste Rennstrecke der Welt. Nur wer aufpasst und die Limits kennt, kann zum wahren „Ring-Meister“ werden.

Ring frei für deine Entdeckungsreise: mit der MONOPOLY-Edition des Nürburgrings.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Income, Lose a Turn, Player Elimination, Set Collection, Trading

name: Swordpoint: Ancient and Medieval Wargames Rules – Second Edition
description:
SWORDPOINT is a new set of “Big Battle” game rules for fighting actions in the ancient and medieval periods.

Games of SWORDPOINT involve between 100 and 250 figures per side arranged into multiple units.
The game is designed to last about 2 hours and encourages the use of historical tactics and emphasises the need to maintain cohesion in the army’s battle line, without being prescriptive.
An extensive series of publications is planned and the game will enjoy the support of web downloads, living FAQ and a range of supported events.

For owners of First edition, a document has been created containing the changes available as a FREE download.

ALL SUPPLEMENTS REMAIN FULLY COMPATIBLE WITH VERSION 2.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Line of Sight, Measurement Movement, Simulation

name: Schatten der Macht: Namenlos
description:
This expansion includes errata of a previous scenario ("Invasion der Verdammten") as well as the new scenario "Namenlos", where players must work together to prevent the Dark Nameless God ("der Namenlose") from returning and bringing the world to his knees.

This expansion features special events (e.g. riots and mass panic), creatures of legend (e.g. Basilisk, Sea Serpent Attack) and new allies with special powers (famous characters in the world of the Dark Eye).

In this apocalyptic and epic scenario, players can ally with an army of Yetis, survive the event of falling stars and deal with demons of the Nameless God - and much more.

The base Game "Schatten der Macht" as well as the 2 Expansions "Verborgene Mächte" and "Graue Eminenzen" are needed to play this Expansion.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Territory Building
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Phoenix Command: Expansion
description:
While primarily thought of as a combat system for Leading Edge's Rhand Morningstar Missions RPG, the original Phoenix Command rules were also intended to be used for man-to-man skirmish wargaming, either on the tabletop or a hex map.


Phoenix Command Expansion contains new rules for the Phoenix Command Combat System, and allows players to add entirely new aspects to their gaming. Each Section is modular, making it easy for players to use the rules that are most interesting to them, and that apply to their particular game. More than a dozen new topics are covered, including:Animal Rules: Full rules for Animals in combat. Data is given for more than 40 different Animals, from Dogs to African Game to Dinosaurs, and special Hit Location and Damage Tables are presented for Birds, Marine Life, Bipeds, and both Short and Long-Legged Quadrupeds. Animal attacks are also given, including Bites, Kicks, Claw attacks, Rams, and special rules for the powerful Rending of a predator with its jaws locked on its target.

Reaction Time: How quickly a combatant reacts to surprise is obviously vital. These rules simulate the reaction times of combatants of varying experience.

Aim Points: Customized Hit Location Tables are given, allowing players to aim at particular areas of a target. The tables accurately represent the modified Odds of Hitting and the altered distribution of hits resulting from aim at the Head, Heart, Mid-Body, or Legs.

40mm Grenade Canister Round: Developed for short-range combat in Vietnam, the M576 Multiple Projectile Round turns a Grenade Launcher into a Shotgun.

Also included are Sections covering: Target Identification; Effective Sustained Automatic Bursts; Tracking Full Automatic Fire; Thrown Grenade Range Modifiers; Grenade Penetration of Brush and Foliage; Overhead Ceilings and Thrown Grenade Ranges; Explosive Shock; Grenade Launcher Arming Range; Expanded Wound Recovery Rolls; and Medical Skill Level Modifiers
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Wings of War WWI: RAF R.E.8
description:
The RAF R.E.8, introduced in early 1917, was the long–awaited replacement for the Be2 series of recon airplanes, offering greater speed and strength. Initial reactions were mixed, as the R.E.8 required more pilot attention than the Be2 and early accidents of spinning and stalls resulted. Once overcome, the airplane became the standard for British observation and light bombing, serving through the end of the war. It was nicknamed “Harry Tate,” after a cockney comedian, who pronounced his name “AIR–EE.”

—description from the publisher
categories: Aviation / Flight, Expansion for Base-game, World War I
mechanics: Action Queue, Player Elimination, Simulation, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Historia w działaniu
description:
Historia w działaniu ("History in action") is a boardgame for 2-5 players. As members of small associations and foundations you will plan and realize historical projects for local societies.
You will get involved in whole process from planning, getting founds, realizing project and summarizing benefits for societies gained thanks to the project.

The player who will manage to complete most ambitious and accurate projects, wins.

Historia w działaniu is not only a boardgame, but can also inspire by ideas, projects and sources of information shown on cards.

Historia w działaniu was published for Niepodległa fund by Games Development in 2019 and was distributed for historical associations for free.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action Queue, Push Your Luck, Race, Rondel, Set Collection

name: Misja Kampinos 2: Społeczeństwo
description:
Misja Kampinos 2: Społeczeństwo (Mission: Kampinos 2 - Society) is a sequel for the boardgame Misja Kampinos.

It is an easy boardgame published for LGD Kampinos (Between Vistula and Kampinos association). It was distributed for free on autumn 2020.

Players as local citizens influence local government (voivode, mayor, regional council)and develop small projects and investments in their communities, counties and voivodships.

The game consists of action drafting and semicooperative mechanics. It's simple and fast, so you can play it either with your family or friends.

Every card shows a different proposition of an investment, that can be realized in communities of players in real-life. Misja Kampinos 2: Społeczeństwo should be treated not only as a boardgame but also as a source of inspiration for projects, that can change life of clocal citizens.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action Drafting, Semi-Cooperative Game, Set Collection

name: Mythic Americas: Warlords of Erehwon Rulebook
description:
The Mythic Americas version of Warlords of Erehwon still keeps at its heart a singular objective in mind – to allow for fast-paced and exciting miniature battles upon a standard-sized table between rival forces known as Warbands. A Warband represents your own band of warriors – courageous humans, blood-thirsty monsters, legendary heroes, and mythological entities from the depths of the darkest myths.

Mythic Americas: Warlords of Erehwon provides a new multi-level, scenario-driven approach to your games. This approach offers plenty of opportunities to reward tactical play, but at the same time keeps things manageable in terms of the size of forces and space required. The game still uses ten-sided and Order dice, making for a game with mechanical depth and considerable adaptability. The Order dice test system, at the mechanical core of Mythic Americas, and an extremely balanced rules set offers Warband leaders great tactical freedom, but the game still offers lots of opportunity for fate and chance to have a say in the outcome of your battles. But, every experienced general throughout the ages knows that fate and chance will test even the most ingenious battle plan!

This is The Way.

The rulebook contains all the rules you need to get playing, a wealth of scenarios and four full army lists for the Tribal Nations, The Aztecs, The Mayans, and The Incas. It also includes background with tactical tips and painting tips for each of the four warbands.

—description from publisher's website
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation

name: Dragon Dice: Kicker Pack 2 – Firewalkers
description:
Firewalkers- Fury from above! The versatile Firewalkers bring their battlelust to the fray.

From the fiery sun, they have come to join the life-and-death struggle for dominance of a young world. They are the Firewalkers, elemental beings who have mysterious reasons for joining the fray. Can your armies harness the might of the Firewalkers and attain victory? Or will their creatues, such as the mighty Phoenix, destroy your troops itself?
This Kicker Pack contains new dice to flesh out your DRAGON DICE forces, all awesome Firewalkers and Monsters of stunning mottled red and blue.

Includes 1 10-sided monster die and 7 6-sided unit dice (4 small 16mm, 2 medium 18mm, and 1 large 20mm) of the red and blue Firewalkers, plus the original rules folder.
categories: Collectible Components, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Die Icon Resolution

name: Dragon Dice: Coral Elves
description:
Return to the ancient days of creation in Esfah…and find that legends live!

In the beginning, there were the Coral Elves. The power of Water and Air created a race that flourished on the coasts, and produced mages and marksman of great skill. In the battle for control of Esfah, the fleet Coral Elves have proved themselves through the ages. Now available in a kicker pack, the Coral Elves also bring their monstrous allies, including the legendary beast Leviathan, making its first appearance in Dragon Dice™.

Each Coral Elf kicker box contains a random assortment of 7 6-sided dice: 4 small 16mm, 2 medium 18mm, and 1 large 20mm. They also include 1 random 22mm 10-sided monster die and a rules sheet.
categories: Collectible Components, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Die Icon Resolution

name: Dragon Dice: Goblins
description:
Return to the ancient days of creation in Esfah… and find that legends live!

Death put forth his hand again and produced the Goblins to create more chaos on Esfah. This sturdy race of Earth and Death provided the shock troops for many a war in the land. Their power in melee and speed in the swamps enabled the Goblins to overrun many other races in the war for supremacy in Esfah. Now available in a kicker pack, the Goblins also bring their monstrous allies, including the legendary abomination Cannibal, making its first appearance in Dragon Dice™.

Includes 1 10-sided monster die and 7 6-sided unit dice (4 small 16mm, 2 medium 18mm, and 1 large 20mm) of black and gold Goblin, plus rules summary.
categories: Collectible Components, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Die Icon Resolution

name: Dragon Dice: Kicker Pack 3 – Undead
description:
What happens in Esfah when the carnage continues to escalate? Lord Death raises the Undead to step into the battle for supremacy on the Dragon Dice field. Zombies, Skeletons, Vampires, Ghouls, Dracoliches, and other not-quite-dead-yet units await your commands!

The Undead are a powerful species in melee combat, combining strong offensive power with superior toughness. Undead mages come in two kinds, heavy and light magic, and use Black/Death magic to devastating effect with their own set of spells to add to the regular spell book. With their racial abilities, the Undead are hard to kill and harder to keep dead. Unlike the other species in the game, Undead have no missile units, so you’ll want to play to their strengths and crush those pesky archers.

Each Undead kicker box contains a random assortment of 7 6-sided dice: 4 small 16mm, 2 medium 18mm, and 1 large 20mm. The box also includes 1 random 22mm 10-sided monster die and a rules sheet.
categories: Collectible Components, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Die Icon Resolution

name: Dragon Dice: Kicker Pack 4 – The Feral
description:
Feral- Nature raises up the beasts to fight on her behalf! The Feral are a fierce and prolific race.

Includes 1 10-sided Elder (monster) die and 7 6-sided unit dice (4 small 16mm, 2 medium 18mm, and 1 large 20mm) of the blue and gold Feral.
categories: Collectible Components, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Die Icon Resolution

name: Dragon Dice: Kicker Pack 5 – Swamp Stalkers
description:
A new horror arises to challenge the ancient powers in Esfah!

From the fetid swamps of Esfah, the Swamp Stalkers slithered into the battles that raged in the land. Fearsome mutants created by Death from other species, these creatures of Water and Death bring powerful melee troops and the magic of death and decay with them. Jagged swords, hurled forks, and reptilian eyes abound as these foul abominations roam your battlefields. Can you harness the horror of these swamp troops and their allied monsters to roll to victory in Esfah?

Includes 1 10-sided monster die and 7 6-sided unit dice (4 small 16mm, 2 medium 18mm, and 1 large 20mm) of black and green Swamp Stalkers.
categories: Collectible Components, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Die Icon Resolution

name: Dragon Dice: Kicker Pack 7 – Scalders
description:
Once the fire starts, there's no quenching it! Nature stretched out her hand once more, but neither she nor Death could control her newest creations. The forgotten children of Nature. Scalders now bring their desire to set the world aflame to your battlefields. Creatures of fire and water, their flaming clubs, fiery arrows, and steaming charms provide a wild new race to command. Now you can harness the wrath of the Scalders and their allied monsters to scorch your way to victory in Esfab!

Includes 1 10-sided monster die and 7 6-sided unit dice (4 small 16mm, 2 medium 18mm, and 1 large 20mm) of red and green Scalders, plus the updated rules folder.
categories: Collectible Components, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Die Icon Resolution

name: Dragon Dice: Kicker Pack 8 – Treefolk
description:
Treefolk- Nature again strengthens her children with the steady toughness of the Treefolk.

Includes 1 10-sided monster die and 7 6-sided unit dice (4 small 16mm, 2 medium 18mm, and 1 large 20mm) of green and gold Treefolk, plus rules folder.
categories: Collectible Components, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Die Icon Resolution

name: Monopoly: The Goonies
description:
“Never say die!” with MONOPOLY: The Goonies! Go on a quest for One-Eyed Willy’s hidden treasure and buy, sell, and trade locations around Astoria, Oregon in this version based on the classic 80s adventure movie! Play with collectible tokens such as Chester Copperport’s Key, the Gold Doubloon, and other memorable items while you try to be the last player with loot!

Includes:
1 Game Board
6 Collectible Tokens: Little Girl’s Bike, Copper Bones, Gold Doubloon, Statue of David, Willy’s Eye Patch, Skull and Crossed Bones
28 Title Deed Cards
16 Chance Cards renamed HEY YOU GUYS! Cards
16 Community Chest Cards renamed NEVER SAY DIE Cards
Custom Monopoly Money
32 Houses renamed Booby Traps
12 Hotels renamed Treasure Chests
2 Dice
Rules

—description from the publisher's website
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Village War: The Calamity
description:
Village War: The Calamity is a card-drafting, resource management, and spirit war game. The theme and narration is a combination of the history, folklore, myths and our fantasy of the Igbo tribe in Nigeria, Africa.

During game set-up, players each take their own village (including 10 different warriors, 11 resources which are selected randomly, 3 artifacts, and their wall). Warriors are different, and some of them possess unique powers to form combos during the war! And the artifacts are gifts from the gods with fierce powers. As players, you also have the chance to buy new artifacts during gameplay. Your aim is to win the battle and earn more resources as tributes paid from other players. The player with the most VPs — a sum of tributes collected and warrior power rank — wins.

Village War: The Calamity is the first of a five-game series that exposes the Igbo culture more than any other game in history. The game story (12 pages) narrates the inspirations behind the artwork and the story, and the game features masquerades, Priest(ess), and other creatures with Igbo origin in mind. The pulisher also had a live studio record for the game to create the right melody creating a 65-minutes "Igbo War music" instrumental for that extra experience.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Drafting, Hidden Roles, Open Drafting, Player Elimination, Victory Points as a Resource

name: Warfighter Shadow War: Expansion #57 – General Soleimani
description:
Target: Soleimani

Qasem Soleimani was a general in Iran's Revolutionary Guard Corps, and the commander of the elite Quds Force, a unit responsible for international covert ops. Due to his terrorist activities, Soleimani was sanctioned by the United Nations and European Union, and designated a terrorist by the United States. Under Soleimani's command, the Quds Force was responsible for killing hundres of US service members with IED attacks and ambushes.
You now have the mission to take out this clear and present danger to US forces in the region. This expansion provides you with several mission profiles to choose from to accomplish this vital mission. Good hunting!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling

name: Dragon's Bane
description:
As a famed mercenary seeking to establish your medieval empire, the prophecy has been commoner's talk for a while now: “Of dragon scales gather up 10, and so become the ruler of men!” But your arrival in the desolate lands has presented two hardships. Firstly, dragons don’t give up their scales willingly. And second, you’re not the only one who’s heard the prophecy.

Game play begins with card drafting as players create a unique hand to battle dragons and each other. Play continues in a series of rounds until 1 player wins by ending a round with 10 dragon scales or being the only player with at least 1 health token remaining.

Dragon scales are gained by contributing strength to defeat a dragon, looting from the dragon, or stealing from other players (if you kill another player you gain all of their dragon scales).

Each round has 3 phases.
Phase 1: (every round)
Players simultaneously play cards from their hand face-down. All cards are then revealed and resolved in a predetermined hierarchy (cards of the same hierarchy resolve clockwise from the dragon).
Phase 2: (triggered only by specific phase 1 cards)
A repeat of phase 1, however only players who have used specific cards during phase 1 can participate.
Phase 3: (every round)
Dragon combat and loot distribution. Players combine their strength in an attempt to defeat the dragon. The dragon player draws the top 3 cards from the dragon deck selecting one to play against all other players. The dragon card increases or decreases the dragon's base strength, often adding targeted abilities*. If the dragon is defeated, all contributing players take dragon scales. If undefeated, all players take 1 damage from the dragon. Looters acquire loot (dragon scales or items) from the dragon irrespective of the outcome.

All non-core cards are discarded before and he role of dragon then shifts one player to the left (their mercenary becomes untargetable for the following round). A new round will then begin, rounds continue in this manner until a winner is determined.


In a round with 2 or 3 players, the dragon becomes automated. In this case the top card of the dragon deck is chosen and targeted abilities affect all players.


Unique game elements include a mix of card-drafting, simultaneous-play, semi-cooperative and competitive tactics, and playing as both the dragon and dragon attacker (in different rounds).

—description from the designer
mechanics: Open Drafting, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Victory at Sea: Kriegsmarine U-Boats & MTB sections
description:
Submarines: A long-ranged submersible, the Type IX was the most successful U-boat of the war, with each vessel averaging over 100,000 tons of shipping sunk. One Type IX, U-107, made the most successful convoy mission of the war, with nearly 100,000 tons of shipping sunk out of Freetown in Africa. The latest variants of this design were capable of ranges of more than 23,000 miles, allowing them to rove far in search of convoys, while their heavy load of torpedoes allowed them to keep pace with a convoy, attacking night after night.

MTBs: The R1-class of R-Boat (from the German Räumboot, meaning minesweeper) was intended to be used as a shallow water minesweeper but, as the war went on, it became a multi-role craft. Its duties expanded to include patrol, antisubmarine, convoy escort, minelaying, and rescue operations. Some classes of R-Boat, such as the R310, were fitted with torpedo tubes, though performance was very modest compared to craft specifically designed for the role.

The ultimate S-Boat to be operational in significant numbers was the S-100-class, which was produced from 1943 and was said to be the best fast patrol boat of its time. The S-100-class was nicknamed the Calotte, as it featured a rounded armoured bridge. It was powered by three Daimler-Benz engines giving it an overall capacity of around 7,500 hp and developing an outstanding top speed of 48 knots.

Contents:
3 Type IX U-Boats
2 S-100 S-Boat Sections
2 R-Boat Sections
Ship Cards

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Nautical, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Simulation

name: Stalemate!
description:
Inspired by Palm Island, Stalemate is a hand held, solo game where you take the role of the British moving through the trenches in WW1 trying to get victory over the Germans. As the game progress, you will have to fight several skirmishes in order to gain ground and build your army. Will you have a big enough army to defeat the Germans in the battle?

Stalemate is played in eight rounds. Each turn you will choose one of two cards. You will then choose whether to store or rotate a card. When you build your army and gain supplies, you will increase your chances in fighting the next skirmish and ultimately winning the battle.

There are four additional cards that you can add difficulty to the game. Also, there are four variants you play without any additional cards.
mechanics: Hand Management, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Star Fleet Battles: Federation Master Starship Book
description:
Dad, what kind of starship is that?
Let’s get you the Federation Master Starship Book so you can look it up!

The first volume in the long-anticipated Master Starship Book series. It includes every Federation ship in Star Fleet Battles, including X-ships, Y-ships, and R1 units that are specific to the Federation. Every ship is illustrated. All updates, corrections, and errata have been added. The ships are in order (regardless of the product they came from) with the enhanced format listing detailed information in a consistent manner.

This book contains the descriptions of the ships, but no SSDs.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid

name: World War III: Team Yankee – Soviet Starter Force: T-80 Shock Tank Company
description:
The Soviet Union’s most powerful forces are stationed in East Germany and Czechoslovakia, poised on the border with West Germany ready to strike at a moment’s notice.
They are equipped with the very best Soviet industry has to offer, from sophisticated missile firing T-80 and T-64 tanks, powerful T-72 tanks, and tough, reliable, and upgraded T-62M and T-55AM tanks to versatile BMP infantry fighting vehicles, as well as plentiful BTR-60 armoured personnel carriers.
Supported by elite Afgansty Air Assault troops, powerful self-propelled artillery there will be little that the corrupt capitalist armies of NATO can do to stop them.
Soon the western workers will be free and the dawn of a new socialist age will begin!

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Modern Warfare, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Simulation

name: Clash of Deck N°2
description:
Clash of Deck is an evolving do-it-yourself card game. This is the first expansion of the game. Each month, a new standalone expansion of the game is released, which allows you to create new decks and thus increase the replayability of the game.

In Clash of Deck, you play as a Sorcerer Lord whose objective is to take control of the safest islands of the Erret Archipelago. To do this you will have to fight other Witchlords.

This expansion is made up of 16 new cards as well as 2 new visuals of Bridge cards. New types of cards are appearing: Spells that have immediate effects and Buildings that remain in play. You will also be able to discover 6 new special abilities that will add even more combos and depth to your games: Evasion, Defender, Untouchable, Gust, Focus and Demolitionist.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Open Drafting

name: Partisans
description:
IntroductionPartisans is a drawless game for two players: White and Black. It is played on the spaces (squares) of a 10x10 square board. At the start of the game, white partisans are placed on the a4, g1, d10 and j7 squares, and black partisans are placed on a7, g10, d1 and j4. Additionally, each player must have access to a sufficient number of stones of their own color outside the board.



PlayWhite plays first, then turns alternate. On your turn, move a partisan of your color to an empty square in a straight orthogonal or diagonal line, without jumping over enemy pieces.

Then, place a stone on an empty square that is a straight orthogonal or diagonal line away from the square onto which the partisan was moved, with no enemy pieces in between along that line. This is called shooting.

Note that partisans can move and shoot over friendly partisans and stones as well as over empty squares.

To compensate for the advantage of moving first, White is not allowed to shoot on their first turn, but they must still move a partisan.

If you have no moves available on your turn, you lose.



NotesPartisans is based on Amazons, a game designed by Walter Zamkauskas in 1992.
mechanics: Pattern Recognition, Point to Point Movement, Square Grid, Tile Placement

name: Clash of Deck N°3
description:
Clash of Deck is an evolving do-it-yourself card game. This is the second expansion of the game. Each month, a new expansion is released, which allows you to create new decks and thus increase the replayability of the game.

In Clash of Deck, you play as a Sorcerer Lord whose objective is to take control of the safest islands of the Erret Archipelago. To do this you will have to fight other Witchlords.

This expansion is made up of 16 new cards as well as 2 new visuals of Bridge cards. A new game mechanic makes its appearance: the cards which rotate on themselves. You will also be able to discover three new special abilities that will add even more combos and depth to your games: Revive, Second Wind and Leap!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Open Drafting

name: Frostgrave: Second Edition – The Red King
description:
Fires rage throughout the Frozen City as an inhuman army pours out of the cracks between realities. In the distant past, a cabal of city elders sought to save their lives by making a pact with a demon prince...and now the Red King has come to collect what he is owed, claiming Frostgrave as his own. Many have already fled before the Red King's demonic hordes, while others seek to weather the storm, turning their bases into makeshift fortresses. The wizards of Frostgrave must choose: Do they stand and fight, or do they abandon this great repository of mystical knowledge to the ravages of unearthly fire?

Frostgrave: The Red King is the first supplement designed for Frostgrave: Second Edition. In this sprawling, epic campaign, wizards will be pushed to their limits, fighting not only against one another and the perils of the Frozen City, but also against an invading army. As the Red King's power grows, the laws of magic and nature will start to bend. Can the wizards put aside their differences long enough to oppose this common foe, or will greed and mistrust doom them all?
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Role Playing, Variable Player Powers

name: Oh My Gourd!
description:
Grow a giant gourd with the help of your gardening tools and a Lucky Ladybug, but watch out! Clever critters, mean Mr. Frost, and big bad weeds will keep your gourd from growing. Protect your garden from unwanted guests and give it everything a growing gourd needs to win!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Fury Hardball: Expansion 1
description:
More teams, more matchups, more action! Expand your Fury Hardball league with 18 additional teams.

Teams included in this bundle:

Pittsburgh

St. Louis

Philadelphia

Chicago (Blue)

Chicago (Gray)

Oakland

Baltimore

Detroit

Cleveland

Washington

Atlanta

Cincinnati

Auckland

Johannesburg

Colombo

Dakar

Karachi

Sydney
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Simulation, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Fury Football: International Expansion
description:
Enjoy the Fury Football International experience with 8 new teams.

Teams included in this bundle:

Munich Boot

Barcelona Tantrum

Paris Wraiths

Toronto Raid

London Scufflers

Beijing Neo Ninjas

Sydney Gargantuans

Tokyo Unit
mechanics: Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Clay Crusher
description:
The board game that requires creativity, strategy and a little back stabbing. Make your finest sculpture in a short amount of time and try to avoid your friends crushing your creations, and your dreams.

The basic premise is each round there is a new judge. The judge selects an idea card for the players to create during the round. A time limit is selected and the players frantically sculpt. The judge rank the sculptures on the table and the players will move accordingly. 1st place moves forward 3 spaces, 2nd place moves two spaces, 3rd place moves 3 spaces, and the rest don’t move at all.

Along the way you will encounter rule squares, penalty squares and star squares, if you land on one of them, pick up a card with the corresponding symbol. Penalty squares make you sculpt with one hand or move back a space, stuff like that. Star squares typically give players the best card in the game, a Clay Crusher card. This means at the end of any future round the player can use their Clay Crusher card to smash another player's creation before the judge sees it. First one around the board wins!

-description from publisher
mechanics: Bias, Deduction, Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Player Judge, Take That, Voting

name: Paupers' Ladder: The Bodachs of Brighthelm
description:
As the moon rises they crawl from their dark, mouldering lairs. These night horrors that scare Brighthelm’s children from sleep. These mysterious, mischievous and downright malevolent bogeymen are using Garolium’s tournament as the perfect foil for a power grab. The question is, which of these quarreling bodachs will climb to the top of their festering pile?

The Bodachs of Brighthelm is a little Halloween-themed expansion for Paupers' Ladder. It adds 4 characters to play in the place of Paupers. The Bodachs, who can enslave creatures to become their familiars and trick or treat opposing players in their quest for power.

Also available as a print and play PDF, this physical version is limited to 100 copies.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Fighting, Horror
mechanics: Area Movement, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Open Drafting, Pick-up and Deliver, Set Collection

name: Keresis: Quest for the Elements
description:
Keresis is a strategic game: A mix of exploration, territory control and resource management. Each player takes the lead of an ancestral tribe and faces his opponents to become the master of the four elements.

The chaotic world of Keresis is about to collapse. To save your tribe, you must find a way to reach the lost shrines. As an explorer, you have a special ability and can unlock new powers later during the game. A shaman and some of your fierce warriors will join you in this unique adventure! Dangerous events may occur at any time during your expedition: Will you play it safe by following well known paths or will you put yourself in danger by exploring uncharted territories? The decision is yours!

Each player takes a turn to play and execute some of the following actions:
Explore
Collect movement points and explore the map / Lay hex tiles and connect them to create paths to follow.

Gather/trade resources
Collect and use the available resources at your disposal: Energy, element stones and powerful action cards.

Control territories / Battle
Use element stones to deploy some of your warriors or expand your domination by invading enemies territories.

Summon your shaman
Protect your territories, rotate them or unleash the mysterious powers contained in the shrines.

Place your amulets
Each amulet placed on a shrine will bring you one step closer to victory! But it won’t be easy: Each territory is only associated with one shrine. Controlling the right kind of territory is key for placing your amulets!

Will be declared winner the first player to place an amulet on each of the four shrines OR the player with the highest score at the end of twenty-four rounds.

UNIQUE GAME FEATURES:
- 2 difficulty levels: Start as a disciple and become a tribe leader! The adaptable rules set offers a challenging and unique game experience for beginners and experienced players.
- Play in team 2 vs 2 with 4 players (Alliance & Betrayal mode).
- 2 modular board games and 60 unique hex tiles offer near infinite map layouts: You will need to use a different strategy and adapt it each game.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Alliances, Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Roll / Spin and Move, Take That, Tile Placement, Variable Player Powers, Worker Placement

name: Chat pardeurs
description:
Chat pardeur is a tactical and lucky microgame for 2 players facing each other during 5-minute games and can be played from 5 years old.

Fear has seized San Franciscat. Food factories are the target of recurrent robberies. But have no fear, Supercat is determined to bring the thieves to justice.
If you are the Kitthief, you have to steal 5 foods of the same type to win. If you are supercat, you must stop the Kitthief by knocking him out.

The kitthief secretly chooses a food on the food card by placing his token on it. Supercat has to guess which food is selected.
If supercat has made a mistake, the kitthief raises the token corresponding to the food on the card.
If supercat has found it, he rolls the dice and try to hit the kitthief.

-description from designer
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Dice Rolling

name: Pirates of the Dread Sea
description:
Pirates of the Dread Sea is a fast paced, fun tabletop skirmish game for two or more players. In Pirates of the Dread Sea you create a crew of pirates from various fantasy races (or just use the pre-designed crews) such as Orcs, Dwarves, the Undead or Humans and fight for treasure and survival. Although PODS can be enjoyed as a single game, and can easily be taught to new players for an evenings entertainment, it can also support long campaigns, during which players can personalise and upgrade their crews.

Games of PODS are based on a Scenario. Scenario’s usually involve finding treasure, though sometimes they may involve capturing or rescuing hostages, or simply fighting. Each player controls a small Crew of miniatures (around half a dozen) and players take it in turns to act with one miniature at a time. During a miniatures “phase” they can perform two Actions (Captain’s can perform three) such as moving, shooting and fighting hand to hand.

In addition to a huge variety of weapons, skills and traits which can be applied to characters dependent on their race and experience, Event Cards add another level of tactics to the game. An Event Card can throw your opponent entirely off track, or boost your own forces, whether that be by ensuing the enemy miss a shot, or by boosting your crews morale by singing a shanty to them!

Pirates of the Dread Sea is a PIRATE war game, not just a war game with a pirate theme tacked on. Everything about the game has been designed to fit the setting, and create fun, narrative, exciting adventures on your tabletop.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement

name: Neighborhood Conflict
description:
Neighborhood Conflict is based on the creator's childhood where the local kids formed their own governments and economies. Construction, share trading, real estate, currency manipulation, diplomacy, theft and combat are all optional strategic tools for getting ahead in Neighborhood Conflict.

Players play as a kid and interact with other kids that have different social and economic skills, and try to manipulate them into assisting their own ascension to the top. Kids use "actions" to either attempt to socially alter the opinions and behavior of other kids or to manage and improve their own financial situation. The goal of the game is to acquire as much wealth as possible before time is up.

—description from the designer

Neighborhood Conflict was modeled after the LARP MicroCiv.

NOTE:

Not to be confused with first edition of Tactical Friction, which was also named Neighborhood Conflict, but got renamed to Tactical Friction in 2008.
Not to be confused with first edition of Micronations, which was also named Neighborhood Conflict in years 2011–2013.
mechanics: Investment, Simulation, Stock Holding

name: A Song of Ice & Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game – Baratheon Wardens
description:
House Baratheon’s battle doctrine is fairly simple: be strong like iron. They outfit their troops in heavy armor at every level and arm them with the House’s signature warhammer. While this heavy kit does slow down troop movements, the tenacity of their defenses can usually see them through. The Baratheon Wardens are the main infantry unit that the House uses, fielding many ranks of these rough and rugged fighters.

The Baratheon Wardens unit box for the A Song of Ice and Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game gives House Baratheon commanders a tough, resilient set of troops for their forces. Clad in plate mail and carrying heavy shields, they have a good Defense Save stat, though all of that does slow them down. Their heavy warhammer attacks can crush the enemy’s spirit as much as it can crush their bones. Defending against these pounding attacks can leave enemy troops gasping for air as the strength is sucked from them.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Novel-based, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Moving Multiple Units
publishers: CMON Global Limited, Dark Sword Miniatures, Inc., Edge Entertainment

name: Warhammer Age of Sigmar: Warcry – Skaven
description:
Cunning and malevolent, the skaven seek to spread ruin and corruption wherever they go. This insidious race of vermin-men worships the foul god known as the Great Horned Rat, and their plots and schemes are truly diabolical in their complexity.

Kill-steal in Warcry yes-yes! Ahem. If you’re looking to start a Skaven warband for skirmish battles (or expand one!), this set is for you, giving you everything you need for a diverse warband of ratmen. It also contains a number of accessories to help you in your games. What’s more, you’ll save money compared to getting the models inside separately!

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Joking Hazard: PAX 2019 Exclusive card
description: A single promo card distributed at PAX East 2019 which reads, "We'll see what the rulebook says about this!"
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Combat HQ: 2nd Edition
description:
Combat HQ 2nd Edition presents fun, streamlined rules designed for large-scale world war two battles featuring rapid movement, decisive combat, and exciting decision making.

The new edition includes rules for close support units, a faster close assault system, extended artillery rules, and more opportunities to wage war on the battlefield.

Rapid Command Pulses and opposed dice rolls keep players constantly involved.
Easy-to-play rules emphasize command-and-control decisions over complex combat resolution mechanics.

In each Command Pulse you decide how to use your limited command resources:

will you use your Command Dice to move up a company of infantry supported by tanks?
Or will you use them to rally an anti-tank gun battery?
Or maybe you should use them to liaise with your staff officers?


The choice is yours.

'Unit Scale: The Platoon is the basic unit in the game and is represented by a model vehicle.

Ground Scale: 1” equals 50 yards.

Figure Scale: Plays equally well with 2mm, 6mm, 10mm, 15mm and 20mm figures. 28mm figures are possible, but a large table is required.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Simulation

name: Black Hell: The Battle for Los Negros Island, February-March, 1944
description:
“The island is lousy with Nips” –February 27th Message from the US Alamo Scouts to General Walter Krueger that more Japanese were on Los Negros island than reported.

Before fleeing Corregidor, General Douglas MacArthur pledged to return to the Philippines. It was first necessary to retake New Guinea and at least neutralize the Japanese fortified base at Rabaul. Taking the island of Los Negros and its airbase at Momote would cut off Rabaul’s ability to received supplies from Japan or elsewhere, and allow the US-led forces to advance for an offensive to retake the Philippines. US Intelligence thought the island was only held by a small Japanese garrison made up mostly of ground crewmen and laborers. Instead, the island was held by a Japanese army garrison composed of many veteran troops whose numbers nearly exceeded those of the US force tasked with taking the island. What ensued was a protracted and violent fight. Perhaps you can do as well or better?

Each copy of Black Hell is composed of the following:

• Two 11 by 17 inch map sheets
• 110 double-sided un-mounted counters
• 7 pages of charts and tables
• 9 pages of rules

Players will also need a standard deck of cards and one D6, one ten sided die (D10, treat a die roll of 0 as ten and not zero), to play the game. Units are mostly companies, a turn represents 1 day of time, and a map hex is one third of a mile across.

-description from designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Open Drafting, Simulation

name: Carnival Zoo
description:
Dressing a hippopotamus or a rhino for the Grand Ball of animals is not easy, especially if you want to be the first to do so.

A fun game teaching to think, recognize shapes, and appreciate the beauty of colors.

Use the spinning wheel to find out the color of the square you're moving to. Pick up the shape you see in that square, and put it on your animal to dress it.

The first to dress completely his animal, wins.

translated from the Italian box cover
categories: Abstract Strategy, Animals, Children's Game, Educational
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Tile Placement

name: Great Rolled Ones
description:
"You and the other players are cultists attempting to summon Cthulhu and bring about the end of the world. YOu must successfully perform 50 arcane rituals, but be careful: misspeak the the strange incantations and you will suffer Cthulu's wrath!"

This is a push your luck game of dice rolling to complete rituals. Completed rituals within a run score you points, provided that you don't accumulate three 1's causing you to go insane and score nothing for the run.

You'll need paper and pencil to keep track of the score.

-description from the book, Random Fun Generator
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck

name: Shadows of Brimstone: Cartwright's Trusty Pistol
description:
Available from the promotional box of goodies made for sale during the virtual DiceFest held in 2020.

Cartwright's Trusty Pistol - Mine Legendary Artifact (First legendary artifact) - Promo 337

Shots are equal to the hero's lore ability.
While you have 1 hand open, use the d8 for damage.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Lair
description: Nightingale Lane is set off the main road and difficult to see from the highway. In other words, it's a perfect spot for secrets. When a courier for Coyote Parcel Service needs a signature for the envelope he is supposed to deliver to 148 Nightingale Lane, he peeks through the window in hopes of getting the owner's attention. What he sees is a room covered in blood-soaked plastic. Could there be a logical explanation for such a sinister sight? Is it possible that this isn't what it looks like? Or has he stumbled upon the lair of a madman who has managed to keep to the shadows and out of the public eye? Explore the house on Nightingale Lane and find out what's really been going on there.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deduction, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: E.S.P.C: Extra Sensory Perception Combat
description:
Enter into the world of Psychic Warfare. To survive on this battlefield, you will need to see the future, read your opponent's mind while obscuring your own thoughts, move in for the kill when they least expect it, and, most importantly, survive by any means necessary.

ESPC is a fast-paced game where you try to be the last player standing. A round should take about 5 minutes or less. The last player left alive gets a victory point. Cards in the game represent Psychic Powers. Each turn a player draws a card and declares what power they are going to use. At this point, any player may challenge the use of this power. If the player claiming to play the power doesn't have that card in hand, they are out for the round, but if the player has the card, the challenger is out. At this point, the player uses their power card and discards face up. This continues until only one player is left, and points are awarded. Then the deck is reshuffled and the next round begins. The game is played until one player reaches the target number of victory points to win.

Each time the game is played, only a subset of powers are used. The number of powers in a game is based on the number of players, and there are rules governing how powers are selected. This leads to a unique experience each time the game is played. For a 4 player game there are 4,000+ different power combinations.

-description from designer
mechanics: Hand Management, Hidden Roles, Memory, Player Elimination, Score-and-Reset Game, Victory Points as a Resource

name: Exploit Zero: Hostile Takeover
description:
Exploit Zero: HOSTILE TAKEOVER

Corporate War - Coming Soon to a Sprawl near you!

The latest Exploit Zero rule book, Hostile Takeover shifts the game away from cooperative or solo mode and lets players command their own security force in a head-to-head corporate war.

Now your elite Agents join small, multi-model tactical units: fire teams of troopers, pods of gun drones, individual specialists, and customized heavy support units. These combined forces will form the assault teams you deploy all across the urban sprawl as you plan, maneuver, and fight to take control of your rival’s corporate headquarters.

An easy to learn, fast play, open miniature table top war game for 15-28mm miniatures set in a gritty cyberpunk future.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game
